loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Doña Teresa tiene 54 años de edad en el barrio 3-80, es casada, su esposo es taxista y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya son independientes a ella.  Doña Teresa se dedica a la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos, tiene 22 años de experiencia en el negocio, empezó vendiendo tortillas y después de algún tiempo pudo invertir en una cocina más grande para también vender frijoles. Teresa cree que es momento de hacerles mejoras a su casa, es por eso que el crédito solicitado será usado en la construcción de un muro para darle seguridad a su vivienda, espera poder seguir haciendo préstamos para terminar de construir su vivienda
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is 54-years old and lives in the 3-80 borough. She is married and her spouse is a taxi driver, she supports him with household expenses. All their children are older and are not dependent on her anymore. Mrs. Teresa is dedicated to selling tortillas and baked beans. She has 22-years of experience in this line of work and started out selling tortillas, though after some time she was able to invest in a bigger kitchen to also provide baked beans. Mrs. Teresa thinks this is the time to do bigger things to her house and with this loan she wishes to construct a proper wall to provide security for her home. She hopes to continue making loans until the construction on her home is complete.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Construct a Wall for Security.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en:
Mrs. Reth B., 43, is a rice farmer in Snampras Commune in Pursat Province. Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Choun, 44, has been a construction worker for the past six years. He also works with his wife.

Reth has been farming since early 2007. She has requested a loan to purchase oxen to help with her farm work. This will help her increase her income as well as provide her with a new fixed asset.

loans.use: To purchase oxen

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan I. owns a video rental shop. She sells and rent video CDs. She is 39 years old and married with two children. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more video CDs for sale. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more Video CDs to sell

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina T., 40, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the villagers and general public 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (~229 USD).  SPBD loans are Avelina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. As her business is going well, her requested loan will be used for upgrading the condition of her house.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement, iron roofing, nails, and timber

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Esther es viuda, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Esther tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende especerías, verduras picadas que ella misma prepara desde muy temprano, también vende verduras. 
Esther necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de comino, ajo, hongos.
Los sueños de Esther son que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio surja mas.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Lila Municipal Bank. Esther is widowed, 48 years old, and has two children. Esther has a stand in the 12 de abril market where she sells spices, chopped vegetables that she herself prepares very early, and also vegetables. Esther needs a loan of 400 soles ($125 USD) that will be invested in purchasing cumin, garlic, and mushrooms. Esther's dreams are that her children be professionals and that her business be further developed.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cumin, garlic, and mushrooms.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 49 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y su nieta en su casa propia. DesD. hace un año se dedica a la venta D. comida, atienD. todos los días por la mañana en un espacio fuera D. su casa que acondicionó para su negocio, su trato cálido y amable siempre atrae nuevos clientes. Teofila se levanta D. madrugada para preparar sus platos y por las tardes se dedica a la limpieza D. los cubiertos y D. todos los utensilios, además realiza las compras para el día siguiente. Teofila quiere seguir creciendo con este negocio, para ello quiere mejorar el aspecto físico D. su espacio y tener platos y cubiertos nuevos. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene grandes expectativas D. impulsar entre los demás integrantes D. su banco comunal un trabajo solidario para que todo el grupo crezca equitativamente. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra D. una carpa granD. para protegerse D. la lluvia y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Teofila is 55 years old, lives with her husband and her granddaughter in her own home. For a year, she has sold food daily in the mornings in an area outsiD. of her house that she has modified for her business. Her warm and friendly market stall always attracts new clients. Teofila rises at dawn to prepare her dishes and in the afternoon she cleans cutlery and utensils and makes purchases for the following day. Teofila wants to continue growing this business and wants to improve the physical appearance of her space and purchase new plates and cutlery. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She has high expectations of driving the rest of the members in her community bank through common work so that the entire group will grow equally. With the money she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of a large tent to protect her from the rain and offer her customers greater convenience.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a tent for protection against the rain

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
E. Fatima est âgée de 21 ans et est originaire de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Fatima est mariée à MOUTAIROU Youssouf, coiffeur de profession. Fatima est mère d’une fille de quatre (4) ans qui est en première année du cours primaire. Le couple vit en location à Minontchou un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Fatima vendait des slips et soutiens gorge au marché international de Cotonou. L'activité de Fatima  a péri dans l’incendie qui s’est produite dans le marché en 2005. Actuellement Fatima vend des pâtes dentifrices et des brosses à dents. Fatima achète des cartons de pâtes dentifrices au NIGERIA un pays frontalier du Bénin. Fatima vend ses produits aux revendeurs ambulants. Fatima sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé pour accroître son capital afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.   

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Fatima E., 21, comes from Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Fatima is married to Youssouf Moutairou, who is a barber. She is the mother of a daughter aged 4, who is in the first class of primary school. The couple rents an apartment in Minontchou, an outlying district of Coutonou, economic capital of Benin.

Fatima used to sell underwear and bras at the international market of Cotonou. Her business was destroyed in the fire that burned the market in 2005. Presently, Fatima sells toothpaste and toothbrushes. She buys cases of toothpaste in Nigeria, a country which borders Benin. Fatima sells her products to traveling salespeople. She is requesting a loan from ALIDé to increase her working capital so as to better satisfy the demand of her clientele. The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cases of toothpaste and toothbrushes

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en: Valelia E., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 2 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $116).  SPBD loans are Valelia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for maintaining the business. She is new and she needs some funding to maintain her business.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Idrissou Papa

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est célibataire, pour subvenir à ses besoins il a appris la cordonnerie, après son apprentissage il a eu la brillante idée de fabriquer des chaussures de différents modèles et de les vendre à ses clients. Cela marche bien pour lui et il réalise de  bonnes recettes sur ses ventes. La demande de ses clients est élevée, pour y faire face il a besoin d’acheter les matières nécessaires à la fabrication de chaussures de même que des outils de travail, raison pour laquelle il s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter son premier crédit.
texts.en:
This young man is unmarried. To support himself, he learned to be a shoemaker. After his apprenticeship, he had the awesome idea to make shoes in different models and to sell them to customers. This is going well for him, and he’s earning good revenues on his sales. Customer demand is high. To cope with it, he needs to buy the supplies necessary for making shoes, as well as to buy work tools. These are the reasons behind his inquiry with WAGES for requesting his first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work supplies and the equipment necessary for the business of shoe-making

loans.name: Dominga Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Fortunata es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Fortunata tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses, sus ventas están mejorando.
Fortunata necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
Los sueños de Fortunata son comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo y educar a su ultimo hijo.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the communal bank "Rosas" (Roses). She lives with her husband, is 44, and has 2 children. Fortunata has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and fruits. She has done this for 6 months, ane her sales are improving. Fortunata needs a loan of 2,500 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and beverages. Fortunata's dreams are to buy a car so her husband can work and to educate her youngest son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and beverages

loans.name: Abibata

texts.en:
Abibata S. is 40 years old. She is married and has six children—one daughter and five sons. Some are currently in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Abibata is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge. She sells the porridge by the roadside in the mornings. Abibata wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a tailor who specializes in uniforms, petticoats, and pants - especially for children. She runs her business, Beatrice Fashion, in the Kibuye Market of Kisumu, Kenya. She graduated from her 2-year training course in 1997 and has been working at her trade ever since.

At times, Beatrice experiences cash-flow problems, but knows that she can rely on a steady stream of business from her regular customers. At times, she has so much business that she has to hire a helper to work on her extra sewing machine. With the proceeds from her loan, she would like to differentiate her business by purchasing a variety of fabrics from Uganda and Nairobi.

Beatrice is a married mother of three boys, aged 11, 8, and 5. Paying for their school fees and feeding the family is difficult at times, but her income from the business combined with her husband’s income from mechanic’s work helps them to provide for their boys.

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. For more information about K-MET, please use the following link: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics and supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth L. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through vocational school. Ruth has a small store where she sells clothes in Abura. She also keeps some in a big bowl and moves from customer to customer to sell, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a trader. Ruth uses her income to pay for house-keeping. Ruth will use the loan to purchase more of the goods for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ruth plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Nuestras socias, pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”, ellas son naturales de la comunidad y distrito de  rinconada Andahuaylillas ubicado en la provincia de Quispicanchis, del departamento de Cusco. 

Nuestras socias tienen entre sus actividades del hogar la crianza de gallinas al por mayor, de cuyes al por mayor, cerdos, también se dedican a la agricultura sembrando y cosechado (maíz, papa, habas); otras socias trabajan en comercio minorista, en el mercado vendiendo comidas, en panaderías, en trasporte, y la socia Justina tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que es precisamente, en esta que se tuvo la última reunión; las socias requieren el préstamo en razón a invertir en sus diferentes actividades y producir mas.  

Nuestras socias agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado, para poder reinvertir y generar mayor ganancia económica, ellas se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada”. They are native to the community and to the district of Rinconada Andahuaylillas, which is located in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

The members are engaged in business activities which include raising animals for wholesale such as poultry, guinea pigs, and swine. They also cultivate and harvest crops such as corn, potatoes, and beans. Other members have retail businesses, sell food in the market, own bakeries, offer transportation services, etc. Justina is a member who sells groceries, just as she had since the last meeting. All of the members plan to invest their loans into their various business activities so that they can increase their production.

The members appreciate and value the loans they have received so that they can reinvest and generate more revenue. They promise to complete repayment of this debt.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinvest into their various businesses

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception N. is from the town of Tukuran. She is 45 years old. Conception is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Conception owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Conception has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 11,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Conception joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conception has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Conception is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Conception from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rodrigo A

texts.en:
Rodrigo A. M. is from the village of Mayor's Village, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old. Rodrigo is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Rodrigo owns & operates a tricycle transport service. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rodrigo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rodrigo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Dédé Egalessi

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame a appris la coiffure ; en 2007, elle a ouvert dans le quartier de Kodjoviakopé à Lomé son atelier de coiffure. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge ; mais cette activité lui permet de se prendre à charge et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle dispose de nombreuses clientes dans le quartier ; mais également des femmes viennent des coins environnant pour se soigner leurs cheveux chez elle à cause de sa maîtrise du métier. Elle en profite également pour vendre des mèches et tissages et d’autres produits cosmétiques. En ce moment elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 mèches Nina, 50 mèches Curly, des produits cosmétiques et tissages de différentes couleurs et bien d’autres produits indispensables.

loans.use: Achat de mèches, tissages et produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem T. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in the Takeo province. She is able to make about US$3 each day as a garment factory worker. Her husband is a worker in printing shop. He typically makes US$3 every day as well. Hem T. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 her husband needs to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ramira

texts.en:
Ramira J. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ.. She is 48 years old. Ramira is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Ramira owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Ramira has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ramira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Ramira is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Ramira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros T., a 45-year-old mother of five children who go to school or work, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, soft drinks, and gasoline. Ros retails her inventory to both passers-by and her neighbors.  She has been running the enterprise for a long time and earns an average of $5 a day. To ensures that the entire family has financial stability, her husband works hard in construction.  Ros T. is requesting her loan to increase her inventory and to buy an old motorbike for touring purposes.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and to buy an old motorbike for touring purposes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
With a passion for arts is our featured entrepreneur, Mrs. Jocelyn D.. She is 36 years of age, is married and is a resident of P1 Garang, Tangub City. Her husband, Bienvinido D., is the one who makes the designs and carves every furniture product they make. Jocelyn assists her husband in polishing and doing some varnish spraying work.

They started this business ten years ago and now they are earning an average net income of not less than Php 10,000 from the sales of their finished products.

Jocelyn joined Paglaum MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and for being awarded “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

Jocelyn is given the privilege of obtaining a loan of Php 15,000 with the purpose of purchasing furniture materials and accessories. The future income from this loan will be used for supporting their basic needs and to save for the future for her two minor dependent children.

loans.use: To purchase furniture materials and accessories

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard tiene 30 años, es padre de 2 hijos que son estudiantes; vive junto a su pareja, su madre y sus dos hermanos mayores. La casa donde viven es de su madre.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, Richard empezó como chofer y ahora ya es propietario de un motocarro. Adicionalmente, tiene una tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, yuca, plátano y otros productos. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacerlo bien, sobre todo dar un buen trato a sus clientes, y como le va muy bien, se siente feliz y con ánimo de seguir progresando.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es tener como compañeros a personas responsables y muy comunicativas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos y otros elementos para mandar a reparar su motocarro y trabajar tranquilamente, ya que también lo usa como movilidad para transportar los productos desde su chacra.
texts.en:
Richard is 30 years old, a father of two sons who are students. He lives with his partner, his mother and his two older brothers. The house where they live is owned by his mother. For eight years he has been working in passenger transport. Richard started as a chauffeur and now has his own motorized rickshaw. Furthermore, he has some land where he grows corn, yucca, banana, and other products. What he likes most about his work is to do it well, and above all to treat his customers rightly. Since he does well, he is very happy and with energy to keep improving his life. This is his first MFP loan and what he likes the most about his communal bank is to have as partners very responsible and communicative people. With the money he is asking for he will buy spare parts and other elements to repair his rickshaw and to work without worries, since he also uses it to move around the produce from his small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his rickshaw

loans.name: Carmelita's Group

texts.en:
Carmelita V. is from the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Carmelita is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by the Kiva field partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carmelita is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling fruits and vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for hog raising purposes as her additional business. She plans to buy hogs and feeds. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for additional business which is hog raising

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana G., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Joseph Hipolito, a taxi driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling ice cream and other snacks as her business.

Ana has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy more stock of ice cream and assorted snacks for her store. Her business earns a profit of PHP 5,200 per month.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business to buy more flavors of ice cream and snacks for her store.

She dreams that her business could be moved to a school someday, where lot of students could purchase her products.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more flavors of ice cream and snacks for her store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the village of Tipan. She is 36 years old. Lourdes is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a hog raising business in the agricultural sector. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main income source for the business is raising pigs for sale. Lourdes has been running her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.
In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La señora Justina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 5 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta sexto de primaria, se dedica a la venta de comida y ahora venderá productos para los carnavales.

Justina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  carne, papa, arroz, globos, serpentinas, mixturas, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es poner una tienda de abarrotes. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Justina has been a member of the community bank "Las Calceteras" for 5 years. She lives in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román and the department of Puno. She is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She studied through the sixth grade of primary school. She sells prepared foods and just now will be selling food for Carnival.

Justina tells us that she used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles from Movimiento Manuela Ramos to increase her business capital.

She is requesting a loan of $700 with which she will buy meat, potatoes, rice, balloons, streamers, mixtures, etc.

Her dream for the future is to open her own grocery store.

What she likes most about her community bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, potatoes, rice, balloons, streamers, mixtures, etc

loans.name: Santa Cruz 1 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Santa Cruz es originario de la Aldea Santa Cruz, departamento de Choluteca, las integrantes son mujeres todas y son muy unidas, a continuacion se detalla cada una de las actividades que ellas realizan diariamente para ganarse la vida:
la sra. Martha G. es una señora casada y trabajadora, hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, las vende en su comunidad y tambien en EXCOSUR que es una empresa melonera que esta muy cerca de su casa, Martha tiene 2 hijas las cuales viven con ella. sus hijas trabajan en esta exportadora de melon y su esposo tambien trabaja en la misma melonera. Las hijas en sus tiempos libres le ayudan a Martha con dicha actividad. Ahora Martha quiere comprar una pequeña maquina para elaborar mas tortillas ya que las ventas son buenas.
la sra. Ana O. se dedica a la fabricacion de tortillas, con esta actividad a logrado salir adelante
y poder ayudarle a su familia, se levanta muy temprano a preparar las tortillas ya que los clientes desde temprano las vende, quiere crecer en con su negocio es por eso que a solicitado este prestamo.
la sra. Egna E. es una persona joven que se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas. Egna  trabaja duro para salir adelante y ayudar a su familia,  tiene 2 niños.
la sra. Juana R. es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y se dedica a la venta y elaboracion de tortillas, lucha para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y darles un mejor futuro, sus hijos estan en la escuela de la comunidad. En los tiempos libres sus hijos le ayudan a juana., ella quiere incrementar mas su negocio es por eso que a solicitado el credito.
texts.en:
The Santa Cruz group is from the Santa Cruz village in the Choluteca department. The members are all women who are very united. The following are details of each one of the daily activities they do to earn a living: Martha G. is married, and she is a hard-worker. She has been making and selling tortillas for a long time. She sells in her community. She also sells to Excosur, which is a melon business very close to her house. Martha has two daughters who live with her. They work for the melon exporter. Her husband also works for the same melon dealer. Matha’s daughters help her with the business during their free time. Martha now wants to buy a small machine to make more tortillas because sales have been good. Ana O. makes tortillas. With this business she has gotten ahead and been able to help her family. She gets up very early to prepare the tortillas because she starts selling them early. She wants to grow in her business, and that is why she is requesting this loan. Egna E. is a young person who makes and sells tortillas. Egna works hard to get ahead and help her family. She has two children. Juana R. is a single mother, and she has three children. She makes and sells tortillas. She struggles to be able to get her children ahead and give them a better future. Her children go to school in the community. The children help Juana during their free time. She wants to increase her business, and that is why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy corn flour, lime, water, and firewood

loans.name: Kobil

texts.ru: Оев Кобил проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 20 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Кобил имеет средне- специальное образование. Кроме того занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает каляски и детские игрушки. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Kobil O. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 20 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Kobil has a secondary-specialized education. He is involved in retail sales and has a store, where he sells baby strollers and children's toys. Kobil is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia hails from Ilogbo in Lagos State. She is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She is still strong and able to do more business so that she can improve on her family’s living standard.

Felicia sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks in her shop; she opens her shop every day of the week.

Felicia started her business six years ago and she is doing well. She hopes for the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO micro-finance for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna A. is married to a taxi driver and lives with her four children. She has no educational background.  Hanna sells fresh cassava at Abura. Hanna uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Hanna will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs such as groundnuts, okra, plantains and others for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Hanna plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuffs such as groundnut, etc. for resale

loans.name: Apostol

texts.en:
Apostol T. is from the village of San Jose. He is 46 years old. Apostol is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Apostol owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not his only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Apostol has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 90000 PHP per harvest.

In 2005, Apostol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apostol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Apostol is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Apostol from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
Mia L. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Mia is married. To make a living, Mia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mia has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Vuffie

texts.en: 34-year-old Vuffie T. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has three school-aged children. Vuffie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Vuffie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vuffie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees and supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Santa Lucía Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inició con la Señora Donatilda A.  integrante del comité “Santa Lucia” de la zona del  km 10 Acaray, la misma contactó   con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona. 
El comité se encuentra dentro del  Décimo Tercer  ciclo y todas se encuentran muy entusiasmada de seguir trabajando con el grupo.
La señora Catalina G. quien se dedica a la obstetricia es una de las integrantes del comité.
Ella adquirió esta profesión con muchos cursos que realizo siendo joven y actualmente con esta actividad mantiene a su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para  realizar algunas mejoras a su consultorios entre pinturas, cambio de pisos y otros, agradece por la ayuda.
texts.en:
The formation of this current group began with Donatilda A., member of the “Santa Lucía” group in the kilometer 10 Acaray zone. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in this zone.

The group is in its thirteenth loan cycle and all of them are very enthusiastic to continue working with the group.

Catalina G., who works in obstetrics, is one of the members of the group. She entered this profession with many courses that she completed when she was young and she currently maintains her family with this job.

She is requesting the loan to make some improvements to her office like paintings, changing the flooring and others. She is grateful for the help.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flooring and paintings, in addition to payment for the labor.

loans.name: Eudelio

texts.es:
El señor Eudelio González P. es de Jejui - Choré, con casa propia,  tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Crispina Acosta de 47 años de edad.
 
           Es propietario de una despensa con mercerías, el negocio tiene 16 años de funcionamiento, también vende repuestos varios para motos.

         Ademas cuenta con 10 hectáreas de tierra en donde tiene 20 cabezas de ganados vacunos y cultivos diversos.

               Es su octava operación de créditos con esta institución, canceló en forma excelente sus créditos anteriores, es un cliente muy trabajador y muy responsable.
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio, como productos de limpieza en general, yerba, azúcar, fideos, aceites, verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Mr. Eudelio González P. is from Jejui - Choré. He is a home owner, 50 years old, and is married to Mrs. Crispina Acosta who is 47 years of age. He owns a general dry-goods store which has been in business for 16 years and also sells various motorcycle parts. He has 10 hectares of land where he has 20 head of cattle and various crops. This is his eighth loan with this institution and has paid back his previous loans in an excellent way. He is a hard working, responsible, customer. At this time, he is taking out a loan to buy merchandise for his business like general cleaning products, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, oils, vegetables and fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general cleaning products, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, oils, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana M. K. sells earthenware bowls and works as a fishmonger in Elmina. Nana has not attained any level of education. She is divorced and has five dependants. Nana has been selling earthenware bowls for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more of her bowls to resell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to open up an earthenware shop.

loans.use: To buy more earthenware bowls to resell

loans.name: Nafees Akhter

texts.en:
Nafees akhter is a housewife who has been living in Borewala city with her husband and seven children for the past four years. 
She is 43 years old. She spends her time in her four room brick house and takes care of her household responsibilities. 
Her husband runs a canteen and her eldest son also helps him in his business. Her eldest son studied till 5th standard and left his education to support his family.
 
Nafees has four sons and three daughters. Her sons, except the eldest one, are getting their education and her three daughters are also attending school.
 
Nafees has applied for a loan from Asasah to support her husband who wants to expand his canteen business. With the loan amount her husband will buy food products, bottles, snacks, etc. for selling through his canteen. Nafees is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business with the help of this investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and has a good credit record. This is the third time she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase food products (bottles, snacks) for canteen business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking man who sells doughnuts to earn a living.  It is now three years since he started his business.  He sells doughnuts both in retail and wholesale.  

Peter is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.  He is the breadwinner in his family.  Since he joined Furaha Youth group in Faulu, Kenya, he has been able to save his money.  He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 to buy additional stock in his business.  He also hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: Expand inventory.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: K. Zuhro has a small shoe-sales business located at Ganjina market in Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Zuhro has been in business for thirteen years and has worked hard over the years to develop a successful business and to help meet the needs of her family. She currently sells a selection of men’s shoes. She has requested a loan of 1,500 USD to help purchase more inventory. Zuhro enjoys being self-employed and would like to continue growing and developing her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Adélaïde

texts.fr: K. Adélaïde vit depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Adélaïde est mariée à HOUNMENOU Franck et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Adélaïde vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Adélaïde vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Pour y arriver, Adélaïde vend du maïs, de l’huile d’arachide et divers autres produits (conserves de tomate, pâtes alimentaires, lait, sardine, savons, papier de toilette, etc.) à son domicile. Adélaïde s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Adélaïde exerce cette activité depuis six ans et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Adélaïde sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en: Adélaïde K. has lived for some twenty years in the Avotrou neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Adélaïde is married to Franck Hounmenou and is the mother of four children, all in school.  Adélaïde lives together with her children and husband.  Adélaïde helps her husband to ensure that the various needs of the family are met with the revenues from her business.  In order to do so, Adélaïde sells corn, peanut oil, and various other products (canned tomatoes, pasta, milk, sardines, soap, toilet paper, etc.) from her home.  Adélaïde gets her supplies in Danktopa, the international market of Benin.  Adélaïde has run this business for six years and has already received two loans which she paid back in full.  With the goal of strengthening her business and better responding to the needs of her growing number of customers, Adélaïde is requesting another loan.

loans.use: Purchais of corn and various products (canned goods, pasta, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor J. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 52 years old. Leonor is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonor owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, lotion, and deodorant in the local community. Leonor has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Leonor is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Leonor from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional daily use products to sell

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Getruda J. is married, in her mid twenties, and has a 5 year old son. For the past year Getruda has been buying clothes and then walking door to door to sell them. She does this between 10 am and 5 pm and it earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Getruda's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Getruda aims to use this loan to pay initial rent on a property which she aims to use to open up a clothing shop. Getruda is really looking forward to having her own shop and not having to go door to door anymore. Getruda's dream is to be able to take her son to a good school.

Getruda will share this loan with her loan group Loyola, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the photo, Getruda can be seen second from right in a black blouse.

loans.use: Pay rent for  shop space.

loans.name: Jaclyn María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jaclyn, tiene 28 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de un año y nueve meses y otro de siete meses.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen una cebichería,  en las tardes su marido trabaja en la finca del papá en la que es el cuidado del ganado, en la cebichería trabajan todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 14h00 o hasta que se termine lo que hayan preparado para el día. Los platos que venden es el ceviche de pescado, camarón, concha y de otros mariscos. A ella le ayuda un hermano de ella.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos para la preparación de los ceviches. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'La Rosa De Guadalupe' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Jaclyn.  She is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has two children from this relationship, one is 21 months old and the other is 7 months old.

Jaclyn and her husband have a 'cebichería' (an eatery where they sell 'ceviche' - raw fish marinated in citrus juice and spiced with chili peppers).  In the afternoons her husband works on his father's farm where he takes care of his cattle.  They both work in the 'cebichería' every day from 6.30am to 2.00pm or until the meals they have prepared run out.  They sell 'ceviche' made from fish, prawns, shellfish and other seafood.  Jaclyn's brother also helps out.

This loan will be used to buy more products for preparing 'ceviche'.  This is Jaclyn's fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she likes the benefits which the institution provides.  Her dream is to have her own premises.

loans.use: To buy fish, prawns, shellfish, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia C. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Talacdan, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling charcoal/firewood, and selling rice. Her husband, Leonardo, who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 26 and 36 years old. Florencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florencia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,300, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for firewood/charcoal to sell and to buy a vehicle so that she can continue to save up for future savings and expansion of her business. Florencia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle for charcoal delivery

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayan-Ulgii province, western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her other four children all attend a local school. May operates a construction business specializing in interior and exterior decoration of buildings. Her husband helps her business by working as an assistant worker. They have done previously many decorations on big supermarkets and store houses. They have owned this business for almost 10 years and over this long time they have earned a good reputation among their customers because of the quality of their work and service. Their earnings have enabled them to provide for their family. 

May is a very open-minded and a hard-working woman and says, “My only wish is to continue to run my business with stable operation so that I can establish my own construction company in the future.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and tools for her construction business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and tools

loans.name: Kelly Edmita

texts.es:
Kelly es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II, tiene 23 años y es conviviente.
Kelly se dedica la preparación de panes, el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como: harina, azúcar, manteca, grageas levadura. La elaboración de panes lo realiza con su pareja y los vende en unos de los principales mercados de Huamanga donde tiene un puesto de venta.
Le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar, tambien porque conoce a mas personas emprendedoras como ella.
Su sueño es poder comprarse un carro para poder repartir sus panes.
texts.en:
Kelly is a member of the “Bienestar II” (Well Being) communal bank.  She is 23 and in a live-in relationship.

Kelly bakes bread.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients, such as flour, sugar, lard, and yeast.  She and her mate bake the bread and she sells it from a stall in the main Huamanga market.

She likes the meetings of her communal bank because she can get loans and she can save because she has met other entrepreneurs like her.

Her dream is to buy herself a car so that she can deliver her bread.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet M. 37 years old has been overseeing her beauty saloon business for the past five years in Jinja town. It is a business where the daily trivial round involves hair dressing and plaiting women's hair. M. is happily married with four kids and she says weekly this business generates her shillings 35,000. Because of financial constraints, she has not been able to fully expand. It is for this reason that she is requesting for this loan to open more new horizons for her business. Top on her list is the purchase of a drier and cosmetics.

loans.use: The purchase of dryers and cosmetics

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a separated woman who lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a rice and beer retail business. She has 3 children who are between 27 and 30 years old, One has family and the other 2 are working. 

Ma. Luisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Luisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks of rice and beer so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs. 

Ma. Luisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Madina has a restaurant business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cups and plates to be used in her restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Madina hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees for her child and also pay house rent. In the future, she hopes to buy a fridge to put in her restaurant.
Madina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her enough time to pay back her loan in installments.

loans.use: To purchase more cups and plates for her restaurant

loans.name: Ada Cristela

texts.es:
Ada de 24 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 7, 4 y dos años de edad, ellos dependen económicamente, Ada se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, este negocio lo inicio por la ayuda que le brindo su madre en un inicio, no tiene un horario fijo ya que en su propia casa tiene la granja.
Actualmente necesita comprar cerdos por lo que solicita un préstamo, con los fondos piensa  adquirir cerdos y ampliar la granja.
La aspiración de ella es ampliar la granja y la clientela, obtener mejores ganancias y que las condiciones de vida de su familia sean mejores cada día.
texts.en:
Ada is 24 years old, she lives in San Rafael Oriente, department of San Miguel with her husband and three children of 7, 4, and 2 years of age who are dependent. Ada raises pigs, this business began with her mother’s help, she doesn’t have a fixed schedule since Ada has the farm in her home.

At present, Ada, needs the loan to buy pigs and plans to use the money to buy pigs and expand the farm.

Ada aspires to have a large farm and customers to have better earnings and that her family’s living conditions improve each day.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina aged 38 years is a single mother of two children, Mina aged 13 years and Rina aged 10 years who are both in primary school. She runs a boutique which is located in Kitengela town where most of her clients are female. Her business of 6 years gives her a monthly profit of Kshs.50, 000.

Edwina was introduced to KADET by a customer. This is her fourth loan and she intends to use it to open another boutique shop in Mlolongo. The profits from this business  will be used in the education of her children.

loans.use: To open another boutique shop in Mlolongo.

loans.name: Nelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nelly M. es de la ciudad de Medellín. Hace 20 años tiene un negocio donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías. Es soltera y vive con su madre que tiene más de 80 años de edad a quien cuida y mantiene gracias a los ingresos de su negocio.

Ella debe desplazarse con sus artículos para la venta hasta donde sus clientes, que se encuentran en diferentes zonas de la ciudad y muchas veces las fuertes lluvias no le permiten llegar hasta donde sus compradores. Sin embargo Nelly es una mujer emprendedora que quiere con el crédito poder comprar más mercancía como ropa y joyería, para ofrecerle mejores cosas a sus clientes y espera en un futuro poder aumentar su clientela y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelly M. is from the city of Medellín.  For 20 years she has been selling merchandise as a source of income.  She is single and lives with her mother who is over 80.  She is able to care for her thanks to the earnings from her business.

She sells her goods door-to-door to customers who are distributed throughout the different parts of the city and on many occasions the heavy rainfall keeps her from being able to work.  But Nelly is very enterprising and plans to use the loan to buy more clothing and jewelry so she can offer a wider variety of products and increase her customer base and income.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa propia que está ubicada en su propia parcela en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos. 

Desde hace 7 años, gana la vida criando ganado vacuno en un corral cercano a su vivienda. Actualmente, cuenta con 22 cabezas del cual extrae leche para venderla a diario.  Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de casa. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre trata de darles a sus animales un buen cuidado y alimentación para que estos tengan una buena producción. Desea comprar más alimento balanceado y pastos naturales para su ganado con los cuales sus vacas producirán más leche, aumentando las ventas y ganancias de Roger. También pretende hacer arreglos a su establo para mejor proteger su ganado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir creciendo en su negocio. Roger es muy trabajador. Las personas que lo conoce le tienen mucha estima. Ha manejado otro préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa y pagó sus cuotas de manera puntual. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roger is 33 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives in a home of his own located in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in the Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  He lives in the rural part of this district and does not have basic services.

For the past seven years he has made his living raising cattle in a pen near his home, where he has 22 heads of cattle whose milk he sells daily.  He does this behind his house and this is his primary source of income.  He is careful to care for his animals and feed them properly so that they will produce.  He wants to buy more balanced feed and natural grasses, so that his cows will produce more milk and so he can increase his sales and income.  He also wants to make repairs to the stables so that his cows will be better protected.

Roger has seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 PEN thorough Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to continue growing his business.  Roger is a hard worker and he is admired by others who know him.  He’s managed a previous loan from Edpyme Alternativa and his payments were all on time.  He appreciates the Kiva lenders for their support in growing his business and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 32 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente de condiments (tablettes de cubes jumbo), pâtes alimentaires, bananes, tissus traditionnels (Dali fini ou Koba), foulards, sacs à main, encens et bois de chauffe. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Malado   C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 pagnes de tissus traditionnels avec les tisserands installés au grand marché de Ségou.  Elle se ravitaille en gros et revend en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant et au marché Château à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Malado  C. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The seven women of the Benkadi group are 32 years old, married with an average of 5 children each, and mostly live in monogamous families.  They all live in the Hamdallaye quarter of Ségou, the fourth largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and met through their business dealings. The group's members buy and sell condiments (Jumbo stock cubes), pasta, bananas, traditional cloths (finished Dali or Koba), headscarves, handbags, incense and firewood. In order to boost their working capital, the members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second microcredit loan cycle. Mrs Malado C. aims to use her loan to buy 7 traditional wax clothes from the fabric suppliers in Ségou's market. She buys wholesale and sells via retail for cash or credit.  She goes from door to door and sells from the Château market to a customer base made up of men and women.  Mrs C. hopes to generate an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which she will reinvest in the business and use to meet her family's everyday needs.  Like the other group members, she wishes to boost her business revenues through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase traditional cloths (finished Dali or Koba)

loans.name: Comfort Group

texts.en:
Christopher S., who is in his late twenties, is single.  He has been running a fruit and vegetable business for eight years now.  He works from 6.00am to 4.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Christopher's  third loan from Tujijenge.  He used the previous loans to increase his stock of fruit and vegetables, bought a motorcycle and paid household expenses. He has paid back his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to further increase his fruit and vegetable stock. His dream is to one day build his own house.

Christopher will share this loan with his loan group "Comfort" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Christopher is 1st on the left in a blue shirt.  (Please note the photos are not very good because of the heavy rains.)

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura, age 55, is a fruit vendor, buying and selling bananas and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. She is widowed, has six grown children, and lives in the village of Magkarila, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental.
 
In 2009, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory was employed as working capital. 

Laura is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to offer for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Inkanyezi Group

texts.en:
Zanele is 30 years old and single with two children who are seven and 11 years old; both of them attend attend school. For a year she has run a retail business selling Green World products from door to door in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni, South Africa. She also receives income from the government's child grant program. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.


Zanele is requesting this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy kids' clothes for resale. She says that customers who take her products on credit and fail to pay on time are her main business challenge. The extra income arising from this loan will help her business grow, enable her to better support her family, and save for their studies at a higher institution.

loans.use: to buy kids' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en: Silverio is 57 years old, married and has 4 children. He is a farmer and tills his own land located in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Silverio grows rice and vegetables. He sells his harvest at his town’s market. Silverio works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Silverio hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Las Margaritas 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre las margaritas 2, las integrantes decidieron ponerle este nombre, por que como son puras mujeres y pues se identifican con esa flor, esta historia es acerca D. la señora Magali, ya que forma parte D. este grupo, cuenta con 23 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo, Eduardo D. 8 años D. edad quien cursa el tercer año D. primaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pizzas desD. hace 4 años.

Doña Magali decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenía la necesidad D. hacerlo, pues no contaba con la solvencia económica suficiente, para la educación D. su hijo y para darle una mejor calidad D. vida, ella decidió invertir el crédito en la compra D. más insumos para la elaboración D. sus pizzas como son: jitomates, puré D. tomate, harina, jamón, carne, queso, piña, salchichas y chiles.

Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder poner una pizzería, ya que así tendrá una mejor producción y variedad D. su producto, para mejorar e incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, para seguir apoyando a su pequeño hijo con sus estudios y en un futuro puedan terminar una muy buena carrera profesional.

Platica que todos sus compañeros, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todas se conocen y no tienen ningún problema entre ellos.

Dice que esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios D. kiva y con FRAC, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, asi poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

Las personas que integran el grupo D. las margaritas 2 y las distintas actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Magali-venta D. pizzas, abelina-venta D. frijoles, Isabel-venta D. perfumes, floricel-venta D. zapatos, Bertha-venta D. dulces, eulalia-taqueria, Herminia-frutería, lazara-venta D. pescados, divina-venta D. ropa- Paula-antojitos, ponciana-fruteria y Paula-molino D. nixtamal.
