texts.en: This group is called Las Margaritas 2 (The Daisies 2). The members decided upon this name because they are pure women who can identify with the flower. This description is about Magali, who is part of this group. She is 23 years old, married and has a son, 8-year-old Eduardo, who is in his third year of school. Magali has maD. a living making and selling pizzas for the past four years. She decided to start this business out of necessity because she didn't have sufficient income for her son's education and to give him a better quality of life. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase more ingredients to make her pizzas, such as tomatoes, tomato sauce, flour, ham, meat, cheese, pineapple, sausages and peppers. She wants to continue investing in her business so she can set up a pizzeria, since then she will increase her production and selection and improve and increase her sales and profits. In this way she can keep supporting her son's education and in the future he can end up with a very good career. She chats with all her fellow group memeber, who are responsible women who all know each other and don't have any problems with one another. Magali says she is very grateful to Kiva and FRAC, since thanks to them she is continuing ahead and has been able to start her own business and support her son. The women who make up the Las Margaritas 2 group and their activities are as follows: Magali - selling pizzas; Abelina - selling beans; Isabel - selling perfumes; Floricel - selling shoes; Bertha - selling candy; Eulali - running a taqueria; Herminia - running a fruit stand; Lazara - selling fish; Divina - selling clothing; Paula - selling snacks; Ponciana - running a fruit stand; and Paula - running a corn mill.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as tomatoes, tomato sauce, flour, ham, meat, cheese, pineapple, sausages and peppers.

loans.name: Ritza Emelina

texts.en: Ritza lives in Choluteca, Honduras with her husband and two small children. She makes a living selling clothing in a central location in her town. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to purchase merchandise. In her free time, Ritza enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, shoes, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 47 years old and has 11 children. Due to financial reasons she was not able to educate her children. Her eldest son works with his father in his Punjabi food restaurant and the next three children work in other cities. Her remaining children stay at home. 
Naseem is a housewife who stays at her home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is a very caring mother and has raised her 11 children with great care. She also supports her husband in his business by preparing food. 
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy furniture for his restaurant. This will allow him to provide better seating arrangements for his customers. He will also buy the necessary ingredients for making better quality food for his customers in order to increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past six years. Naseem is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband and improve the family's standard of living. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: to buy furniture and required ingredients for her husband's Punjabi restaurant business.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Clemencia has a rice farm that sells & harvest rice grains in due time. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to buy fertilizers for the rice field. 

Clemencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Clemencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and lives in Bacolod, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. 

Teresita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase materials for her food stall renovation. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Teresita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her food stall renovation.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy, who was born in 1958, lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune, with her husband, who is a worker, and her son. Vy has had a clothing shop in the market for the past five years, earning a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND).

Having participated in SEDA since 2007, she promptly repaid her last loan of 8,502,000 VND and is now requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more new clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Edna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en:
Sukhbaatar is 38 years old and lives with her wife and two sons, aged 11 years and 5 months, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district, a district without basic infrastructure in the city. His elder son attends local secondary school while his wife babysits their newborn son who is only 5 months old. 

Sukhbaatar supports his family by operating a clothing retail stall business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When he started his business in 2005, he sold his wife’s handmade coats and jackets. Then they started to sell products which they imported from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 
 
Autumn is a very high shopping season in Mongolia, therefore he is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrik) loan to purchase more clothes to sell in his stall during this autumn in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina, D. 52 años es una mujer luchadora que junto a William, su esposo desD. hace 28 años. Cuidan a 3 D. sus 5 hijos; en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad D. Huancayo. Ella es una mujer luchadora, su principal virtud es el ingenio que tiene en cualquier negocio que emprenD.. La venta D. productos D. belleza en todo tipo D. marcas, es su principal actividad económica. Además brinda el servició D. lavado D. ropas y limpieza D. casas, donD. le va muy bien, pues durante este tiempo logró obtener buenos clientes. Pero como ella gusta D. estar ocupada y activa; en festividades del mes D. octubre, venD. turrones en las calles acompañando a la procesión del cristo moreno. Además D. panteones en navidad y la preparación D. comida los días domingo en una esquina D. su casa. Las ganas D. progreso D. está mujer son impresionantes, “tengo que trabajar para sacar a mis hijos adelante”, afirma, ya que uno D. ellos estudia una carrera universitaria y su mayor deseo es ver a todos sus hijos como unos profesionales, responsables y con éxito. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, se siente aliviada, pues tiene el apoyo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. La casa D. Georgina necesita D. algunos arreglos, por ello D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. puertas, ventanas y pago al personal para revestir sus paredes con un material fuerte.
texts.en: Georgina, 52, is a hard-working woman who alongsiD. William, her husband for 28 years, cares for three of her five children in their own house located in the city of Huancayo. She is a hard-working woman. Her principle virtue is the knack that she has with whatever business she starts. Selling beauty products from all types of brands is her main economic activity. Additionally, she provides a laundry and a house cleaning service which do well and during this time she has managed to obtain good customers. But she likes to be busy and active. In the festivities of the month of October, she sells candies in the street accompanying the procession of the black Christ, in addition to cemetaries at Christmas and preparing food on Sundays in a corner of her home. This woman's desire to get ahead are impressive, "i have to work to get my children ahead" she affirms since one of them studies at university and her greatest wish is to see all of her children become professionals, responsible and with success. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She feels relieved since she has the support she needs to achieve her objectives. Additionally, she promises to be punctual with her repayments. Georgina's house needs some repairs for which she needs your support. She will invest the money requested in the purchase of doors, windows and to pay the people to recoat her walls with a strong material.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows for her house, as well as pay the construction workers.

loans.name: Damasus

texts.en: Damasus is a hardworking business man aged 35. He is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. For the last five years, he has been running a general shop to make a living. He also operates a butcher shop for more income. Damasus has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. He has employed two people in the business. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his business premise by painting and adding more shelves. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: To renovate his business premise by painting and adding more shelves

loans.name: Jenny Del Carmen

texts.es: Jenny es estudiante de Contabilidad Pública, tiene un negocio propio de reciclaje, y con esos ingresos paga sus estudios. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una computadora, que le permita poder practicar y hacer investigaciones a cerca de su carrera. Dentro de algunos años se ve administrando efizcamente los recursos con que cuenta su microempresa, su inspiración es su hijo, ya que como madre y padre para él desea darle lo mejor. Ha presentado muchos desafíos a lo largo de sus estudios y los ha podido superar gracias al empeño que tiene de coronar su carrera
texts.en: Jenny is studying Public Accounting.  She has a recycling business and uses income from it to pay for her schooling.  The loan is to buy a computer that will help her do research for her career.  She sees herself in a few years efficiently managing her micro firm’s resources.  Her inspiration is her son because being both his mother and father she wants to give him the best.  She has faced many challenges during her studies and has managed to overcome them thanks to the determination she has to complete her career.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 56 years old and lives in Tubod, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with four children.

Constancia has a general store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Constancia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 months. In the future, Constancia hopes to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  DRISSA  est âgé de 43 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à KOUNKODJAN, un des villages de la sous- préfecture  de BAGUINEDA,  Région de Koulikoro.
DRISSA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son cinquième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de KOUNKODJAN et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins deux mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Drissa is 43 years old and lives with his ​​six children and his wife in a traditional family in Kounkodjan, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Baguinéda, part of the Koulikoro Region.

Drissa has not had the opportunity to go to school. Very early on he became interested in income-generating activities, in particular the buying, storing, and selling of cereals. He learned the business from his maternal uncle, who was once a major grain trader.

In order to satisfy his growing number of customers, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on his fifth individual loan he will use to buy two tons of cereals (maize, beans, millet, fonio) from farmers and producers in Kounkodjan and the surrounding area, and store them for at least two months. He mainly sells wholesale to a clientele made up of dealers from big cities like Bamako.

Drissa expects an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, the rest being reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Chanthorn, 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a food and drinks vendor in front of the provincial hospital. Her husband helps her sell food and one of her children is in the military. Chanthorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to expand her business of selling food and drinks. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children's studies.

loans.use: to expand her business of selling food and drinks

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 61 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella esa casada y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de cereales y de maiz y habas,tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y tambien ella prepara chicha que es una bebida a a base de maiz,ella sigue siendo un amujer emprendedora que por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales,maiz y habas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maiz y habas y tambien para comprar alimetos para los animales como cuyes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member Luisa is 61 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has one child. 

She continues to make her living in the business of buying and selling grains, corn, and broad beans. She also works in the business of animal breeding like guinea pigs and sells chicha, a drink made from a corn base. She continues to be an entrepreneurial woman who, through these small businesses, has helped her children get ahead. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her grains, corn and broad beans. The member is requesting a loan to buy corn and lima beans as well as to buy feed for animals like guinea pigs. 

She values and infinitely appreciates the loan she has been granted as it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time she is committing to make her payments according to the terms stipulated.

loans.use: to buy corn and broad beans and also to buy feed for animals like guinea pigs.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 24 years old. He is a tea farmer in the Rift Valley. He has been in operation for the last year, earning a monthly income of KES 10,834.

Noah is requesting his first loan from KADET ltd of KES 15,000. He plans to use the funds to purchase tea seedlings for transplanting to his farm. The profits will be used to expand the tea farm and plant more tea bushes. His dream is to own a large tea farm.

loans.use: To purchase tea seedlings for transplanting.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is unmarried, and she was unable to go to school. She has three children between the ages of 7 and 20 years old; they are in school and live at home. 

Tawah describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years, she has been selling cold water and soft drinks in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 AM to 6 PM, and she likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her fiance. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business location.

Tawah is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water and soft drinks for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
I sell cheese, milk and other milk products. I have a moblile business and I distribute my products in general stores and small villages. I have been doing this for four years and my earning have been enough to cover family expenses. My wife sells drinks, charamuscas and ice to teh neighbors.

Loan Use: Purchase of cheese, milk and other milk products

Me dedico a la venta de queso, quesillo y mantequilla, mi negocio es ambulante ya que distribuyo el producto en pulperias y caserios. Tengo 4 años de dedicarme a esta actividad que me ha ido muy bien, los ingresos que he percibido me han ayudado a cubrir los gastos de mi familia. En mi casa mi esposa se encarga de verder a mis vecinos y a vender refrescos y charamuscas y hielo.

loans.use: Compra de queso, quesillo y mantequilla

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en: Rukaya is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children. She runs a major food joint at Effiakuma, a suburb of Takoradi. She has been providing local foods to the community for the last 3 years. These include rice, rice balls and banku, which is made from corn. She has gone through the TEACH sessions of Kraban Support Foundation. She therefore wants Kiva to assist her with the loan to acquire a permanent structure to grow the business and give comfort to customers in a clean environment.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Imanalu

texts.en: Mrs. Imanalu J. is 51 years old. She is married with six (6) children. She was trained for 2 years before starting her own business, and she hails from Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to get the above amount to buy materials for her soap business.

loans.use: To buy more material for soap making

loans.name: Gerardo Ignacio

texts.es:
I have lived in my home for more than five years. I would like to build a room in the back, since we only have two rooms and my mother lives with me and my two children. Space is very tight. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to build another room for my kids and so we're not uncomfortable at home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya más de 5 años viviendo en esta casa. "Me gustaría construir un cuartos en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda ya que solo tiene 2 recamaras y tengo dos hijos y vive con migo mi mama así que el espacio es muy reducido. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls para construir un cuarto más para los niños y así no estar incómodos en la casa.

loans.use: Add a room to my home

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Navy is divorced with 6 children: 2 sons and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production business in 1992. 2 of her daughters also weave silk at home.

Mrs. H. has taken out 2 loans from MAXIMA to date. She is now requesting a loan of $600. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread as well as pay fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a 35-year-old resident of the Makangarawe area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has been doing business for the past four years. She runs a restaurant in Makangarawe that prepares local dishes. She wants to expand her restaurant into a bigger one to accommodate more customers. She needs to buy more tables and chairs for her restaurant.  She is in need of $225 to help her boost her business

loans.use: Expand bussiness

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en: Yeyen is 35 years old, and a mother of a 12 year old daughter. She sells some accessories and usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, S., is a tailor and usually earns $5 per day. She has to work hard to earn some extra income. She really needs a $50 loan to expand her and her husband's businesses and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Amelia L. is 38 years old and has been married for 19 years to Mr. Porfirio L., who is also 38. The couple has 4 children, the oldest is 18 and studying the first year of a degree in nursing. The others are 15, 13 and 11 years old, respectively, and are studying at schools in the city.

Amelia has her own convenience store, which she attends to personally, offering excellent service to her customers. She started this business 5 years ago with capital from her husband, who owns an upholstery store, and in this way she has been able to increase the family's income.

She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, yerba mate, oil, flour, pasta and articles for Christmas, as during this time of year the demand for these products increases considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Amelia López de 38 años de edad esta casada hace 19 años con el Señor Porfirio López también de 38 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene 4 hijos, la mayor tiene 18 años y esta cursando el 1er. Año de Licenciatura en Enfermería, los otros tienen 15 años 13 y 11 años respectivamente y están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad.

Doña Amelia tiene una despensa propia, el cual atiende de forma personalizada ofreciendo de ésta manera a sus clientes una excelente atención. Se inicio en este negocio hace 5 años con un capital que le facilitó su marido que es propietario de una tapicería y de ésta aumentar los ingresos de la familia.

La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, yerba, aceite, harina, queso, fideos y en especial para la compra de artículos navideños; ya que como estamos en época de fin de año la demanda de estos artículos aumenta considerablemente.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, yerba mate, oil, flour, cheese, pasta and articles for Christmas.

loans.name: Raquel Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. N.'s business is food sales. She prepares the food in her home very early in the morning, and then later sells it in the market. To be able to run her business, she buys ingredients on loan, paying for them each week - and when she has the opportunity, she immediately makes her purchase.

Mrs. N. has had her business for two years and started with a loan of $2,000 cordobas that she obtained from a moneylender.

Ceprodel has granted her with 4 loans over the past 1 1/2 years. These loans have had a big impact on her business. The demand for her food has grown and the loans have allowed her to purchase ingredients and at the same time, have allowed her to purchase a stand in the "food court" section of the Santa Ana market in Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra.N. es la venta de comida la cual la prepara muy temprano en su casa para después proceder a su venta en el mercado. Para poder realizar este negocio, ella compra productos (ingredientes) al crédito pagándolos a la semana y cuando tiene la oportunidad, realiza su compra de contado.

La Sra. Raquel N. tiene 2 años de tener su negocio e inicio con C$2.000.00 producto del préstamo que realizó a un prestamista.

Ceprodel le brindó apoyo por medio de financiamiento por año y medio con 4 créditos otorgados siendo el impacto que han tenido estos créditos de mucha utilidad para su negocio por lo que ha habido un crecimiento en la demanda en su comida ya que ha podido suplir sus necesidades en la compra de los ingredientes de la comida y a la vez ha podido alcanzar un puesto de venta en el sector de las comiderías del mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mr. Prum P. owns a plot of farmland where he grows rice and typically earns approximately $1 per day. His wife works as a housewife and stays at home to look after their children and to cook food for the entire family. The couple has nine children, one of whom is married and lives away from their home. Two of their children collect recyclable materials by going door-to-door in the village and they re-sell the materials to the plant to earn approximately $100 each month. Moreover, another child works in the garment factory and has a salary of $40 per month, while another child is a blacksmith and earns approximately $20 per month. The couple hopes to receive a $300 loan from Kiva so that they can purchase a motor bike to transport the recyclable items to the plant.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to transport recyclable products to the plant for re-sale.

loans.name: Iliganoa

texts.en: Running a canteen business is not easy for Iliganoa, but what motivated her to keep her business is the service that she wants to offer to the children of her district. She explains that from Monday to Friday she has to get up at 4am in the morning to start her preparation: making sandwiches, sausage rolls, hot dogs, etc. She doesn’t hire anyone to work for her, but she has two daughters that are helping her out with the preparation before they depart for work. This business has become really successful for Iliganoa due to the service she provides and the nutritional value of the food she sells. She has been in business for more than three years now, and she is 55 years old and still willing to keep her business running well. With her requested loan she plans to buy an electric stove to so she won't have to wake up so early to gather fire wood.

loans.use: To purchase an electric oven for easy preparation of her canteen food.

loans.name: Hadija's Baraka Group

texts.en: Hadija is married and earns income managing a small stock of animals (cows). She started this business in 2004. Every day, Hadija works from 7 am to 6 pm, and is now hoping to receive a loan to be able to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members Asha, Sauda, Sara, and Anna, who own food and charcoal sales businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
N. Juma has been a farmer for 20 years, growing maize, beans, cassava and coffee and raising cattle for their meat. He recently also began a "boda boda" (motorcycle taxi) business. He is married with 8 children, of whom 6 are in school. He also cares for five orphans who stay with his mother.

This is Juma's second time to ask for a loan from Pearl Microfinance through the Kyosiga Women’s group and the first loan was paid promptly. He needs a loan to buy a cow for its meat.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Farajallah

texts.en: Farajallah, 43 years old, is married and has 2 children. He lives in the area of Nabatieh in South Lebanon and owns a vegetable and fruit shop. Farajallah needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,200 to enlarge and diversify the inventory of goods he can offer to his clients. Farajallah has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 6 years and always repays his debts on time. He is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the happiness of his family.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to enlarge and diversify the inventory of goods he can offer to his clients

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. cooks rice to sell to her costumers. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Felicia and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Mr. Eliseo Centurion is a native of the city of Carapeguá and lives in the Beni Loma region. He is 36 years of age and has been married for over 11 years with Mrs. Pelagia Chaparro. They have three children, two of which are in school and one is an adult.

Since he was nine years old, he worked selling quilts with his mother, which they both produced. After much sacrifice and to gain his independence, he decided to work on his own and began selling local artisan products from his region using his motorcycle as transportation. He sells these local products in the cities of Caapucú, Missions, and Florida. Thanks to his hard work he has succeeded in building a modest home for the comfort of his family.

With this loan he will buy quilts / blankets, Paraguayan hammocks and bed sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Eliseo C. es oriundo de la ciudad de Carapeguá y vive en una de la compañía Beni Loma, tiene 36 años de edad y está casado hace más de 11 años con la Sra. Pelagia Chaparro y tienen Tres hijos dos en edad escolar y el otro ya mayor de edad.

Desde los nueve años de edad empezó a salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producían con su madre, después de mucho sacrificio logró independizarse y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia; lleva los productos artesanales de la zona a vender por las ciudades de Caapucú, Florida y Misiones trasladándose en su motocicleta. Gracias a este trabajo logró edificar una modesta casa para comodidad de su familia.

Con el Crédito comprará colchas, hamacas paraguayas y sábanas

loans.use: To purchase Paraguayan hammocks, sheets and quilts. (compra de hamacas paraguayas, sábanas, colchas)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of more products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es:
El nombre del cliente es Martha Carolina P. C. tiene 35 años de edad, su estado civil es  casada, tiene 3 hijos  las edades de sus hijos son de:18, 15 y 11 años de edad los dos mayores cursan la secundaria y el menor actualmente cursa el sexto grado de primaria, su compañero de vida trabaja en la compra de artesanía, los propósito y sueños que desea lograr son : poder contar con un negocio lo suficientemente rentable con el cual pueda ayudar a los diferentes gastos del núcleo familiar. Otros de los deseos es que sus hijos logren coronar una carrera como profesionales siendo uno de los principales motivos para ella, para que en el futuro puedan defenderse por sus propios medios.

En cuanto a su actividad económica actual, esta es la comercialización de artesanía, en el poblado de la calle real de Tolapa municipio de Malpaisillo, tendiendo 11 años de tener su negocio, el negocio fue heredado por sus familiares ya ella se dedicaba a la elaboración  de loza y hoy en día la comercializa fuera de la comunidad debido a la afluencia de extranjeros en el lugar una de las formas en ella   logra venderla de forma ambulante y que los clientes puedan apreciar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha Carolina P. C. is 35 years old and is married with three children who are 11, 15, and 18 years old. The two oldest children are in high school and the youngest is still in 6th grade in elementary school. Her husband is an artisan making various handicrafts. Her dreams are to have a profitable company that can pay her family's expenses, and for her children to become professionals in the careers of their choice. One of the principal motives for her work is to be able to provide for herself and her family on her own. Currently, she sells handicrafts in the neighborhood on Tolapa Street in Malpaisillo. She has run her business for 11 years; inheriting it from her relatives. She has worked making china which she sells outside of her neighborhood since there are more affluent foreigners outside of her neighborhood. She does not have a fixed locale and generally sells walking through neighborhoods and markets to commercialize her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Hasrat

texts.en: Hasrat M. lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan.  He was born in 1984 and is single. He is in the business of selling tables and chairs. Hasrat has been in this business for three years. He would like to improve this business and requests a loan of 970 AZN to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Evilia

texts.es: Evilia tiene 56 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella es administradora, desde muy joven trabajó en diversas instituciones  educativas, ahora está a puertas de iniciar el funcionamiento de su propio colegio, en el cual también brinda servicio de Internet a los jóvenes de su zona, servicio que lleva más de 4 años. Evilia está muy contenta porque siempre le gustó la idea de formar  su propio colegio  y administrarlo, lo cual la llena de entusiasmo, además de tener el apoyo económico de su servicio de Internet, el cual es muy concurrido por los escolares, aunque los problemas empiezan a surgir cuando las máquinas no  tiene un constante mantenimiento y perjudican los ingresos diarios. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Evilia invertirá el dinero que solicita y aparte otros 300 soles de sus ahorros, en la reparación de sus computadoras y renovación de módulos para las cabinas.
texts.en:
Evilia, 56, is married and living with her husband and two children. She is an administrator. She has worked in various educational institutions since she was very young, and now she is on the threshold of starting the operation of her own school, in which she will also provide Internet service to the young people in her area, a service she has provided for more than 4 years. Evilia is very happy and pleased with the idea of forming her own school and administrating it. She is filled with enthusiasm. She also has the economic support of her Internet service, which is very popular with the students, although problems are starting to show up if the machines are not constantly maintained, affecting the daily income. This is her first loan with MFP. Evilia will invest the money she has requested, as well as 300 soles from her savings, in the repair of her computers and renovation of the cubicles in the booths.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of her computers

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Juana es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Juana tiene un puesto en el mercado Jesús Nazareno en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hijo.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Juana son hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is an associate of the Alliance Communal Bank. Juana is married, 42 years old and has 4 children. Juana has a position in the Jesus of Nazareth market where she sells groceries, an activity that she carries out every day with the aid of her son. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. The dreams of Juana are to grow her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar for her grocery business.

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es: Don Ricardo tiene 23 años de edad, habita en  memorial sandino, su esposa le tiene una hija de 1 años de edad, el joven Ricardo tiene dos años de laborar como técnico de bodega y facturador de pedidos, lo cual inicio como ayudante de bodega, y por su experiencia lo promovieron, lo cual es un logro no solo en lo personal si no que económicamente le subieron su salario que es de mucho ya que sus metas es poder tener su casa propia para su familia, con sus ahorro tiene una parte de materiales comprados, y con esta solicitud de préstamo en Afodenic va invertir en mas materiales de construcción para hacer la sala de su casa. Sus planes es poder tener estabilidad económica y social, laborar, para poder seguir ahorrando y con los préstamos terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Don Ricardo is 23 years old, lives in Memorial Sandino and has a 1-year old daughter with his wife. Young Ricardo has 2 years experience working as warehouse technician and order billing. He started off as warehouse assistant and because of his experience, he was promoted, something that is not only a personal accomplishment, but also a financial one. His pay was increased, which is big since his goal is to have a home for his family. With his savings he’s been able to purchase part of the building materials, and with this loan from Afodenic he will invest in more so he can build the living room for his home. His plans are to have economic and social stability, and to work so he can keep saving and with his loans, finish building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to build the living room for his home

loans.name: Teyode

texts.en: Teyode A. is 36 years old and married with 2 children.  She has a small lodging and drinking spot. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est un jeune homme de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est réparateur moto à Womé, un village situé à l’ouest du Togo. Il opère dans ce secteur de puis 5 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des outils de travail et aussi aménager son atelier. Dans la photo, Kokou est situé à l’extrême droit.
texts.en:
Kokou A., age 33, is married and the father of 2 children. For 5 years, he's been repairing motorcycles in Womé, a village located in Western Togo. With this loan, he wishes to buy work tools and and to outfit his workshop. In the photograph, Kokou is on the right.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and outfit his garage

loans.name: Komesse

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un marin de formation, mais il n’a pas pu aller très loin dans ce métier, il s’est vite lancé dans le commerce de cartes de recharges, ce commerce marche bien à Lomé car il y a beaucoup de société de téléphonie dans la ville, il arrive à réaliser de bonnes recettes, actuellement son stock a diminué et il n’arrive pas à répondre convenablement à la demande, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 182 cartes TOGOCEL et 450 cartes MOOV. Il est célibataire et c’est grâce à ce commerce qu’il arrive à subvenir à ses charges
texts.en:
This gentleman trained as a sailor, but he did not manage to go far in this trade. He soon began selling rechargeable phone cards. This business is successful in Lomé since there are a lot of telephone companies in the city. He manages to have a good turnover. Presently his stock is diminished and he is not able to keep up with demand. Thus he is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 182 TOGOCEL cards and 450 MOOV cards. He is single and it is thanks to this business that he is able to support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Tulkunjon

texts.en:
K. Tulkunjon is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has three children and a wife whom he has to support. Tulkunjon wishes to develop his business. This business consists of cattle-raising in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns. Tulkunjon is helped by his wife.

Tulkunjon is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing and, accordingly, their expenses are growing too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities and services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: MR D. est un maçon de profession depui presque 30 ans:il travaille avec ses enfants qui sont appelés à prendre la relève ;avec ce pret il veut acheter des planches car il en a besoin pour ses chantiers;
texts.en:
Mr. D. has been a mason by profession for almost 30 years. He works with his children, who are called upon to take his place. With this loan, he wants to buy planks because he needs them at his construction sites.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
La señora Nely, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Primavera”, vive en el Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 45 años y es madre soltera de 03 hijos, 01 que todavía estudia y depende mucho de ella. 

Nos cuenta que se inició con S/. 500.00 y que fue por iniciativa propia que decidió emprender su negocio de venta de dulces.
Es ella misma quién se encarga de prepararlos en su casa, aparte de vender sus dulces, chifles, turrones, también vende sus aguajes y algunas frutas de estación.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, y vende caminando por diferentes lugares dentro de la ciudad donde hay mas movimiento, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas y ya tiene mucha acogida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, lo invertirá comprando sus sacos de aguajes, insumos para la preparación de sus productos como Chancaca, azúcar, maní seco y galones de aceites para la preparación de sus chifles y turrones. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando panes y dulces, para luego venderlos.

Nely toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que ahora es muy independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como mujer y empresaria, y por ayudar a otras mujeres que sueñan con salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nely belongs to the La Primavera Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is a 45 year old single mother with three children. One child is still in school and very dependent upon her. She started her business of selling sweets with 500 PEN and her own initiative. She makes the sweets in her house. Besides selling sweets, plantain chips, and nougat candy, she also sells aguajes (a Peruvian fruit) and some seasonal fruit. She currently has the same business. She sells by walking to the busier places in the city. She is well received, and sales are going very well for her. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy sacks of aguajes and ingredients like sugar cane, sugar, dried peanuts, and gallons of oil to make her plantain chips and nougat candy. She will use part of the money to buy bread and sweets to later sell. Nely makes the decisions about the earnings from her business. She is now independent, self-confident, and responsible about making her payments. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and as a business woman and for helping other women who dream of getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients (peanuts, sugar cane, sugar, and others) to make her sweets

loans.name: Rukhsana Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Baji is a wife of M. A., and for the past 15 years has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a construction supply business, and has been selling supplies to building contractors for over 3 years. Rukhsana Baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to advance her husband’s business.

This is a group loan, and Rukhsana Baji is the group leader. The other three members are women from her area. Zubaida Baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread and clothes) for preparing embroidered clothes. Rubina Baji wants to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Azharan Baji wants to buy materials (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her food-selling business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Rukhsana Baji is seated in a white shawl in this picture.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina O. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through senior high school. Regina sells banku and fish at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is a porter. Regina uses her income to pay bills and other household expenses. Regina will use the loan to purchase bags of maize and other food stuffs for the preparation of the food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and other food stuffs for the preparation of the food for sale.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega especificamente en el Mercado Central la señora Juana N. se dedica arduamente a atender su negocio de venta de ropa siempre muy sonriente siendo esto de mucho gusto para todos sus clientes que le compran a ella.

Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de la ropa y es por este motivo que espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito porque requiere llenar sus estantes y así obtener mejores ingresos en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega department, more specifically in the Central Market, Juana Noyoa works arduously tending her business selling clothes. She is always smiling, and this pleases her customers who buy from her. She is now asking for a loan to buy clothes. She hopes to be the beneficiary of a loan because she needs to fill her shelves and get greater income from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 03 que aun dependen D. ella.

Tiene varios años dedicándose a este tipo D. actividad, D. venta D. pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central D. su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo D. Manuela Ramos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.
Así, siguió superándose, ahora venD. pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un puesto alquilado del Mercado Central, donD. brinda el servicio, a los moradores D. la comunidad y amas D. casa.  Con este préstamo D. S/.3,000.00,  comprara  pollos vivos en jabas, para D. esta manera vender más y satisfacer a sus clientes.
Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Marina Dice: Que el pertenecer a un grupo D. mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina belongs to the Communal Bank, "Nuestra Senora D. la Paz II:, in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, in San Martin Department. She is married, is 53 years old, and has 6 children, 3 of whom are still her dependents. For some years she has been in the business of selling cleaned and cut-up chickens in a stall in the Central Market of her city. She began her business when she received a loan from Manuela Ramos and since that time, has done very well and has good customers. In this, she continued to do better and better and now sells a large number of chickens. Currently she is continuing with the same business in the stall that she rents in the Central Market. There she offers her service to the community residents and to housewives. With this $3,000 sol loan ($1025), she will buy live chickens in crates so that she can sell more and please her customers. Today she is an independent woman, and she is the one who runs and makes the decisions in her business. She says that "to belong to a group of women has helped her know what her rights are and together see that these are respected..

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens in crates to increase her stock

loans.name: Suyunbubu's Group

texts.en:
Suyunbubu, the leader of this group, is 51 years old. She has raised four children, two sons and two daughters. All her children have already started adult life and earn their own livelihoods. Her eldest son works in Russia doing odd jobs at a construction site. Her eldest daughter works as a seamstress in Alamedin market in the capital. Her second son is an excavator, and her youngest daughter is a college student at the Humanities University in the capital.

Suyunbubu prefers to be independent from her children and earns her living by manufacturing curtains and tailoring. This business, which she has been working at for 20 years, makes her a humble income of $120 USD a month. Suyunbubu has also taught her daughters how to sew. With their help, Suyunbubu manages to get her work done faster. She has her own sewing machine and does all her work at home. However, she is in need of a new sewing machine as her current one has become old and inconvenient. She also needs to purchase some accessories for the sewing machine. Therefore Suyunbubu is requesting a loan to help her make these purchases and thus save valuable time. In the future, Suyunbubu hopes to marry her sons and daughters, and help her youngest daughter complete her college education.

Suyunbubu’s partners are Shailoobai, Akmoor and Akmolmol. Shailoobai, 30, is married and has a cute five-month-old daughter. He provides for his family by raising livestock. He needs a loan to buy one sheep and three goats.

Akmoor, 33, is a mother of three children. She raises livestock and sells some of her cattle at market when needed. Akmoor needs a loan to buy five or six goats for breeding.

For the last ten years, Akmolmol, 36, has been providing for her four children by raising cattle and selling milk. As the children grow, she needs to increase her income to meet their growing needs. She hopes to get a loan and buy a calf.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and supplies

loans.name: Doylalita

texts.es: Doylalita es una mujer colaboradora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 35 años, es madre de tres menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de condimentos y abarrotes en el mercado de Micaela Bastidas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en una empresa privada. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas” desde hace dos años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en condimentos.  En la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos. La meta de Doylalita es tener un negocio en su casa de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Doylalita is a collaborating and dynamic lady. She lives in the town of Pucallpa, province of Coronel Portilla. She is 35 years old and a mother of three young children. She sells condiments and groceries for a living at the market of Micaela Bastidas. She is supported by her husband who works at a private company. She has been a member of "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Galácticas" for two years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in condiments. Presently she needs a loan of 1000 soles to be spent on buying sugar, rice, milk, and noodles. Doylalita's goal is to set up a general store at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying sugar, rice, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” del centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos, vive en la plaza de Ticaraya, ella estudio educación superior (computación).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 años y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, luego lo vende en la feria de Chaca Chaca, también se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de venta de abarrotes.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones, los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela, de 51 años, ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Alipio), de 48 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Guido de 18, David de 16, Hilbert de 24 y Gladys de 26 años, y desea con todas sus fuerzas tener un futuro más prometedor.

Las 5 de la mañana, es la hora en que Micaela despierta para sacar a pastear a sus animales, los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza de sus animales depende la ganancia que obtendrá por venderlos, ella lleva sus reses a vender a la feria de la ciudad de Huancané donde siempre obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por los inmensos campos por donde pastea a su ganado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más dificl es trasladar sus animales hasta la feria. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Micaela con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los setecientos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para alimentar mejor a sus animales.
texts.en:
Micaela is 51 years old and has fought hard to move up in life. She lives in her own home along with her husband, Alipio, 48, and their four children: Guido, 18; David, 16; Hilbert, 24; and Gladys, 26. She wishes with all her might for a brighter future. At 5 in the morning, Micaela waks up to graze her animals, which she raises with a lot of tenderness and dedication because she knows that the profits she makes when she sells them depends on their care. She takes her heads of cattle to sell at the market in the city of Huancané, where she always earns very good profits. What she likes most about her job is walking through the immense fields where she grazes her cattle. She has 10 years' experience in the business and considers taking the cattle to market to be the most difficult part. In the future, she hopes to be able to increase her heads of cattle and thus increase her income. This is Micaela's second loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she has made all of her payments on time. She feels a responsibility as a member of her community bank, where she is very respected for putting together meetings with the other members. With the 700 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more feed to better nourish her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her animals

loans.name: Mrs. Channa Ry Uong Group

texts.en: Mrs. Channa Ry U. is a group leader of six people, and they all live in Damnak village in Takeo province. Mrs. Channa Ry U. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. However, the soil is infertile, and in order to deal this problem, Mrs. Channa Ry U. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Teng Sokheng, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Channa Ry U. is a mother of three children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 49-year-married man and the father of 3 children. He has owned a car painting shop since 1995, which provides enough income to provide for his family. After years in the business, Youssef is requesting to borrow $1,000 to renovate his shop and his tools in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: renovate his shop and his tools

loans.name: Tlayecac Group

texts.es:
UBICADO APROXIMADAMENTE A 20KM DE LA CIUDAD DE CUAUTLA SE ENCUENTRA EL PUEBLO DE TLAYECAC PERTENECIENTE AL MUNICIPIO DE AYALA MORELOS.
EL PUEBLO CUENTA CON VARIAS NTRADAS PARA LLEGAR A EL PERO LA MAS FACIL Y CERCA ES POR LA CARRETERA MEXICO - OAXACA  SE LLEGA A LA DESVIASION QUE DICE TLAYECAC - AMAYUCA DOBLA A MANO DERECHA Y TODA ESA CARRETERA LLEVA AL PUEBLO DE TLAYECAC.
EN ESTE PUEBLO LA AGRICULTURA ES LA ACTIVIDAD PRNCIPAL EN ESTA COMUNIDAD,BASICAMENTE EN LOS CULTIVOS DE SORGO Y MAIZ EN UNA SUPERFICIE DE 1234 HECTAREAS Y 195 PRODUCTORESY EN LA GANADERIA ES IMPORTANTEEL GANADO BOBINO, PORCINO Y CAPRINO, ENTRE OTRAS ACTIVIDADES IMPORTANTESSE ENCUENTRA EL COMERCIO, YA QUE AQUI SE UBICA LA ZONA INDUSTRIAL QUE PROPORCIONA EMPLEO EN ZONA REGIONAL LA DISTANCIA A LA CABEZERA MUNICIPAL ES DE 13KM.

EN ESTE POBLADO SE ENCUENTRA LA UDE TLAYECAC LA CUAL SU ACTIVIDAD DE LAS INTEGRANTES ES MAS DE COMERCIO ESTA UDE YA LLEVA 9 CICLOS TRABAJANDO CON LA EMPRESA DE FUNDACION REALIDAD POR TIEMPOS YA QUE DURANTE DOS CICLOS HAN DECIDIDO DESCANSAR POR QUE LAS TEMPORADAS Y LAS VENTAS ESTAN BAJAS Y DECIDEN ESPERARSE APENAS ACABARON DE RECIBIR SU 9NO CREDITO YA QUE PARA LA TEMPORADA DE DICIEMBRE SE VAN A SURTIR.
EN ESTA UDE SE ENCUENTRA LA SRA. AMBROSIA M. Z. LA CUAL HA ESTADO EN EL GRUPO DESDE QUE SE INICIO EN EL 2006 Y HASTA LA FECHA SIGUE CON NOSOTROS ELLA ES CASADA TIENE 4 HIJOS 2 ESTUDIAN Y LOS OTROS 2 YA TRABAJAN Y EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITO ESTE CICLO FUE DE $6000 PESOS  Y LO A A INVERTIR EN SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES PARA COMPRAR HUEVO, LECHE, POLLO, PAN, AZUCAR, SAL, REFRESCO, SABRITAS, ETC, SU NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN CALLE 24 DE FEBRERO NO 28 DEL PUEBLO DE TLAYECAC NOS COMENTA QUE ATIENDE A MAS DE 200 PERSONAS AL DIA YA QUE SU NEGOCIO ESTA EN UNA AVENIDA PRINCIPAL Y ESTA CERCA DE EL CECYTE ENTONCES TODOS LOS ESTUDIANTES PASAN A COMPRAR CON ELLA NOS COMENTA QUE SU NEGOCIO A ENFRENTADO ALGUNOS RETOS QUE SIN EMBARGO NO SE HAN DEJADO Y HAN SALIDO ADELANTE YA QUE HACE 2 AÑOS SE PUSO UNA TIENDA ENFRENTE A LA DE ELLLA Y AL INICIO DIO TODOS SUS PRODUCTOS MUY BARATOS ENTONCES TODOS LOS CLIENTES SE FUERON PARA ALLA PERO PASADO UNOS MESES SUBIERON TODOS LOS PRECIOS Y ESA TIENDA QUEBRO Y TODOS SUS CLIENTES REGRESARON CON ELLA.
EL SUEÑO MAS GRANDE QUE ELLA TIENE ES ABRIR OTRA TIENDA POR OTRA CALLE DE TLAYECAC Y HEREDARSELA A SU NIETO QUE ESTA CHIQUITO PERO ES SU RAZON PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE YA QUE SU HIJA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y ELLA LA APOYA EN TODO.
POR ULTIMO AGRADECIO A FUNDACION REALIDAD POR SEGUIR CONFIANDO EN ELLAS YA QUE COMO HAN DESCANSADO Y VUELVEN A REGRESAR TODO ES SIN NINGUN PROBLEMA.
A KIVA POR AYUDAR A LA EMPRESA A QUE PUEDA SEGUIR AYUDANDO A PERSONAS QUE EN VERDAD NECESITAMOS EL CREDITO PARA PODER HACER CRECER NUESTRO NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
The town of Tlayecac, which is part of the municipality of Ayala Morelos, is located approximately 20km from the city of Cuautla. The town has several approaches but the easiest and nearest is via the Mexico-Oaxaca highway. When you reach the turn-off marked “Tlayecac-Amayuca” turn right and follow that road all the way to the town of Tlayecac. Agriculture is the main activity in this town, especially corn and sorghum, which is cultivated by 195 farmers on 1234 hectares. The most common livestock is sheep, pigs and goats. Among other important activities is commerce because the industrial zone that provides employment in the region is located here; the distance to the municipal seat is 135km. This town is home to the Tlayecac communal bank in which most of the members are engaged in commerce. This group is in its ninth loan cycle with FUNDACION REALIDAD although they took a couple of cycles off because sales were low and they preferred to wait so they have just now gotten their 9th loan in order to stock up for the December season. Ambrosia M. Z. has been a group member since its founding in 2006. She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are students and two are employed. She requested 6000 pesos this cycle which will be invested in her grocery store to buy eggs, milk, chicken, bread, sugar, salt, soft-drinks, Sabritas, etc. Her business is located at #28 24 de febrero street in Tlayecac. She tells us that she has over 200 customers per day because her store is on one of the main avenues and near CECYTE (State-run technological high-schools) so many students stop by to buy from her. She relates that her business has faced some challenges but they haven’t caved in and have continued forward despite having a store open across the street from her two years ago. At first, the competition cut all its prices so all her customers went there but, eventually, that store went bankrupt and her customers returned to her. Her greatest wish is to open another store on another one of Tlayecac’s streets that she can leave to her grandson, who is still a little boy, but who is her main purpose in life and her motivation to continue working because her daughter is a single mother and Ambrosia supports her in every way. Finally, she is grateful to Fundacion Realidad for continuing to believe in them and for letting them return, having taken some time off, without any problems. She is also grateful to Kiva for helping the Fundacion so that it can continue to help people who truly need credit in order to see their businesses grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, milk, sugar, soft-drinks, Sabritas (Frito-Lay-type snacks), etc.

loans.name: Budragchaa

texts.en:
Budragchaa is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His youngest son goes to university.

During the winter, Budragchaa works at a private company as a security guard in his town. In summertime, he makes traditional Mongolian shoes by hand. In order to supplement his earnings, sometimes he also makes deel, which is a traditional Mongolian coat.

Budragchaa has been making shoes for many years now. His shoes are well known and valued by his customers for their quality and design. He sells his shoes for 60,000-80,000 tugrugs (~42-56 USD) and receives between 50-60% net profit for each pair. Budragchaa would eventually like to expand his little shoe-making shop into a factory employing several people. He is requesting a 400,000 tugrug (~280 USD) loan to purchase materials such as glue, leather, rubber, and tools for his shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as glue, leather, rubber and tools

loans.name: Nguyễn
loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer, a 25-year-old who lives in the Bekaa, has been selling used metal and aluminum since 2008. He also sells old and used spare parts and accessories. Samer is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business.

He is special in his work because he is a hardworking man, and his clients are his family members, friends and neighbors, as well as traders. Although he didn’t have a great deal of start-up cash, Samer decided to establish his business because it is in high demand in the region. In the future, he plans on expanding his operation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Rosa Estelita

texts.es: La Señora Rosa es un cliente nuevo que llega a la institucion por recomendación D. la hija Jaquelin quien tiene un credito vigente. La cliente tiene un kiosco o tienda dentro D. un colegio donD. venD. golosinas refrescos y  es la unica que venD. comida rapida en los recreos, ella es quien atienD. pero tambien recibe la ayuda D. su hijo menor o en ultimo caso D. su hija jaquelin cuando va a comprar mercaderia. ya que por estas fechas que inician las clases que la señora Rosa necesita capital para llenar su negocio ya que con la comida rapida genera mas ingresos es que decidio elaborar tambien pasteles o queques para luego venderlos en la tienda Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a new client who comes to the institution thanks to a recommendation from her daughter Jaquelin, who has an active loan. Rosa has a kiosk or store insiD. a school where she sells sweets and refreshments. She is the only fast-food vendor during recess. She tends to the store but her youngest son, or even her daughter Jaquelin, sometimes help out when she goes out to buy merchandise. Because the new school term is about to start, Rosa needs funds to stock her business and, because fast-food generates more income, she has decided to make cakes and pastries to sell in her store. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items and merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Cleofes

texts.es:
doña Maria Cleofes C. tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son de su primer matrimonio, hoy tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de una pequeña niña de 8 años de edad. 
 
su negocio es la venta de baleadas y otros alimentos tipicos de las mañanas, esta actividad la realiza en las afueras del mercado municipal de Nacaome, todos los dias, tiene la ayuda de uno de sus hijos como de su esposo, con este trabajo han logrado mejorar su casa y han comprado un carro.
 
esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que han confiado en ella y dice que hara todo lo posible por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Cleofes C. has 4 children, 3 of whom are from her first marriage. She is 42 years old and has an 8-year-old daughter.

She sells baleadas (wheat flour tortillas filled with beans and other ingredients) and other local breakfast foods at the Nacaome municipal market every day with the help of one of her children and her husband. With this business, they have managed to improve their home and purchase a car.

She is very grateful to all the people who have trusted her, and she states that she will do everything she possibly can to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour, beans, cheese, butter, coffee, milk, sugar, drinks, juice, beef, pork, and eggs

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.ru: Сулаймонова Мукарама проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж, строитель. Сама Мукарама более 5 лет занимается торговлей, она в основном продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mukarama S. lives in the Vahdat district. She is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Mukarama has been involved in retail sales for over 5 years. She primarily sells children's clothing. She is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 41-year-old married man and father of one child. From 14 years ago, he opened a linen shop in his town where he buys pajamas, blankets, pillows etc. He cooperates with his wife who works in the village municipality to satisfy the family expenses. He has already received several micro loans from Ameen to improve his business and the final loan has from Kiva to buy inventory in good prices. He’s a punctual client and he has consistently paid on-time. 

Today, Ahmad is planning on taking another Kiva loan from Ameen of $ 2,000 so that he can continue to expand his business and purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Topoika Ole

texts.en:
Topoika Ole K. is a 30-year-old gentleman who is married to Nalakiti K.. Together they have three school-going children. Topoika has been a potato farmer for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area and most of his customers are wholesalers from the city who come to buy his produce and then sell to the city residents.

He learned about KADET through an awareness program conducted by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be Topika's second loan and he is planning to buy a new species of potato called ‘shangi’ which research has shown can do very well in this area and generate higher yields. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet demand for his farm produce and eventually become a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To plant more potatoes on a bigger piece of land

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old, married to Peter Baiya, and has one child. For the last two years, she has run a retail shop where she sells household goods in small quantities in Naivasha town.
Nancy was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy a deep freezer to put in her shop so that she can start selling milk and milk products. Nancy plans to grow her retail business as it has proved to have a good return on investment.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer for her shop to start selling milk

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn M. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Ailyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ailyn owns & operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ailyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ailyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rushuma Twimukye Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Amos, aged 30, with a family of three children, has been operating a retail shop in Itembezo trading centre, Kihihi, for over 5 years. There, he trades in a variety of products commonly used domestically like sugar, soft drinks, sodas, water, cooking oil and much more. In a week, he makes profits amounting to 40,000 shillings. He does this business alongside his other farming practices that include growing and selling tea, sorghum and millet.

Amos’s main drawback is that he has a limited variety of products in his shop that currently cannot satisfy his increasing customer demand. Therefore he is looking forward to increasing the amount of stock in his business when he gets this loan and also to expanding into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and sustain his daily life needs.

Amos also belongs to a group of members who insure each other in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his store like bags of sugar and salt and crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Josee

texts.en:
Josee was born in 1963 and is married. Josee is a farmer and a woman who is serious, because she has a big place where she can work. Josee has 10 years of experience in agriculture and livestock. She employs two people full time for her business.

Josee is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to buy more cows so she can expand her business by employing more people. Once she is able to do this, Josee will be able to earn more profit from her daily activities.

loans.use: Expanding her business of agriculture and livestock

loans.name: Cristina Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina lleva trabando junto a Emprender desde el año 2004, es cliente antigua de la institucion, anteriormente trabajo en la garantia solidaria Cistalinos, actualmente la Señora se encuentra trabajando de forma individual. La actividad a la que la cliente se dedica es la atencion de tienda de abarrotes paralelamente atiende una tienda libreria-bazar. La Señora vive con su esposo y sus dos sobrinas de las cuales se esta haciendo a cargo.  El destino del credito es de incrementar mercaderia en ambas actividades como ser Fideo, azucar, refrescos, dulces, y para la libreria comprar hojas, libros, cartulinas, lapices, boligrafos, marcadores, etc. para que asi su tienda este bien surtida.La Sra. Cristina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender Y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Señora Cristina has been working with Emprender since 2004 and is a standing client. Previously, she worked with the communal bank Cistalinos. Currently, Señora Cristina is self -employed. She runs a grocery store and a bookstore/bazaar. She lives with her husband and her two nephews, for whom she is responsible. She will use the loan to increase the amount of merchandise in both her stores with items such as noodles, sugar, soft drinks and candy, and in the bookstore with items such as paper, books, cards, pencils, pens, markers, etc., so that her store is well-stocked. Señora Cristina is a very hard-working person and is responsible with her payments. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown by granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store and bookstore

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus M. is 39 years old, married to a teacher and they have four children between the ages of 14 years and 2 years old, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. His business is located at Mwingi town – a busy area served by the Thika branch. He has been selling books to schools, students, teachers and parents of school-going children. He has been doing this business for four years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is that there are other people doing the same business as him in the area, so customers are spoilt by the choice. He works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more books to meet the demand. He hopes to own a chain of bookshops in major towns. He describes himself as very hardworking, responsible and social.

loans.use: To buy past examination papers

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband, who sells crockery sets, cups, jugs, etc. from a cart. He sells them by visiting different streets of the city named Borewala.
