Nazeeran moved to this city with her husband few years ago. She embroiders clothes for her neighborhood clients to fulfill the needs of her family.

She is the mother of a son and daughter who couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints.

With the help of a loan, Nazeeran will buy different crockery sets, cups, etc. for her husband to sell. She wants him to be successful in his business and that’s why she always supports him through every difficult time. This is the first time she has acquired a loan from any MFI, and she hopes that her husband will be able to improve his business. With the help of this investment Nazeeran’s family will be able to enjoy the basic necessities of life.

Note: In this photo, Rabia, a group member, shows her clothes selling business.

loans.use: To purchase crockery sets to sell.

loans.name: Frederico Armando

texts.pt:
Frederico Armando C. nasceu na provincia de inhambane sul de moçambique, vive maritalmente é pai de uma rapariga de 10 anos que vai a escola. Fez a 5ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições por parte dos progenitores,vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pelos seu pais que vivem em Inhambane enviando lhes uma sexta básica de 500.00mt em cada 3 meses.


Frederico muda se definitivamente para o Distrito de Namaacha quando ele começa a trabalhar nas minas de exploração da Pedra Lage(pedra preciosa) e devido a distância leva sua familia para junto dele e do seu trabalho. Porque o material de exploração era precário e assim  ezigia muito esforço, ele abandona  o emprego e inicia um negócio de venda de produtos. Hoje é dono de uma banca em sua casa onde vende produtos de 1ª necessidade (feijao, amendoim, caldo) e mais, tem viajado 2 veses por semana levando consigo uma média de 5.000.00mt e tendo de lucro 2.000.00mt mensalmente que aplica nas dispesas da casa.


Este é o segundo  empréstimo de Frederico na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos(amendoim, feijão, óleo,temperos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.000.00mt foi para o comercio.

 Esta muito feliz por ter conseguido alcançar as espectativas de manter seu negócio e vai  reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um outro empréstimo para construir um estabelecimento e deixar de vender clandestinamente.
texts.en:
Frederico Armando was born in the Inhambane province in South Mozambique. He is in a common law marriage and has a 10 year old daughter who goes to school. He went to school until 5th grade but didn't finish due to his parents' lack of conditions. He lives in his own house and helps his parents who live in Inhambane by sending them 500 meticais worth of groceries every three months. Frederico moved to the Namaacha District definitively when he started working mining precious stones in Pedra Lage. Due to the distance, he brought his family to live close to him and his work. He left his job and started a retail business because the mining equipment were precarious and that demanded a lot from him. He currently owns a store at his house where he sells staples (beans, peanuts, stock). He travels twice a week and takes 5,000 meticais with him and makes 2,000 meticais in profit, which he applies towards household expenses. This is Frederico's second loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva, in the amount of 8,000 meticais. He intends to buy products (peanuts, beans, cooking oil, seasonings and others) to increase his inventory. The previous loan was for 5,000 meticais went to his business. He is very happy to have met the expectations of keeping his business. He will pay the loan back ahead of time and request another one to build a store and stop selling informally.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (peanuts, beans, cooking oil, seasonings, and others)

loans.name: Butunduzi Abagambakamu Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
In this world, one needs a pinch of extra effort and hard work to earn a living, especially in this era of stiff competition. To maximize on this point, Francis M. of the Butunduzi Abagambakamu Group, Kyenjojo, who is 40 years and studied carpentry, has been running a carpentry workshop for close to three years. 

He makes windows, chairs, tables, doors and many more products for customers. This business is located in Butunduzi, Kyenjojo district. He has this enterprise alongside his farming practices, which earn him an additional income. He is therefore seeking this loan to help him purchase materials, including timber, nails, cover cloth and leather cover materials for chairs. This will help him to improve the quality of his products and get him more customers, thus more revenue.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials like timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for her coffee crop

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 48 years old. Cynthia is married and has two children aged 27 and 26. To make a living, Cynthia owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 28 years.

Cynthia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cynthia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Caminando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO  inicia su onceavo ciclo  en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, de esta asociación podríamos decir que cuenta con socias antigua, sin embargo también tiene socias nuevas.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está integrada por la  presidenta, la tesorera y la secretaria de actas.

La señora  presidenta Zulema es una mujer de 32  años de edad, casada con dos hijos, está desde hace dos ciclos en la asociación, llegó a la misma invitada por un familiar. En este corto tiempo ha logrado ganar la confianza de sus compañeras de forma que ha sido nombrada presidenta.

Desde hace cinco años trabaja en la venta de telas, polleras, centros, mantas, junto a su mamá, ambas cuentan con dos espacios de venta, un puesto en la zona 12 de Octubre y una tienda en la calle Max Paredes.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: venta de “variedades” (venta de papel higiénico, peines, pilas, agujas, sepillos de dientes, pasta dental, etc), venta de tela, polleras, mantas, venta de camisas, pensión, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa y venta de verdura.
En la foto aparece ademas el hijo mayor de una socia,viste una chompa roja, el comenta que quiso acompañarla.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Caminando Hacia el Futuro," is starting its 11th loan cycle in the central offices of Pro Mujer Bolivia in Villa Exaltacion.  We can say that this group contains some old friends; however, it also has some new members.  This group has 8 members: 7 women and one man.  The board of directors consists of the president, the treasurer, and the recording secretary. 

The president, Zulema, is a 32 year-old woman who is married and has 2 children.  She has been with this group for 2 loan cycles; she was invited to join by a relative.  Over this short period, she has managed to gain the confidence of her fellow group members, such that they named her the president.

For 5 years, she has worked selling fabric, traditional Bolivian skirts, and blankets with her mother.  They have 2 places where they sell: a post in the 12 de Octubre market and a store on the Max Paredes Street.  

With respect to the businesses that support the rest of the members of the group, they include sales of: consumer goods (toilet paper, combs, batteries, sewing needles, tooth brushes, toothpaste, etc.), fabric, skirts, blankets, shirts, meals, shoes, clothing and vegetables.

In the photograph, the oldest son of one of the members also appears in a red sweater.  He states that he wanted to come with her.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Mrs. Belen M. is from Barangay of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 38 years old, married to Danilo M. and blessed with 4 children all of are now school age.  To make a living, she presently manages an electronic repair shop business. She is also receiving support from the salary of her husband as an overseas seaman.  She’s been engaged in this kind of electronic repair shop business for 2 years already.  She is earning an average amount of not less than PHP 1,500.00 from the business. 

Just this year, Belen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and is now requesting a loan of PHP 50,000.00 as her 1st loan which will be used for the payment of the tuition fees for her children and the remaining amount for pocket money for her husband who is back working abroad.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Payment for tuition fees and pocket money for her husband for going back abroad to work.

loans.name: Alexia

texts.en: Alexia is 38 years old. She is married and has six children who are between the ages of three and fourteen. Her husband sells hardware. Alexia has a beauty salon and sells hair products and cosmetics. She has had this business for thirteen years. She has requested a loan to buy more beauty products to sell and with the profits she would like to expand her house. She says that her business is successful because she repaid the previous loan and managed to save and raise school fees for her children. She would like to get a loan of 500,000RWF in the future. Alexia has been photographed combing her client's hair.  All those pictured here have agreed to have their picture taken with her.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Majilyn

texts.en:
Majilyn Z. is from the village of San Roque. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Majilyn plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $161 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Majilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Majilyn is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.es: El señor Ireneo nacido el 12 de febrero en Chuquisaca vive con la Sra. María  con 3 hijos, hoy tiene sus tierras en alto espejo. Vive en la misma parcela donde trabaja agricultura pero también tiene su camión tiene su línea que hace servicio forestal, el siembra, arroz, yuca, Maní y también se dedica a la crianza de Chanchos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra y en la compra de cría de Chanchos, todo lo que el cosecha lo comercializa en el  mercado de El Torno, y su camión le ayuda en transportar su mercadería al mercado, es muy trabajador y responsable, trabaja toda la familia unida, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Ireneo was born February 12 in Chuquisaca, he lives with Mrs. María and their 3 children, and he has his land in alto espejo. He lives in the same plot where he works as a farmer but he also has a truck and has a route that has a forest service; he grows rice, yucca, and peanuts and also raises pigs. The money from the loan will be used to buy seeds for his crops and to buy pigs to breed, everything that he grows he sells in the El Torno market, and his truck helps him to transport his merchandize to the market. Mr. Ireneo is a very hardworking and responsible man, the whole family works united and is very grateful to the institution for all the support given to them.

loans.use: For his rice crops and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jacquilyn

texts.en:
Jacquilyn S. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 32 years old. Jacquilyn is married and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Jacquilyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jacquilyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jacquilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jacquilyn is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Jacquilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosemin

texts.en:
Rosemin G. is a farmer in a town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 46 years old and married. Rosemin's husband is also a farmer. Together, they make sure the rice and corn crops that they plant grow healthy. They also want to serve the best quality of produce to their customers. 

Rosemin is requesting for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds. She hopes that this loan will help in increasing their harvest. She is working hard as her way of thanking lenders for the financial provisions they give to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gulinora

texts.ru: Рустамова Гулинора жительница района Кубадиян. Ей 50 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Образование - высшее, педагог. Про профессии проработала 8 лет. На сегодняшний день она занимается птицеводством. Она в основном разводит кур в дальнейшем для продажи. Еще она занимается продажей яиц. В этой области уже 3 года. Целью кредита является покупка корма.
texts.en: Gulinora R. lives in the Qubadiyon district.  She is 50 years old, married and has three children.  She has a higher education, as a teacher.  She worked in that profession for 8 years.  Currently, she is involved in poultry husbandry and primarily breeds chickens for future sale.  Gulinora also sells eggs.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  The goal of this loan is a purchase of feed.

loans.use: Purchase of bird feed

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero  y es productor lechero; su esposa le ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar mas ganado (un par de vacas lecheras) para aumentar la producción de leche y sus ingresos.
Tomás tiene seis hijos;  esta actividad de producir leche es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir gastos de su familia. Vive  en casa  propia ubicada en la Localidad de Chojasivi en la Provincia Los Andes.
texts.en:
Tomas raises raises cows and produces milk. His wife helps him with these agricultural activities. With the money from the loan, he will be able to purchase more cattle (a pair of milk cows) to increase his milk production and his revenue.

Tomas has six children. Producing milk is the source of income that he has for covering his family's expenses. He lives in his own home located in the town of Chojasivi in the Province of Los Andes.

loans.use: Purchase a pair of milk cows to increase his milk production

loans.name: Frengki

texts.en:
Frengky is a 42-year-old man who is married to Thersiana. They have three children - Meksi, Putra, and Daniel. Meksi is 15 years old and is in the 3rd grade of Junior high school. Putra is 10 years old and is in the 2nd grade of Elementary school. Daniel is 5 years old and is not at school yet. Frangky and family live in the village of Pariti, which is about 35 km from the Kupang City. 

In order to meet his family's needs, Frengky runs a shrimp business. Usually he goes to sea in the afternoon around 2 pm when the weather is good and returns home at 2 am in the following day. Frengky usually uses a trawl for catching the shrimp. In a day, Frengky can drag about 2 to 3 kg of shrimp, and he sells the shrimp at about IDR 35,000 to 55,000 per kg. However, his trawl is currently broken and Frengky does not have enough money to mend it. As a result, he cannot go to catch shrimp.

Frengky tried to farm in addition to catch shrimp. He planted cabbage in a small quantity due to the limited fund that he had. Of 100 seedlings of cabbage planted, 60 of them grow and can be harvested after 3 weeks. One cabbage is sold at IDR 4,000 at the traditional market in Camplong. Frengky sees that the result of farming cabbage is quite promising for the future and so he intends to seek for a loan to support him improving the businesses.

Frengky is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on cabbage seeds, to fix the trawl and to buy a chainsaw to be leased. If the capital is still sufficient then he also plans to buy piglets for breeding. He really expects the loan can improve his family life in the future.

loans.use: to fix fishing equipment and buy cabbage seeds

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta de carne, ella trabaja en el mercado central de la ciudad de cusco en el mercado de nombre San Pedro, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Richary Runa Communal Bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ms. Irma is 39 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one son. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling meat. Irma works in the San Pedro Market, which is the central market in Cusco. She has been in this business for years and it brings her both personal and economic satisfaction. Irma is a very cheerful and responsible woman.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her meat-selling business.

Irma is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy meat for her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma, es socia del banco comunal Jesús De Nazaret del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad, su esposo es trabajador independiente.
Con los 10 años que lleva en Manuela Ramos ha comprado una máquina remalladora que le hacía buena falta para poder tener un mejor acabado en las prendas que confecciona.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 metros de tela de algodón, 1 aceite de máquina, 5 pañitos de aguja de varios números, 5 metro de tela, 2 kilos de retacería, 1 juego de reglas, 1 tijera, 3 cajitas de alfileres.
Su trabajo le genera ingresos que le pueden servir para ayudar a sus hijos que todavía están estudiando una carrera.  Ella recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en los quehaceres de la casa (los días que tienen libre), así puede avanzar con su trabajo de costura. Con Manuela Ramos ha tenido la oportunidad de tener un pequeño capital para poder trabajar y lo supo aprovechar, gracias a ello ha crecido como empresaria.
texts.en:
Wilma is a member of the “Jesús de Nazaret” communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 43 years old and her husband is self-employed.

In the ten years she’s been working with Manuela Ramos she’s purchased an overlock sewing machine she needed to better finish the items she makes.  She will use the new, 1600 new sol, loan to buy the following:  six meters of cotton fabric, one container of sewing machine lubricant, five little kits of needles in assorted numbers, five meters of fabric, two kilos of remnants, one set of rulers, one scissors and three boxes of pins.

Her work generates income that she can use to help her children who are still studying their careers.  Her children help her with the household chores (on the days they have free time) so that she can get ahead with her sewing tasks.  Manuela Ramos has given her the opportunity to have a bit of capital to work and she used it well.  Thanks to it she’s grown as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy cotton fabric.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 29 years old and lives in Sinkor. She lives with her boyfriend and they have two children that live with them and are attending school. She was able to go to school and finished 11th grade. 

She started doing business in 2000, carrying cookies and selling them around her neighborhood and around the market. In 2005 she was able to get a place in the market and now has a table where she sells rice, onions, oil, chicken stock powder and other food items. 

She likes being able to save money for herself and her children. Her business is growing and she is getting ready to open a shop. In her new business Alice will keep on selling her current products but also offer dry goods like tissue and soap. 

Alice has requested a loan to purchase tissue, soap, rice and onions. In the future, she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase tissue, soap, rice and onions

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira B. is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to an electrician.  Together they have raised two sons and a daughter. The first son and the daughter study at university, and the second son works as a confectioner. 

Six years ago Damira got a loan in the amount of 8000 soms for purchasing livestock. She repaid that loan successfully and made good money reselling livestock animals at a higher price after being fattened. The profits gained from this activity made it possible for her to pay her children’s tuition at university. 

With money received from this loan she wants to purchase three livestock animals for breeding. In the future she wants to see her children get wed and save some money to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي رجل عمره 40 سنة متزوج وهو اب لاربع اولاد يعمل في بيع العطورات والبسة له في عمله نحو 4 سنوات يرى ان عمله هو اهم ما لديه يريد ان يطوره وان يزيد من مدخوله يسعى الى تأمين العيش الجيد له ولعائلته كي يؤمن لهم مستقبل جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل ودعم المصلحة حتى يتمكن من مواجهة المنافسة التي يتعرض لها في عمله وما ينقصه سوى المادة حتى يزيد من مدخوله هو طموح يتميز عمله بالدقة والاسعار الجيدة له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق في تحسين وضع العمل وزيادة بعض البضائع
texts.en: Ali is a 40 year old married man with four children. He works as a perfume-seller and also sells clothes. He has been in this business for approximately four years. He considers his business the most important thing he has, and wants to develop it in order to increase his income. He aspires to secure a good future and a comfortable standard of living for himself and his family. He lacks the financial capital to be able to increase his income. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock and attain the financial support necessary to face the competition his business is exposed to. He is ambitious and his business is distinguished by his precision in his work, and his good prices. He has good credit history with al-Majmoua and the last loan helped improve his shop and increase his stock.

loans.use: to purchase new stock .

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothing and herbal medicines. Flordeliza is seeking to borrow 14,000 PHP ($325) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Flordeliza has been fortunate enough to finance her business activities in recent years through six prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco , es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa e hijos , don Francisco su planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , la mayor afectación que se le presenta en el cultivo es no poder contar con suficiente capital para estar dando el mantenimiento necesario al cultivo , para que este salga en tiempo forma sin tener perdidas en tamaño , color , sabor y sobre todo en lo natural .Agradece Afodenic  atrávez de los fondo Kiva  el apoyo que le brinda a los productores para que puedan realizar su manteniendo de piña  ya que es su recurso para poder sobre vivir .
texts.en: Francisco is a small-scale farmer from Ticuantepe.  He lives together with his wife and children.  Francisco's plan for the future is to improve his living conditions.  The biggest problem he has in growing his crops is not having enough capital to provide the maintenance the crops need so that they grow on time without their height, color or taste suffering, above all, that they grow naturally.  He is grateful to Afodenic who, through Kiva funds, provide support to producers such as himself.  This means that he can provide necessary maintenance to his pineapple crops since this is how he makes money to support himself.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flora works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Flora is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas for her food vending business.

Flora has been supporting her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for her food vending

loans.name: Luber

texts.es:
Luber de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Pacora que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo. 

La actividad que desarrolla Luber es a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral y ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo oferta a sus clientes o a los diferentes mercados de la zona y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus gastos familiares.  Otra forma como obtiene más ingresos es alquilando su mototaxi. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para comprar más animales, especialmente cerdos que su comercialización es más rápida y con los ingresos que obtenga puede tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Luber es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y brindarles otras oportunidades académicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luber, age 53, lives with his wife and children in their own house.  The only service the house has is electricity.  It is located in the Parcora district, Lambayeque department.  This area is characterized by its farming, livestock, and tourist activities.

Luber raises and sells poultry and pigs.  He has them in the yard behind his house.  He feeds them balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they grow to their optimum, he sells them to his customers or at different markets in the area.  With the income that he receives he is able to pay the family expenses.  Another way that he gets more income is renting his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).

He has requested a loan of 2,200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy more animals, especially pigs.  They sell faster, and with the income that he gets he is able to have a better quality of life.

Luber is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing that he wants is for his family to get ahead and to give his children more educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Cesielyn

texts.en:
Cesielyn is a 28-year-old mother of three children around school age. She is married to a farmer in the province of Quirino. She has helped her husband manage their farming business for almost 15 years now. She is grateful for their determination in growing their farm because the profits earned from it greatly help in covering their daily needs and the school allowances of their children.

Cesielyn is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy farm supplies needed to maintain their farm, such as corn seed and fertilizers. Because of the loan, Cesielyn anticipates a larger amount of income from the next harvest, for she is providing sufficient farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as corn seed and fertilizers, needed to maintain their farm

loans.name: Pascualina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 14 anos de idade todos vaõ a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, é negociante permanente de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 11 anos e tem um rendimento de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no TCHUMA no valor de 4.000.00mt destinado ao comercio,o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim,oleo,arroz,refrescos,eoutros ).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt tambem para o comercio.  
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e concluir o seu estabelecimento, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Pascualina was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name. She is a single mother of two children, aged 10 and 14, who attend school. Pascualina stopped going to school after the 7th Grade owing to her financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.
She has never left Maputo. She has been a full-time business woman selling essential items for more than 11 years; she earns a monthly salary of 3,000MTs which covers her household expenses. She also saves a little in her Millennium BIM bank account.
She has previously borrowed 4,000MTs from TCHUMA, another microfinance institution, for her business and she repaid this with ease. She heard about Hluvuku through her friend who is also a client. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, for 25,000MTs, which she intends to use to buy products such as peanuts, oil, rice, drinks and other items. Her first loan was for 10,000MTs and was also used for her business.
She hopes to expand her business and finish building her premises. She intends to apply for further loans with Hluvuku in order to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (peanuts, oil, rice, drinks and other items).

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. She is married and is selling natural medicines in the Philippines.

Estrella requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Estrella would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang (shown in the photo with her son) and her husband, Sichann, are rice farmers. Additionally, Sokheang is also a tailor and her husband does construction work. They have been married since 2004 and have two young children – one son and one daughter. They live in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sokheang is asking for a loan of $700 to buy fabrics for her tailoring business and rice seed.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her tailoring business and rice seed.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.
 
Irene has a shop that sells vegetables like string beans, eggplants, okra & squash. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Irene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Irene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Elmira yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Elmira rodilas v 1958 qodu.
Ona uje 15 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsay v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci. Eto yeyo pervaya ssuda.
texts.en: Elmira is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family.  She is married and has one child.  Elmira was born in 1958.  She has been involved in poultry farming for 15 years and breeds chickens.  She now needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy chickens.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela cuenta con 47 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo 3 estudian, el mayor esta en primer año de prepa, otro en primer grado de secundaria y el más pequeño en segundo año de primaria, puesto que los demás están casados y tienen su propia vida, tiene una pequeña farmacia desde hacen 20 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este buen negocio ya que es muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias, las cuales le ayudarían para apoyar a su esposo, con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos, tanto para tener una mejor solvencia económica, como para tener un buen nivel de vida, lo cual logro con mucho esfuerzo, el crédito que recibió lo continua invirtiendo en la compra de mas medicamentos, sueros, vitaminas, analgésicos, pastillas, antigripales, etc.
Doña Ángela dice que una de las metas para su negocio, es la de continuar invirtiéndole mucho mas, ya que tiene como objetivo ampliar su farmacia, y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, para continuar ahorrando y así poder asegurar la carrera profesional de sus hijos.
Ella está muy agradecida con fundación realidad, pero sobre todo con los donadores por la confianza que le están brindando, ya que dice gracias a esta ayuda ahora tiene un mejor negocio y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela is 47 years old.  She is a widow and has six children, only three of whom are still in school.  The eldest is in his first year of senior high school, another is in the first year of high school and the youngest is in the second year of elementary school.  The rest are married and lead their own lives.  Ángela has a small pharmacy which she has been running for 20 years.

Ángela says that she decided to start out in this business as it is very profitable and would make her good money which would help her to support her husband with their household expenses and family expenses.  The business has put her in a better financial position and she is able to enjoy a good standard of living.  She has achieved all this through a lot of hard work.  Ángela will use the loan that she received to continue investing in the purchase of more medicines, saline solution, vitamins, painkillers, tablets, flu remedies, etc.

Ángela says that one of the goals she has for her business is to continue investing in it a lot more as her goal is to expand her pharmacy and thereby improve and increase her profits so that she can continue saving and thereby guarantee her children's higher education.

Ángela is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and, above all, the lenders, for the trust that they are placing in her.  She says that thanks to this help she now has a better business and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more medicines, saline solution, vitamins, painkillers, tablets, flu remedies, etc.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 48 years old. He is married and a father of three children. Raphael runs a cafe on a daily basis, a business that has been in operation for the last four years. 

He was recently introduced to KADET LTD  and this marks his first loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables, and cereals. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables, and cereals

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es casada, tiene 30 años D. edad, es D. profesión maestra D. educación, lleva ocho años D. experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que también es maestro D. educación..

DeciD. solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra D. terreno ya que espera tener este inmueble y mejorar su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is married, thirty years old, and works as a school teacher. She has eight years of experience in this work, with her husband’s support who is a school teacher too.

She is asking for a loan to use to buy land and she hopes that by having this property to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Kheng and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Kheng is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase recyclable materials to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials to resell.

loans.name: Lisse

texts.en:
Lisse is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Sasina.  She is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Lisse owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Lisse has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lisse joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lisse has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  Lisse is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase a new fishing boat to replace the old one. This loan will be the 2nd one taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Lisse plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat to replace the old one

loans.name: Ulduza

texts.ru:
Eto vtoraya ssuda Ulduza, ves yeyo kredit bil pogashen vovremya bez zaderjok. Ona shitayetsya nashim xoroshim chlenom. Ulduza ochen blagodarna Kive i Lenderam za predostavlennuyu ssudu. Eto ssuda yey ochen pomogla v uludshenii biznessa. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. 
Ulduza uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. 
Ona zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Ulduza yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Absheron regione posolok Masazir vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Ulduza 46 let. 


http://partners.kiva.org/pa2/loan/170701
texts.en: This is Ulduza's second loan, her former loan was repaid on time without any delay.  She is considered a member of good standing.  Ulduza is extremely thankful to Kiva and its lenders for granting her a loan.  Her first loan really helped her improve her business.  Currently she needs 2,000 AZN which will be used to buy sheep and increase the quantity of livestock for sale.  Ulduza has been working in animal husbandry and raising sheep for 9 years already.  She is married and has  four children. Ulduza is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli.  She now lives in the settlement of Masazir in the Absheron region with her husband and children.  Ulduza is 46 years old.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem, 29, is a married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district. She has a common law relationship with her husband who is skilled at building stone and wooden houses. Her husband has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses from place to place. Sem presently has three children who depend on her income. 

Sem and her husband have been paying money for taxis to get to work, or anywhere, because they don't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, Sem is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which will allow her and her husband to commute to their work location.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Dukerebuke Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne est une commerçante de bière  industrielle et Fanta, âgé de 26 ans. Elle exerce son métier depuis 3 ans.Elle habite à Gitega.Elle était élève avant de se lancer dans le commerce.Elle a étudié jusqu’en 10e année secondaire,elle est mariée à  Hermès, ensemble ils ont 2 enfants qui étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital et  acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière et Fanta pour gagner plus.
Il est membre du groupe communautaire « DUKEREBUKE»
texts.en: Joselyne is a vendor of commercially produced beer and Fanta; she is 26 years old. She has been in this business for three years. She lives in Gitega. She was a student before launching into this business. She remained in school until the 10th year of secondary studies. She is married to Hermès, and they have two children, who are in schoo

loans.use: to add to her working capital and stock up on cases of beer and Fanta [for sale] in order to increase her income

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old, married to Mohamed, and they have two children. She has run a retail shop for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase cooking fat, maize flour, and sugar for her business. Her hope is to have a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchse stock of maize flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Faalulugaina

texts.en:
Faalulugaina is thirty-four years of age and is married with two children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Faalulugaina needs a loan of WST 1,500 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 150 or US $63 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Faalulugaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faalulugaina's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Verohanitra Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Verohanitra est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 42 ans, elle est divorcée. Elle loue une maison. Le nombre d’enfants est de deux  dont l’ainé est déjà marié, l’autre de 13 ans est en classe de sixième. La réussite de son enfant dans ses études constitue sa priorité, à cela s’ajoute l’amélioration des conditions de vie.
Verohanitra a comme activité la vente de sandales depuis qu’elle est mariée. Au début, elle était commerçante ambulante dans le domaine, mais quand elle est tombée enceinte, elle a cherché un point de vente fixe. En outre, la quantité de produits augmente et le transport est devenu de plus en plus difficile. Le développement de l’activité dépend de la qualité  et de la diversification des produits. Elle est à son cinquième  prêt pour la développer.

loans.use: acheter des sandales

loans.name: Enma Grisel

texts.en:
My name is Emma B. and I make and sell fast food like burritos, breakfasts, bread with beans, cheese tortillas, enchiladas, baleadas(honduran taco) and lunches. I have had my business for 4 years and my daughters help me cook. I have good customers because my business is located in from of a high school, my business generates an income to support my family and my goal is to increase my inventory in order to increase sales and to satisfy my clients and with the profits remodel my home(business) andto fincance the education of my two children.

Loan Use: Purchase sausages, plantains, beans, tortillas, vegetables, butter, salt,oil, spices, sodas, fruits, cheese and bread.

Mi nombre es Enma B. me dedico a la produccion y venta de comidas rapidas, como ser burritas, desayunos, pan con frijoles, tortillas con quesillo, enchiladas, baleadas, almuerzos, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años y me ayudan a cocinar mis hijas, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada al frente de un colegio publico, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder vender mas comida y asi satisfacer a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa) y darles estudio a mis dos hijas

loans.use: Compra de chorizos, platanos, frijoles, tortillas, vegetales, manteca, sal, aceite, especias, refrescos, frutas, queso, pan

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar H. is a local taxi driver in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Anar is looking for funding so that he can purchase new tires for his taxi so that he can keep his cab on the road.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for his Taxi Cab

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris I. is 26 years old married with two (2) children. She beautifies people hair in her community. She hails from Benin, Edo State, Nigeria. Wishes to borrow $150 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more hair dressing equipment

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 31 years old, married and has one child. Her husband works as a farmer. She has a grocery store at her home where her neighbors come to buy. She is part of the group “Chiflon 4”, together with: Magdalena Diaz Aguilar (who sells food and breakfast from home), Maricruz Gordillo Lopez (who sells shoes), and Petrona Hernandez Velasquez (who sells vegetables door-to-door). With the loan, they all want to invest in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses, and this way increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

CONSUELO TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD , CASADA TIENE UN HIJO SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CAMPESINO ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA EN LA QUE COMPRAN SUS VECINOS DE LA COMUNIDAD . ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO CHIFLON 4 JUNTO CON : MAGDALENA DIAZ AGUILAR ( VENDE COMIDAS Y DESAYUNOS EN SU CASA ) MARICRUZ GORDILLO LOPEZ ( VENDE ZAPATOS )Y PETRONA HERNANDEZ VELASQUEZ (VENTA DE VERDURAS DE PUERTA EN PUERTA).CON EL PRESTAMO TODAS ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MERCADERIAS PARA SUS NEGOCIOS Y AUMENTAR ASI SUS INGRESOS

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Ouedraogo

texts.en: Ouedraogo J. P., “African cow-boy,” is 29 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and their 3 children in Port-Bouët, very populated suburbs in the south of Abidjan District. Two children are in primary school, and the youngest is a baby boy of 10 months. He is a meat and cow skin wholesaler at the Port-Bouët slaughter-house of cattle. The cow skins are sold to local shoe makers. P. has more than 8 years of experience in this business. He joined AE&I microcredit program in June 2005 and has already taken loans from AE&I that he reimbursed in a good manner. P. will use the loan to purchase cows. P. is dynamic and ambitious.

loans.use: Ouedraogo Pierre will use the loan to purchase cows

loans.name: Rosario Ofelia

texts.es:
I dedicate myself to the sale of prepared snacks at a school in the city of Nuevo Laredo. This is my business in which my mother-in-law and I work. I am requesting a loan of $1,000 for the purchase of a freezer in order to expand the variety of goods in my store.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Me dedico a la venta de alimentos preparados en una escuela de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este es mi negocio en el trabajamos mi suegra y yo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de un congelador y surtir mas la tienda.

loans.use:
Purchase a freezer and merchandise

Comprar un congelador y mercancía

loans.name: Ponsiano

texts.es:
Mr. Ponciano S. has a store in the neighborhood of Fátima of the Eastern City; he is married to Fidencia and they have 4 children who are all married.

Ponciano has had his store for more than 20 years, and his was one of the first in the neighborhood. One of his daughters lives with the family and helps with the business.

The store is well-stocked, however Ponciano would like a loan in order to purchase merchandise such as pasta, meat, fruit, sugar, chicken, eggs and other items since this is the time of year when demand increases quite a bit.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Ponciano S. tiene un mí mercado en el barrio Fátima de Ciudad del Este; el esta casado con la señora Fidencia y tienen 4 hijos que ya están todos casados.

Ponsiano tiene una despensa hace ya más de 20 años, el mismo fue uno de los primeros en el barrio. Una de sus hijas vive con ellos y le ayuda en el negocio.

Su negocio esta bien surtido, no obstante, desea adquirir un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como fideos, carnes, frutas, azúcar, pollo, huevos entre otros ya que en esta época del año la demanda aumenta bastante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as pasta, meat, fruit, sugar, chicken, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesús L. is the mother of three children and she is responsible for supporting them. For ten years she has worked selling clothing in a location in the central market of Chinandega.

Despite the difficult financial situation she has gone through she has been able to reach a different quality of life and with enough hard work and sacrifice she has been able to support her three children providing them with education and food. It is important to remember that the clothing business is very competitive because there are many clothes sellers.

Over the past year and a half she has received 8 loans through CEPRODEL and has wisely invested them in the remodeling of her shop and above all in the support of her three children.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria de Jesús L. es madre de tres hijos a los que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener. Actualmente tiene 10 años de laborar en el negocio de la venta de ropa en una localidad del mercado central de Chinandega.

A pesar de la difícil situación económica que ha atravesado ha logrado alcanzar un nivel de vida un poco diferente ya que con suficiente esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos brindándole educación y alimentación. Es menester recordar que el negocio de venta de ropa es muy competitivo ya que hay muchos comerciantes de este producto.

Ella ha realizado desde hace un año y medio 8 créditos con Ceprodel invirtiéndolos sabiamente en la remodelación de su local y sobre todo en la manutención de sus tres hijos.

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Since 1998, life of Mrs. Dinh Thi L. family was very difficult. The income from her and her husband were just enough to send her children to school. Her only solution at that time was to breed the animals at home. Being encouraged to join the Fund, and realized that the Fund’s working mechanism was suitable for her family, Mrs. L. joined the Fund. Taking advantage of living near a factory, and being sociable, she switched to selling vegetables and food. Her main customers are the factory workers. She has more and more customers and her income is stable now. Currently, her husband is a motorbike taxi rider, helping her repay the money weekly. Her 2 children are workers. Her family income is 320 USD/ month. She would like to be a long-term member of the Fund and borrow more money to expand her business, and increases the family income. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more vegetables and food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Về nghỉ chế độ năm 1998, cuộc sống của gia đình chị Đinh Thị Lượng, 44 tuổi, khi đó cũng rất khó khăn. Lương của hai vợ chồng chị cũng chỉ đủ nuôi 2 con ăn học, chị không biết làm gì thêm ngoài việc ở nhà chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ. Đuợc chị em vận động vào Quỹ, sau khi tìm hiểu thấy cơ chế phù hợp với gia đình, chị đã mạnh dạn tham gia vay vốn. Tận dụng điều kiện thuận lợi là gần cổng nhà máy, lại thân quen nhiều chị em trước kia làm cùng nên chị đã chuyển sang buôn bán rau, thực phẩm. Đối tượng chủ yếu là các công nhân trong nhà máy, lượng khách hàng ngày đến với chị khá đông, thu nhập thường xuyên và ổn định. Hiện nay, chồng chị Lượng hàng ngày chạy xe ôm góp tiền trả tuần, hai con chị đi làm công nhân, thu nhập của cả gia đình hàng tháng đạt 320USD. Tâm sự của chị và gia đình là sẽ tham gia lâu dài với Quỹ để vay vốn lớn hơn mở rộng các mặt hàng, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 950USD để mua thêm rau quả, thực phẩm.

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
N. Mahmud is 40 years old. He is a cattleman and he has been in this business for seven years. Currently Mahmud has a turnover in cattle of 9000.00 Somoni (US$2500.00). The business is stable and generates the main income for his large family and allows him to make savings for the future of his three kids.

Now Mahmud requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of seven months. He is planning to purchase cattle and fodder. Mahmud has had loans from IMON several times and has proved himself a reliable client. So, he promises to pay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Ms. Sareth S., 39 and single, has lived in the village of Prk Rang in Kandal Province since she was a child.  She is a garment worker earning about $2 per day in the factory located next to her village.  However, Sareth would now like to start an animal husbandry business in her village and therefore is requesting a loan of $525 to purchase some pigs to begin this enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has two children, ages 11 and 2. Veronica owns a small food store and a video show room; she started this business in 2001. Every day, she works from 7 am to 8 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

Veronica now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items (rice, beans, and vegetables) for her food sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of more food items (rice, beans, and vegetables) for a sales business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa* and Alfredo are a married couple who have been growing citrus fruits for over 30 years. After much effort in this field, they have been able to meet the needs of their only child, who is 2 years old. Their desire to help their son’s wishes come true drives them to request a loan in order to improve the quality of their crops and increase production.

*Only Alfredo is pictured above. Elsa was working outside of the region when Kiva's partner MFI (Microfinanzas PRISMA) took this picture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa y Alfredo, son una pareja de esposos que se dedica al cultivo de cítricos por mas de 30 años y que con el esfuerzo puesto en su labor han podido satisfacer las necesidades de su único hijo de 2 años. Su deseo de contribuir con el cumplimiento de los sueños a futuro de su pequeño los conducen a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos e incrementar su número.

loans.use: Increase capital to improve crop quality and quantity

loans.name: Girasol Ii Group

texts.en:
The women from the Girasol II loan group are from Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, a very small town in the highlands. They enjoy working together and are excited to access a loan. The women that comprise the Girasol II group raise livestock for a living. They buy and sell cows and bulls of different ages. Some of them sell the grown animal while others butcher it and sell the meat to butcher shops. They raise the cattle over a period of time and have established a business cycle. Most of their families have other means of income apart from raising livestock and dedicate a part of their land for grazing purposes.

Despite the rise in the price of a grown cow or bull from 300 to 800 USD, purchasing calves and raising them involve substantial costs. The animals are raised for 7 to 8 months. Since raising cattle involves an initial investment, being able to access loans is very important. Loans give these families a safety net which allows them to invest in feed, corn and vitamins for the cattle.

The credit has allowed them to grow their business and investments bit by bit. Most of these women began with small loans of under 50 USD. Today, they borrow and repay loans that are on average from 300 to 400 USD.

Reyna G. began her micro-enterprise raising and selling chicken. Currently, she is raising half a dozen of her own cattle. She described her venture as separate from her husband’s affairs. She takes out the loan, raises the cattle, sells the meat and repays the loans after making a profit. The loans provide her with the flexibility to maintain her own cattle business while raising three children.

Money is on these womens' minds very often, so that they can support a happy, healthy and prosperous family. Their livelihood is contingent upon having the peace of mind that there is cash to cover expenses while they build a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, cattle feed and other fencing equipment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 22 years old. She is a single woman. She became a hair designer in 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Josephine now hopes for a loan to open a salon for her business.

loans.use: To open a salon for her business

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria sells cow's milk to PIL Andina, S.A., a company that distributes dairy products. The company pays her every two weeks for this service. Gregoria also has a grocery store. Both activities are her principal sources of income. With them, she covers the costs of raising her three children.

Gregoria lives in the Chijipina Chico community, in the Omasuyo province, in the department of La Paz (three hours from the city of El Alto).

This credit will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality because Gregoria hopes to increase her production of milk.

This is her second credit with Impro, and she receives it without difficulty because of her good payment record.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gregoria es productora de leche de vaca, vende su producto a PIL Andina S.A. empresa que distribuye productos lácteos. Por este servicio la empresa le paga quincenalmente, Gregoria también tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ambas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso, con ellas cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos.

Gregoria vive en la Comunidad Chijipina Chico, Provincia Omasuyo del Departamento de La Paz (a tres horas de la Ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito será usado para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad ya que desea incrementar su producción de leche.

Es su segundo crédito con Impro y puede acceder sin dificultad al préstamo por su buen comportamiento de pago.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tidiane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tidiane K. est âgé de 23 ans est célibataire et père   d’un (1) enfant. Il vit dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali), dans une famille traditionnelle avec son enfant, ses frères et soeurs, son père, sa mère et les autres parents 
Pour des raisons de pauvreté, Tidiane l’aîné de la famille fut obligé d’abandonner les études et entamer une activité génératrice de revenus afin de venir en appui à ses parents (comme l’exige la tradition). Ainsi il entama l’apprentissage du métier de tailleur auprès de plusieurs maîtres tailleurs de la ville de Ségou puis de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Après huit (8) ans d’expériences, il devient un maître tailleur connu de tout Ségou. Son atélier  situé au quartier Darsalam est très visité par une clientèle très variée.
Afin de satisfaire les demandes de plus en plus croissantes et exigeantes de cette clientèle, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle  il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre et une armoire pour la garde des tissus et habits.
Monsieur Tidiane Keïta compte  réaliser  50.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour subvenir essentiellement aux besoins de sa famille très nombreuse.
texts.en:
Mr. Tidiane K., 23, is single and the father of one child. He lives in the neighborhood called Darsalam of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali), in a traditional family with his child, his brothers and sisters, his father, mother, and other relatives.

Due to poverty, Tidiane, the eldest in the family, was obliged to leave his studies and begin to earn money so as to help his parents (as tradition demands). Thus he took up an apprenticeship with several master tailors of the town of Ségou, then of Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). After 8 years of experience, he became a master tailor, known by all in Ségou. His workshop situtated in the Darsalam neighborhood is frequented by a very varied clientele.

So as to satisfy the growing demands of these exigent customers, he decided to become a member of the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is presently on his first individual loan. He plans to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine and a wardrobe for his workshop to keep his cloth and suits.

Mr. Tidiane Keïta expects to make 50,000 F CFA which he will use essentially for the basic needs of his very large family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine and a wardrobe

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Hace 4 años en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino el joven Juan Carlos V. inició una pequeña mini pulpería el cual no prestaba las condiciones de infraestructura y además vendía pocos productos. Hoy en dia a medida que los años vinieron transcurriendo ha logrado surtir mucho su pulpería y es por esta razón que se ha levantado muy satisfactoriamente y además ha sido un excelente comerciante en su municipio.

Ceprodel ha sido un apoyo fundamental para este joven por lo que le ha apoyado con créditos que los ha usado directamente en la compra de los productos para el negocio. Una vez más acude a Ceprodel con el mismo objetivo ya que son sus metas mejorar y seguir creciendo perfilándose como un gran comerciante.
texts.en:
Four years ago, the young man Juan Carlos V. opened a small mini-store in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. He couldn’t borrow money to improve the condition of the building, and he sold very few items. Now with the passage of time, he has succeeded in stocking his store well, and for this reason he has made great progress and is considered an excellent businessman in the municipality. Ceprodel has been a fundamental support for this young man, and the organisation has helped him with loans that he has used to purchase products for the business. Once again he is approaching Ceprodel with the same goal of reaching his objectives and expanding the business. His plan to become a great businessman is taking shape.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sénadé

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de sept enfants, Mme K. Sénadé vit avec son mari instituteur à Afagnan. Afin de contribuer aux nombreuses charges de la famille et aider son mari, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des noix de palmistes qu’elle achète aux paysans et qu’elle revend aux industries productrices d’huiles végétales. Pour améliorer cette activité et avoir une part considérable de ce marché prometteur dans la région, elle sollicite  un financement pour augmenter la quantité de noix de palme à offrir à ses clients. Cela lui assurera un revenu considérable qui lui permettra de faire face aux besoins d’éducation de ses enfants sans soucis majeurs.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of seven children, Mrs. Sénadé K. lives in Afagnan with her husband, a schoolteacher. In order to help her husband with the numerous family expenses, she started a business that consists in purchasing palm nuts from farmers, and in reselling them to companies that produce vegetable oil. To bolster her business and grab a fair share of this promising market, she's seeking this loan to increase the quantity of nuts she has to sell. This will ensure her important revenues, which will enable her to provide for the education of her children without much concern.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm nuts to be transformed in vegetable oil

loans.name: San Juan Evangelista Group

texts.en:
The St. John the Evangelist Village Bank is located in the Asención community of the Yauli District, Huancavelica Department. This beautiful area has many llamas, since it is surrounded by beautiful grazing spots and nearby ranches. The women in this group have few resources and work primarily in agriculture, while some sell vegetables, fruits and sweets in the city of Huancavelica. A few work as artisans. 

Valentina R. D. T. is married and has five children. She has a store which she has been stocking with a wider variety of merchandise since she began taking out loans. She now also sells canisters of gas (for cooking). Her village bank has always been very supportive of her, since it taught her how to save and her savings have helped her through tough times. Thanks to the group training sessions given by her group’s loan officer, Valentina has improved her business. With this loan, Valentina plans to buy more gas canisters for her business. Her dream is to open a large store and for her children to graduate with professional degrees. She plans to use her savings to help two of her children get their degrees. 

Vicenta C. is married and has six children. She sells firewood and dry goods from a tent, since her house is still under construction. Vicenta suffered through the death of her 18-year old daughter which left her depressed. She plans to use her loan to buy firewood for her business. Her dream is for her children to grow up to have better lives than she is. 

Sabina P. is separated and has three children. She buys and sells mutton, pigs, hens and guinea pigs. Sabina has learned how to command respect and value herself, which led her to separate from her first husband. Her children were being psychologically abused, and her husband fractured her arm and injured her spine. She is now rehabilitated, however, and is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise to stock her kiosk. Her dream is to be a businesswoman and run a transport business. She met her current partner at a village bank meeting.

loans.use: The St. John the Evangelist Village Bank needs a loan of $4550 for various businesses. Valentina plans to buy more gas canisters for her business.

loans.name: Annonciate

texts.en:
Greetings from Annonciate M. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Annonciate is 29 years old and still single.

This entrepreneur owns a tailor workshop where she makes various women's clothes for people in the area. She also makes school uniforms for primary students. She has 5 sewing machines and employs 2 people in the workshop. She earns about US$ 210 from the sewing workshop.

Annonciate is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Frws to buy more sewing materials for her workshop. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: buying more sewing materials for her workshop

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom Y., 18, mother of a 2-year old child,  lives in Prey Me Long Thboung village in Takeo province. She owns a mall grocery store, which is going well.  She wants to expand her business and is asking for a to buy more grocery items for her store. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Mun La, a construction worker, makes a small income to support the family. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale in her store.

loans.name: Balamna

texts.fr: Balamna H. a pour activité principale la vente de céréales, c’est un commerce qu’elle pratique depuis 1998, étant en besoin de se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour pouvoir s’acheter 04 sacs de maïs et 8sacs de sorgho. Cela lui permettrai aussi de satisfaire convenablement à la demande. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est un marin.
texts.en:
Balamna H. works mainly in selling grain. This is commerce she has been doing since 1998. Needing to restock, she is requesting from WAGES a loan to buy 4 sacks of corn and 8 sacks of sorghum. This will also enable her to satisfy the demand appropriately. She is married and the mother of four. Her husband is a sailor.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and sorghum

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
JOVITA RAMÍREZ D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. Oscar Benavidez N° 651 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 65 años, 05 hijos, su esposo es jubilado.

	Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa y su primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, uso para fortalecer su negocio D. abarrotes, ya que antes las compras la realizaba al día, y ahora lo podía hacer semanalmente.

El último préstamo que recibió fue D. S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, ésto le permite realizar compras en mayor volumen y por enD. mas cómodo en abarrotes todo al por mayor, arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite y bebidas gaseosas que tiene buena salida en estos meses. 

Felicita a Manuela Ramos por la facilidad D. los préstamos, y recomienda a sus amigas que saquen solo lo necesario y que esté a su alcance, para no demorarse en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
JOVITA RAMÍREZ D. P., 65, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("the Fortress"). She lives in the Calleria district with her husband who is retired. They have five children. Jovita runs a small general store out of her home. The first loan that she received from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos (300 soles) was used to solidify her store, because before the loan she had to buy supplies daily, and after the loan, she could restock every week. The loan that she is requesting now (1300 soles) will allow her to purchase groceries wholesale (rice, sugar, pasta, oil, soda) that have a quick turnaround. Jovita is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for providing loans, and to her friends she recommends to borrow only what they need and what they can pay back comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and sodas to restock store

loans.name: Adela Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Marisol es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, estudia administración en la universidad, Marisol vende celulares, accesorios para celulares, recargas, tarjetas y servicio técnico, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en un local alquilado.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para celulares.
Los sueños de Marisol son ampliar su negocio y culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Two Thousand Communal Bank. She is 32 years old, single, has one son, and is studying administration at the university. Marisol sells cellular phones, accessories for cellular phones, chargers, phone cards, and technical service. Her business is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho in a rented space. Marisol needs a loan of 600 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of cellular phone accessories. Marisol dreams of expanding her business and finishing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying animals for his land and some seeds

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Amanecer” se encuentra representado por la señora Catalina y  esta conformado por 12 socios los cuales obtienen sus ingresos D. diferente modo, algunos con la venta D. productos como el pan casero, ropa, abarrotes y comida, pero una mayoría del grupo se dedica al servio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del transporte público existe mucha demanda D. pasajeros pero también la competencia, es por esta razón que los socios requieren D. un capital para refaccionar sus vehículos y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio veloz y sin complicaciones mecánicas, entre las socias que se dedican a la venta D. productos requieren D. capital para la compra D. insumos y materiales para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se encuentra cursando su tercer ciclo juntos demostrando tener aptitudes para el manejo y administración D. los fondos otorgados y responsabilidad con los pagos.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevo Amanecer" is represented by Mrs. Catalina and has 12 members who obtain their income in different ways. Some sell products such as homemaD. bread, clothes, groceries, and food, but a majority of the group works in public transportation of passengers. The demand within public transportation of passengers is high but so is the competition, and for that reason the members require capital to buy spare parts for the vehicles and be able to offer a better and faster service without mecanical complications. The members who work in sales need capital to purchase supplies and material to improve sales and increase income in order to offer a better life quality to their families.
