A majority of the members of the group are in their third season together showing aptitudes in the management and administration of the loans and responsibility with the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Sara

texts.fr: K. Sara est née vers 1984 à Adjohoun dans le Département du l'Ouémé. Mais Sara vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Sara est mariée à AHOVI Aubin. Sara a un seul enfant qui n'est pas encore en âge d'aller à l'école. Sara vend de l'huile et des légumes chez elle à la maison. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Sara va faire ses achats et revient chez elle pour proposer ses produits à la population de son quartier. Sara a eu déjà de crédit de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Sara a fini de rembourser le premier crédit qu'elle a pris à ALIDé et demande actuellement un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour continuer de développer son activité dans le but de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. Sara was born around 1984 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County. But Sara lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to AHOVI Aubin and has just one child who is not yet old enough to go to school. Sara sells oil and vegetables out of her house. At Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, she makes her purchases and comes back home to offer her merchandise to the people in the district. She has already had a loan from ALIDÉ and is currently asking for a second loan to continue developing her business with the goal of satisfying the customer demand better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 25-liter drums of peanut oil and a hectare of vegetables

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina M. se dedica con mucho entusiasmo al negocio de pulpería el cual estableció desde hace 4 años en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y preocupada por su negocio y para ello hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería para comercializarlos en su localidad y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Cristina M. works, with much enthusiasm, at her small grocery store which she started 4 years ago in the municipality of Telica in the city of León. She is very hard-working and concerned about her business; thus she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to be used to purchase supplies for her store to sell to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to sell in grocery store

loans.name: Shobajo

texts.en: F. is 50 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells drinks and water. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks so as to meet her customers’ demands. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Dianora

texts.es: Dianora tiene 30 años, es soltera y madre de una niña en edad escolar, la casa donde vive es alquilada. Anteriormente vendía golosinas en su casa, pero no tenía buenas ventas por encontrarse en una zona no muy transitada. Sin embargo, hace 2 años, gracias al apoyo de su hermana quien vive a 4 horas de su casa, en un caserío llamado Curimana, Dianora ha mejorado en su negocio. Ahora se dedica a enviar las golosinas a su hermana, quien se encarga de venderlas en su localidad, teniendo ambas un porcentaje de ganancia. Adicionalmente, desde hace 5 años Dianora también vende productos de medicina natural de una marca muy reconocida y por ser éstos muy demandados, puede obtener buenos ingresos económicos. Con este, ya serían 5 los préstamos que viene teniendo con MFP y considera que lo que más le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes son coordinados y muy solidarios. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en el incremento de la mercadería de sus dos negocios.
texts.en:
Dianora, 30, is a single mother, and she has a school-aged daughter. They live in a rented house. She previously sold sweets in her house, but sales were not good because she does not live in a busy area. Two years ago she received help from her sister, who lives four hours from her house in a village called Curimana. Thanks to this help, Dianora has improved her business. Now she sends the sweets to her sister, who sells them in her area. Both of them get a percentage of the earnings. Also, for the past five years Dianora has also been selling a very well know brand of natural medicines. These are in much demand, and she is able to get good income from them. This will be her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes best about working with her community bank is that all of the members are very supportive, and they work well together. She will use the money she is now asking for to increase the merchandise in both of her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
la sra. ALBA LUZ V. ORDOÑEZ se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en el Benque, Jamastran su pulperia opera bajo el nombre de Pul. "Las Gemelitas" y es de mucha ayuda para su vida.
Doña Alba es madre casada, tiene 4 hijos que los ha sabido mantener muy bien, brindandoles todo el apoyo en sus estudios de los cuales ya van adelante.- La Sra. V. tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad la cual es de buena ayuda por la experiencia con que ella cuenta y eso le ha permitido tener una buena clientela por la amabilidad y actitud que ella demuestra a sus clientes.- y es por ello que le ha podido generar una buena satisfaccion en su familia.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder hacer crecer su negocio.
la meta de ella es poder tener un mercadito grande en el cual pueda vender hasta todo tipo de carnes y lacteos.
texts.en:
Alba Luz V. O. sells popular consumer products. She has a mini market, which is located in the Benque, Jamastran. Her mini market is called Las Gemelitas. The mini market is a big help in her life. Alba is married and has four children. She has known how to support them very well. She offered them total support in their education, which they are continuing. Señora V. has had her business for five years. Her experience has been a big help. Her friendliness and the attitude she shows her customers have allowed her to have a good customer base. That is why she has been able to make her family feel satisfied. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise and make her business grow. Her goal is to buy able to have a large market where she can sell all types of meat and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, churros, bread, beans, shortening, tortillas, rice, sugar, coffee, crackers, and juice

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Danao. She is 54 years old. Nena is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Nena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kenjekyz's Group

texts.en: Kenjekyz is the leader in this group. She is forty five years old and has three children. Her husband is a carrier by trade. She has already married off one of her daughters who now lives separately. The other daughter goes to school. As well, she has a son, a college student. As any woman that has already reared her children until a definite age, when she no longer has to sit at home and look after them, Kenjekyz had long ago planned to start working some day. Until that very moment, she had been saving money to start her own business. And here it was, nine years ago this day came and she invested her savings in shoes and started trading. This determination of hers has already yielded quite impressive results. Due to her earnings, she and her husband have already bought a house, a car, and some convenience goods. Now, her monthly income constitutes around $470, which is considered to be a good income. Kenjekyz, currently needs a loan to invest in a new purchase of shoes and with the rest of the loan she wants to cover house-building expenses. Once she saves a sufficient amount of funds she is going to buy a container and help her son get married. These are Kenjekyz’s partners: Aigul, Gulnarida and Beishekul: Aigul, 35, is married and has four children. She trades in clothes, whereas her husband is a welder. Aigul makes $430 a month. She needs a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Her future plans are to provide her children with education and to buy a car. Gulnarida, 25, is married and has one child. Nevertheless, she manages to be engaged in trade, as she sells women’s underwear. She borrowed money from her aunt to start her business. Gulnarida needs a loan to purchase more underwear and to add slippers to her assortment. Beishekul, 49, is married and is the mother of two children. Her husband does odd jobs at a construction site, and she sells nightgowns at the local market. Beishekul needs a loan to purchase more nightgowns. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a new batch of shoes and to cover house-building expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Accroître la capacité de son commerce

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en Ticaraya, ella estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora inicia su trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de  S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral comercializa sus productos en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades de los prestamos.
texts.en:
Sr. Emiliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón Pampuyo”, which is located in the central village of Corazón Pampuyo in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. Emiliana lives in Ticaraya and completed her high school education.

She just started working with Manuela Ramos. Her first loan is in the amount of 500 soles and will be used to increase her business capital so that she can buy pigs and chickens to sell at the regional fairs. Emiliana hopes to open a grocery store. She enjoys the simplicity of her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & chickens

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita P. lives in the village of Bucros, La Carlota City Negros Occidental. She is 60 years old, but still strong and able to manage her business. She is a widow with three children aging between 23 to 37 years old, all of whom have already finished their studies through the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon. Two of her children have their own families and her youngest son is the only one left living with her. He helps her with all household and other work. Despite being old, she is still very happy because her dreams have come true that all of her children have finished college, and are still earning their living.

Before she started as an NWTF-Project Dungganon member, she already had her business which helps support her family and pay for her children's education. She is engaged in running her general store, purchase and sales of rice, running a coffee shop, and pig fattening. This business was run by herself with the help of her husband and children. But unfortunately her husband died. But her life and business continues, and is also a source of leisure for her to forget what happened to her husband. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon her businesses brought more comfort to the family because it doubled her earnings to sustain her children. Even in her age, she continues her loans and businesses, in fact she was able to earn Php 6,000 per month, a big help to her children, and she is also maintaining good credit performance in NWTF-PD. 

Previously she borrowed Php 15,000 for additional capital for her business. The said amount was paid in full and on time. Now, she is borrowing the same amount, Php 15,000, to be used as additional capital, and any income from it will be used to expand the business.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additonal Capital for the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is now 63 years old, still contented and happily living with her husband Aurelio C., 64 years old. In the long years of their marriage they were given three children: Fernando, 39 years old; Zenaida, 36 years old and Rowelio, 33 years old. One frustration for Gloria and her husband is that their children only attained a low level of education.

A good thing is that their two sons are now working abroad, so they will be able to send their children to school until college. Naturally, Gloria and Aurelio don’t want their children to experience what they experienced in the past. Gloria, in her own little way, helps their children to make their dream possible for her grandchildren. She has run a variety store business for seven years, and she really wants this to continue and to grow more. In 2002 she joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), and as a member she is entitled to loans. Every loan that she received in the past years of being a member was always used in improving her variety store business. Now her loan will be used to expand her business, because she will buy all the necessary things needed by her business like sacks of rice, different groceries and many more. She is hoping that her business will grow so that they can turn it into a grocery store that can sell more things than a variety store. In that way, she could help her children in sending their children to school, and also help themselves improve their life.

loans.use: To finance her variety store business

loans.name: C2321 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 35 years old and is married with five children with ages between 2 and 10 years. She is the president of a group called Twitezimbere. This group has owned a shop for the past three years selling a wide variety of goods. It is well known in the community and employs four people. The business is open every day from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. 

After having operated successfully in business for three years, Jacqueline and her group are requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. The loan proceeds will be used to expand their offerings through purchasing additional goods such as household items and a variety of foodstuffs such as sugar, beans, rice, etc.

The members of Twitezimbere hope that the new range of products will appeal to their current customers as well as attract new customers to their store. All of this should result in a greater profit for their enterprise. With this profit, the members of Twitezimbere will continue to pay school fees for their children and build a secure future for their families and loved ones.

loans.use: To buy additional goods, household items and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Mrs. Ellen A. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Ellen owns and operates a business selling a variety of foods like tempura (deep-fried, battered seafood or vegetables), kikiam (ground pork and vegetables wrapped in bean curd sheets then deep-fried until golden) and other snacks in the local community. She earns 5,000 per month. In 2004, Ellen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Khudoyor

texts.en:
B. Khudoyor is 26 years old. He is a market vendor. He sells clothing at the central market of Dushanbe city. With his eight years of working at the market, Khudoyor has enough experience to do his work successfully, and he has clients who always come to him. He is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels.

Khudoyor wants to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. For this reason, he is asking to borrow 4000 TJS. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all for supporting him. Your generosity can change his life. Be an important part of the growth of Khudoyor’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Chann Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chann Thoeun H. lives in Slaeng village in Takeo province. She is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns 3-hetar of land to cultivate rice and support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phan Keam, owns a harvesting machine which he rents to people in the local village at harvest time. In this rice field, this family faces some problems. Their field is far from an irrigation system. There is not enough water, yet they did not have enough money to acquire water to support the rice field.  Mrs. Chann Thoeun H. has decided to ask for a loan to dig a well and the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizers, and pesticides. She is a mother of three children. Two are studying at th  local public school while the other one is a laborer in a garment factory.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charcoal and cereals stock.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio, de 42 años, es soltero y vive al lado de su hermana y sus sobrinas, en su casa propia ubicada en la sierra del Perú.
Cada día es nuevo en la vida de este trabajador hombre que se dedica a la agricultura; siembra papas y alverjas, producto que cuida con mucha dedicación para que tenga una buena cosecha y logre vender toda su producción. Paralelamente cría ganado vacuno, ovino y caballos, los que comercializa en los mercados de su zona. Esta labor le gusta mucho, pues obtiene buenas ganancias por las dos actividades, además que está acostumbrado al trabajo duro. 
Aunque Dionisio no tiene familia ayuda a su hermana con los gastos de sus hijas, pues las quiere como si fueran sus propias hijas. 
Siendo un hombre muy emprendedor, para el futuro tiene planeado comprar más animales, así como sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos, como lo ha sido siempre, ya que quiere seguir adelante en sus negocios. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de algunas cabezas de ganado, también adquirirá fertilizantes, abono e insecticidas para sus campos de cultivo, ya que quiere asegurar su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 42 years old and single. He lives in his own home with his sister and his nieces in the mountains of Peru.

Each day is a new day in the life of this hardworking gentleman who dedicates himself to farming. He grows potatoes and peas and tends to his crops with great care. During the harvest season, he sells everything he produces. Dionisio also raises cattle, sheep, and horses to sell at the local markets. He enjoys his work tremendously and is able to earn a good living from both of these activities. Dionisio is also accustomed to hard work. Despite not having a family of his own, he helps his sister with the expenses of her daughters and treats them as if they were his own. Since he is a very enterprising man, Dionisio has future plans to buy more animals and plant crops in greater quantities so that he can generate more revenue.

This is his third loan with MFP. As always, Dionisio promises to make his payments on time and in a responsible manner because he wants his businesses to succeed. The money he is requesting will be used to buy a few heads of cattle as well as fertilizers, compost, and insecticides for his fields so that he can secure his next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak K. is a village woman who lives with other family member in an area of the capital, Phnom Penh. She is aged 40, is a housewife, and she is married and blessed with three children. One of her daughters is an employee in Naga club.

The family is supported by Prak K.’s husband who operates a vehicle sales business. He buys and sells second-hand motorcycles that he also buys from the people who live in the rural areas. He is conducting his job very well but currently he lacks some cash to buy more vehicles for resale. He discussed this with his wife and she has decided to ask a loan of $1,000 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycles for her husband to sell

loans.name: Ruthe Francisco

texts.pt:
Ruthe Francisco N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo, sul de Moçambique tem 37 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 13 e 10 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, desenvolve o seu negócio nesta cidade há mais de 10 anos. A sua actividade é vendedora ambulante de roupa diversa, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga dona Ana que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (roupa diversa) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt, os quais foram para a área de comércio e habitação. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Ruthe Francisco N. was born in the city of Maputo, in southern Mozambique. She is 37 years old, and a single mother of two children 13 and 10 years old. Both attend school. She only completed fifth grade due to lack of funds. She lives with her children in her own house, and has no other dependents. She never left Maputo, and has run her business in the the city for over 10 years. She sells clothes as a street vendor, and has no employees. She uses her monthly income of around 10,000 MZN for household expenses and manages to same some in a Xitique (a traditional revolving savings sistem). She has never taken out loans from other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through her friend Ana who is also a client of the organization. This is her fourth loan, for 20,000 MZN, which she intends to use to buy products (clothing and others) to increase the quantity of her stock. The earlier loans were for 10,000, 12,000 and 15,000 MZN for improvements to her home and place of business. In the future she would like to apply for additional loans to complete her house and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Madame Awa C. a 46 ans et vit avec son époux et ses enfants  dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires, Awa n’a pas pris du temps à s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman depuis son jeune âge et l’exerce pour elle-même il y a plus de 20 ans de cela.  Son activité principale est la vente des  articles de fêtes (chaussures, sacs, parures etc), elle fait  également des prestations de services avec la coiffure. Elle est très sollicitée par les femmes de la ville de Koutiala. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce  et satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité et en quantité, Madame Awa a fait recourt à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le premier a été correctement remboursé.  
Avec ce deuxième prêt elle compte acheter,  60 paires de chaussures  et 20 sacs à main. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako  et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée  de jeunes filles et de femmes mariées  au comptant ou à crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire ses propres besoins, entretenir ses enfants  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of five children, Ms. Awa C. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and her children in the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala Prefecture (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to continue in primary school, Awa took no time at all to become interested in revenue-generating work at an early age at her mother's side.  Awa has been working for herself now for over twenty years.  Her main business is in selling gift items (shoes, bags, fine accessories, etc.).  She also offers a range of hairdressing services.  She is in high demand by women in Koutiala City. Concerned about increasing her working capital and satisfying her customers with regard to quantity and quality, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her second individual loan.  The first one was correctly repaid.  With this second loan, she intends to buy sixty pairs of shoes and twenty handbags.  She gets her supplies from Bamako and sells, cash or credit accepted, in Koutiala City to a customer base composed of girls and married women.  With the increase in her sales, she plans on a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that she envisions using for repaying the Soro Yiriwaso loan, for meeting her own needs, for providing for her children, and for investing the rest in her business. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and bags

loans.name: Félix Pedro

texts.es:
La señor Félix Pedro M. O. es originario del departamento de Estelí comunidad de santa Adelaida trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como responsable de área porcina y avícola  tiene mas de diez años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo en su área, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra una refrigeradora ya que su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio como venta de comida a estudiantes de la universidad ucatse.
Antes de tener este trabajo el se dedicaba a hacer otras labores en la agricultura trabajando con su padre. 

El plantea que la refrigeradora  le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá y le ayudara a mejorar más sus ingresos al aumentar sus ventas.
Félix es casado y tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar de los cuales uno de ellos esta en la universidad y los otros en secundaria a los que les brida su apoyo uno de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos preparados ya que a él se le fue negada la oportunidad 
 
Este es él sétimo crédito que Félix tiene con ceprodel
Y espera no quedar mal, expresa que estará agradecido con ceprodel ya que se le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida familiar  y se ha superado a través del crédito.
texts.en:
La señor Félix Pedro M. O. es originario del departamento de Estelí comunidad de santa Adelaida trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como responsable de área porcina y avícola tiene mas de diez años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo en su área, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra una refrigeradora ya que su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio como venta de comida a estudiantes de la universidad ucatse. Antes de tener este trabajo el se dedicaba a hacer otras labores en la agricultura trabajando con su padre. El plantea que la refrigeradora le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá y le ayudara a mejorar más sus ingresos al aumentar sus ventas. Félix es casado y tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar de los cuales uno de ellos esta en la universidad y los otros en secundaria a los que les brida su apoyo uno de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos preparados ya que a él se le fue negada la oportunidad Este es él sétimo crédito que Félix tiene con ceprodel Y espera no quedar mal, expresa que estará agradecido con ceprodel ya que se le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida familiar y se ha superado a través del crédito.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Refrigeradora

loans.name: Vanndy

texts.en: Mrs. Vanndy K. is 48 years old and a villager who lives in Prey Ta Pong village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sengly Horm, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Vanndy K. is electric supply seller and her husband is a construction worker. In order to help her husband get to his work place, Mrs. Vanndy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle to support her husband's transportation. This couple has two children who are both students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion G. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Concepcion owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more copra to sell and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more copra to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Eligathe

texts.en:
Eligathe J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and fire woods at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Eligathe is 47 years old. She is married and her husband is a retired director. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike to transport bags of charcoal from producers to the retailing markets.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maxima Estela

texts.es:
Máxima de 48 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil ( zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). Ella tiene dos carros que los alquila para taxis. 

Para poder mantener a sus dos hijas ella tuvo que invertir su dinero en un carro que lo comenzó a maneja su esposo poco a poco con esfuerzo, ellos pudieron tener otro carro para alquilarlo a un taxista. Ahora ella tiene un dos carros y su esposo es guía de la cárcel. Diariamente los carros le producen $ 50.00 diarios. 

Para continuar con sus carros ella quiere comprar llantas ya que están gastadas .Uno de sus sueños es tener una cooperativa de carros y que sus hijas terminen con éxito la universidad.
texts.en:
Máxima, age 48, lives in the paradise of Guayaquil (a periurban zone, with a dissolving ecology). She has two cars which she rents for taxis. In order to maintain her two children she had to invest her money in a car which her husband started to drive. Bit by bit, with hard work, they were able to get another car to rent to a taxi driver. Now she has two cars and her husband is a prison guard. Daily the cars make them $50.00. In order to continue with her cars she wants to buy used tires. One of her dreams is to have a car cooperative and that her children will finish university with success.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tires

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos tiene 20 años de edad y el otro tiene 17 años de edad a su cargo. Tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de discos y otros productos, tales como frutas y verduras, también vende adornos y artículos escolares. Cuando la señora inicio este negocio con capital prestado de su papa, ya que ella para ese tiempo no tenía trabajo, su esposo estaba sin trabajo ya que trabaja en construcción por lo que su situación era muy difícil y solamente ella trabajaba. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercaderías, ya que desea aprovechar las fiestas de Santiago que se acercan y que son fechas buenas de ventas. Su deseo es llegar a comprarse un modulo en el mercado para brindar mayor seguridad a su producto.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 37 years old, married, and has two children. The oldest child is 20 years old and the other one is 17 and still under her care. For the past six years Maria has been in the business of selling DVDs and other products such as fruits, vegetables, decorations, and school supplies. She started her business using seed money that she borrowed from her father since she did not have a job at the time. Her husband also did not have a job since he worked in construction, so their situation was very difficult and she was the only one working.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. She wants to take advantage of the festivals of Santiago (Saint James) since she generates good sales on these occasions. Her wish is to acquire a storefront where her merchandise will be more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Bessy Auma

texts.en:
After the completion of her education, Bessy started a clothes-selling business in the year 2000 in the Ahero market to generate income to enhance self-reliance. She normally travels after every two months to Nairobi to purchase more stock. 

Being a community health worker, she came to realize about the KMET-Kiva microfinance initiative and decided to request a loan worth 50,000 Kenyan shillings to enable her to boost her business and get a substantial income, which will later enable her to buy a plot to build both her residence and rental houses. 

She is 28 years of age and a married mother of three children. She lives in Rabuor in Kisumu.

loans.use: To boost business

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en: Ma. Nida L. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Ma. Nida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Nida buys and sells fruits like lanzones in the local community. Ma. Nida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ma. Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, cooking oil and maize flour, and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans, rice and pulses to sell. Mary is 41 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans, rice  and pulses to sell

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette M. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes, raising livestock and food vending. She lives in Purok 6, Brgy. Cubay, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her RTW sales, livestock and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,200 PHP. Suzette is now borrowing 15,000 PHP to sustain and grow her businesses. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Suzette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.


About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: Working capital for her business ventures

loans.name: Luis Hernan

texts.es:
El Señor Luis Hernán C. F. de 29 años de edad, cuenta con un local de ventas de artículos eléctricos, cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñado, el joven Lorenzo F., que mediante su esfuerzo lograron montar dicho negocio. 
Empezó hace mas de 5 años El señor  Luis es casado,  tiene 2 hijos.

Solicito el  préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de mas mercaderías, el mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Hernán C. F. is 29 years old and has a stall where he sells electric appliances and has the help of his brother-in-law, Lorenzo F.; through their hard work they were able to start this business.

He began the business 5 years ago. Mr. Luis is married and has 2 children.

Mr. Luis asked for the loan from Fundación Paraguaya (Kiva’s field partner) to which he is very thankful, he will use the loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy electric appliances like cables, light bulbs among other items.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila T. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 50 years old and single. To make a living, Lucila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lucila is happy to be helping her family financially. She works hard to keep her land productive.

Lucila joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Lucila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso, de 24 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Todas las mañanas Alfonso se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de sus frutos, como: la naranja y mandarina, que después de cada cosecha los llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que él mismo administrar su negocio y disponer de su tiempo. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus cafetales. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado.
Con los dos mil trecientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 24 years old.  He is a simple and hard-working man.  He lives in his parents' house and what he wants more than anything is to get ahead in life.  Every morning Alfonso takes a lot of care in working his soil and leaving it very fertile since he knows that the quality of his fruit, such as oranges and mandarins, depends upon it.  After every harvest he takes his fruit to sell in the market in the city of La Merced.

What Alfonso most likes about his work is that he has a lot of freedom to work on his land since he runs his own business and makes use of his own time.  He has been in this business for 4 years and he considers that the most difficult job is cleaning his coffee plantations.  Over time, he would like to be able to buy more land in order to increase his production.  This is his fourth loan with MFP and he feels able to make all his repayments.  He is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.

With the 2,300 nuevos soles that he is requesting, he will buy more fertilizer to make his soil more fertile.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make his soil more fertile

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita S. is 53 years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: buying and selling sea cucumbers and lobster and a general store. She lives in Prk. Pag-asa, Brgy. Port Barton, San Vicente, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of 18000 PHP. Zita is now borrowing 24000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Zita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kimanzi

texts.en:
Kimanzi M. is twenty-eight years old and married. His wife runs their retail shop and they have one child aged one year old to whom they hope to give good education up to the university level. 

His business is located at Mwingi and he is served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for its production of pineapples. He has been selling cow and goat skins. He sells to other traders who sell them wholesale for making leather. He has been in this business for the last ten years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more skins to resell to the traders. He hopes to grow his business and become the major skins distributor in the area. He also sees himself buying a car.  He describes himself as sociable and persuasive.

loans.use: Animal skins

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy M. (shown in the photo) is 30 years old. Her husband, Mr. Phally Ny, is 22. They have been married since 2008 and have a one-year-old son. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sophy has been a tailor since 2007. She operates the business at home. Her husband is a lathe operator. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Sandra Zenobia

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años, de estado civil madre soltera, tiene 03 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja hace más de 08 años con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas, huevo y detergentes para su tienda, es ayudada por sus hijas en cuanto a la atención de la tienda.

Su sueño en el negocio es tener una tienda más grande con locutorios.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la distracción al intercambiar palabras con las socias, el plazo de pagar es rápido y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the communal bank “3 de Mayo II” (May 3rd II) in Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department.  She is 44 years old and a single mother of 3 children, all of whom are financially dependent on her.  She completed studies in higher education.

She has been working with "Movimiento Manuela  Ramos" for more than eight years.  Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in her business selling groceries.

Sandra is now requesting a new loan for 1300 PEN ($475 USD), which she will invest in the purchase of sodas, rice, sugar, milk, crackers, eggs and detergents for her store.  Her daughters help her take care of the store.

Her dream for her business is to have a larger store with telephone booths.

What Sandra likes about her communal bank is passing the time chatting with the other members, that the payments are fast and that she earns on her savings.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise, like sodas, rice, milk and various other products.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia C. is from the village of Plaridel. She is 60 years old. Lucia is married. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lucia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Lucia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Olivia is married. 

To make a living, Olivia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She also makes and sells snacks like rice and cheese cakes. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Olivia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Olivia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Olivia from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: A. is currently in a business selling retail goods. She is 35 years old and married with five children. Two of her children go to school. A. requested a loan to stock more retail goods to sell. With the extra profits, A. hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La Sra. Ana vive en la localidad de San José , es nacida en el departamento de Santa Cruz,  su esposo con el cual tiende un hijo es de ocupación chofer,  vive en la casa de su cuñada hace un año, su actividad es la venta de refresco, chicha y tortas y muy pronto preparara salteña, por este motivo solicito el crédito que será  destinado para comprar un horno para la elaboración de salteñas, hace un año que se dedica a esta actividad, sus ingresos de su esposo no era suficiente para sostener a su familia, por lo tanto ella  tiene que realizar esta actividad para apoyar la economía de su familia,  es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora con ganas de superación, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana lives in the town of San José but was born in the department of Santa Cruz.  She lives with her husband, who is a driver, and her son in her sister-in-law's home, where they have been residing for one year.  Ana sells softdrinks, chicha (corn drink) and cakes.  Soon she will begin making meat pies and plans to use the loan she requested to buy an oven.

She's been running her business for a year now and helps with the household expenses since her husband's income is not enough to maintain the family.  She is very responsible and a hard worker who wants to get ahead.  She is grateful to the institution for the support she is receiving by way of this loan.

loans.use: To buy an oven

loans.name: Silas Odoyo

texts.en:
Silas O. is a 30-year-old gentleman. He and his wife Pamela have five children. They live in Migori, Kenya.

Silas is a carpenter, and he has been in business for one year. He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced to the organization by a friend. He intends to use the loan to buy more timber. He already has some orders from customers, and the loan will really help him to meet their demands.

Silas hopes to expand his business and use the profits made to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Del Bosque Group

texts.es: Orfelinda D. L. C. V. D. 44 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 1 hijo, hace mas D. 10 años que se vino D. su natal Amazonas ha vivir en L. zona del Bosque en Carabayllo - Lima - Perú, empezó su negocio vendiendo hielo y con un teléfono público, hace casi año y medio empezo con su bodeguita. Con su negocio a logrado cercar su casita con ladrillos y mejorar su economía. Actualmente desea tener una bodega bien equipadita y con variedad D. productos. El préstamo que le ha dado EDAPROSPO lo invertirá en compra D. mas productos .
texts.en: Orfelinda D. L. C. V. is 44 years old, separated, and has one son.  More than 10 years ago she came from her home in the Amazon region to live in the Bosque en Carabayllo zone in Lima, Peru.  She began a business selling ice and renting a public telephone.  Almost a year and a half ago she started her little grocery store.  With this business, she has been able to build a brick fence around her house and improve her quality of life.  She currently desires to have a grocery store that is well-stocked with a variety of products.  She will use the loan from EDAPROSPO to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Climaco Wilfrido

texts.es:
Climaco Wilfrido M. R. tiene 37 años, es soltero vive con los hijos, en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  LA SOLEDAD se encuentra ubicada en el recinto EL TAMBO  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y además cría aves como gallina y patos.

Climaco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz,  los productos las compras en Chillanes y en El Tambo y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo para el negocio.

Le gusta salir con el hijo hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Climaco Wilfrido M. R. is 37 and single.  He lives with his children in Chillanes Canton of Bolivar province.  

The members of the La Soledad communal bank live in the El Tambo area in the Chillanes Canto.  This communal bank’s 12 members grow cacao, rice, corn and cassava, as well as raising poultry such as chicken and ducks. 

As a farmer, Claudio grows cacao, rice and corn.  She buys products in Chillanes and El Tambo and sells them in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

Claudio is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops.  The loan will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces challenges likes pests, crop diseases and weather changes.   His dream is to buy a vehicle for his business.   

He likes to go out with his son.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi lives in Vodyanoye and earns his living growing tomatoes in greenhouses. He owns 4 big greenhouses and 2 separate ones for seedlings. Yuryi has been in the farming business for 6 years. He has already invested about 100,000 grivnyas in his venture. His annual expenses on seeds and film amount to 45,000 grivnyas.

Yuryi is requesting a 10,000 grivnya loan to invest in farming supplies he will use this season. He is planning to spend 3,000 grivnyas on fertilizers and chemicals, 2,000 grivnyas on polyethylene film, 4,000 grivnyas on coal to keep the greenhouses warm and 1,000 grivnyas on wood. This type of business is very prospective for this region, which is why Yuryi is planning to continue growing it by expanding his greenhouses and constructing new ones in the future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film, fertilizers, wood and coal for greenhouses

loans.name: Luciah

texts.en: Luciah is 34 years old and a single mother of two. She runs both a grocery and a retail shop with one employee. Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business and she is now able to provide for her children without strain. She hopes to have a stable business in the future. She has requested 60,000 Kes to buy maize, sugar and wheat flour for her store.

loans.use: to buy maize, sugar and wheat flour for her store

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni  lives  in the city of Kampala in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her late sister’s children.    

Zaituni has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 9 years, and works 7 days out of every week.  Zaituni sells her products at the market by means of retail.   She also generates additional income by selling charcoal.

Zaituni has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more mangoes, pineapples, oranges, cabbages and onions. The main business challenges for Zaituni include transportation, thieves, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to start growing the fruits herself and to build her own house.  

Zaituni lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy fruit to resell

loans.name: Muhabbat's Group

texts.en:
Muhabbat is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised three sons and two daughters. The first son works in construction; two younger children study at school and the others grow clover to earn money.  The family is also engaged in cattle breeding.  

Muhabbat sells dairy products to earn additional money. In this way she earns an additional 2500 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the near future, Muhabbat plans to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 32 years old and married with four school-age children. She lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Minda owns and operates a "Habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. She has been engaged in this type of service because it is used to travel in mountainous areas. She has earned PHP 3,000 per month by doing this type of business for more than five years. She wanted to request a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase tires and spare parts for her motorcycle.

Minda has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes that she can purchase additional motorcycles for transport.

loans.use: To purchase tires and spare parts

location.town: santa cruz tangub city misamis occidental

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ronelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines and also earns additional income buying and selling dried fish and farming rice. Ronelyn is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell in her business.

Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Elvin David

texts.en: Elvin lives in Choluteca, Honduras with his wife and two children. For the past three years, he has run a small general store to earn a living. Elvin has requested a loan of Lps. 12,000 to purchase merchandise for his store. In his free time, Elvin raises chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, condiments, lard, cooking oil, eggs, bread, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products to sell.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose is a 60-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who has a child who is now 30 years old. She is a widow and supports herself and her child by selling fruits. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and has been able to earn enough money to pay for her child's school fees and meet her family’s overall needs. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including tangerines, passion fruits and bananas. She hopes to earn enough money in the future to accumulate some savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Acica

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inharrime, provincia de Inhambane ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 vão a escola. Fez a 9ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo ainda pequena com os pais, é negociante ambulante ha mais de 12 anos e tem um rendimento de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende investir no seu negocio de compra e venda de carne DE VACA.   
Sonha em construir um mini-talho para ampliar o seu negocio e obter mais lucros,e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Acica was born in Inharrime, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children; three of them go to school. Acica finished ninth grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

When she was still young, Acica left Inhambane to move to Maputo with her parents. She has been a traveling businessperson for more than 12 years and has an income of 6,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is her first Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais to invest in her business buying and selling beef.

Acica dreams of building a mini butcher's shop to expand her business and earn more profit. To do so, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell beef.

loans.name: Suubileg

texts.en: Suubileg, 28 years old, has been running a taxi service for 5 years. He lives with his 2 daughters and wife. His wife is a shop seller, his older daughter attends secondary school and his younger daughter has an impairment. The family lives in a ger, a nomadic tent, on a small piece of land near the mountain peak. It is a very difficult and dangerous place for them to live, especially in winter. Therefore, Suubileg is planning to replace his land with a better location near downtown so that his family can live in a safe environment. Suubileg plans to use this loan to help pay for the land.

loans.use: To help with his land payment

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, a 23-year-old married mother of one child, has been selling cooked potatoes for the last two years. A KADET client, she has requested her second loan for KES.20,000 to purchase more potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal. With the anticipated profits,Cecilia will  repay the loan and also  expand her business. Her dream is to own a café.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is married with four children. Eliza is 44 years old and lives in Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte.

Eliza sells ready to wear clothes to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase clothes, pants, skirts and other items.

Eliza has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Eliza hopes to have good living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, pants and other products to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman with two children; one of whom attends school while the other is too young for school. She has a house with electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past two years. In addition, she sells leso (Khangas) which adds to her other source of income. Her potential clients are the people that come to the market to buy fish. She faces a major challenge of lack of fish, especially during the cold seasons. She dreams of buying her own freezer, so that she can stock more fish for sale.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase more fish, ten liters of oil for frying fish, and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish, ten liters of oil for frying fish, and charcoal.

loans.name: Miramar Femenina 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Deyeana es la coordinadora del Grupo Miramar Femenina 1 & 2,  Este grupo está compuesto por 10 mujeres dedicadas a las ventas D. ropas, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros, algunos D. modo ambulante y algunos tienen sus negocios en sus casas. 

Deyeana está muy emocionada D. recibir su 13th préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, desD. los inicios D. su negocio ella ha tomado préstamos con nosotros, llevando ya alrededor D. 7 años invirtiendo los préstamos a su negocio. El actual será invertido en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. empanadas (comida realizada con harina amasada, rellena y luego frita o horneada), comprara Harina, Carnes, vegetales, aceite para cocinar, entre otros productos. 

Sus planes para el futuro es poder tener un local propio para su negocio, ya que realiza sus ventas en la escuela D. su comunidad, también desea construir una cocina para su casa y comprar un vehículo, este último es su reto mas difícil. A Deyeana gusta cantar, asistir a la iglesia y compartir con sus amistades.

Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad D. Samana, una ciudad turística, rodeada por el océano atlántico y un paisaje natural D. mucha vegetación y montañas, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos económicos y servicios, es una zona totalmente rural, donD. los principales negocios pertenecen a los miembros D. este grupo.
texts.en:
Deyeana is the coordinator of Grupo Miramar Femenina 1 and 2. The group is maD. up of ten women who have businesses selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, among other things. Some of them sell door-to-door while others run their businesses out of their homes.

Deyeana is very excited to receive her thirteenth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She's been getting loans from us and investing them in her business ever since she started it seven years ago. She will use the current loan to buy ingredients for maK. empanadas (dough stuffed with meats and vegetables and then fried or baked) such as flour, meats, vegetables, cooK. oil.

In the future she would like to have a shop where she sells empanadas. She currently sells them at the local school. She also wants to build a kitchen in her house and buy a car, which is her biggest challenge. She enjoys singing, going to church, and sharing with her friends.

This group is in the town of Samana, a popular tourist destination on the Atlantic Ocean that's surrounded by a lush, mountainous landscape. The community has few economic resources and services, since it's a very rural area. The main business in town belong to the members of this group.

loans.use: to buy flour, meats, vegetables, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ntinkoy

texts.en:
Ntinkoy is 37 years old, married and has five children.  He practices livestock farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 11 years.  He is able to provide for his family and educate his children with the income from his business. He has improved his business through Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management.

Ntinkoy hopes to expand his business in five years. He needs a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy goats.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad tiene 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y sociable. Esta separada de su esposo, pero vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos en su casa que es propia. La actividad que realiza Natividad es la venta de plátanos, fruto que lo compra a los comerciantes mayorista de vienen de la ciudad de Pucallpa, en ocasiones ella misma realiza dicho viajes para traer sus productos y luego venderlos en un pequeño puesto que tiene, ubicado en el mercado municipal de su distrito. Tiene cuatro años dedicándose a esta actividad, y da gracias de que sus hijos la hayan apoyado siempre para continuar con el trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es poder sentirse productiva y contar con un ingreso económico para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Ella considera rentable este negocio, pues el plátano es de consumo masivo en esta parte de la región. Este sería el crédito número dos con la institución MFP, se siente muy bien y cómoda con el grupo al cual pertenece, ya que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de plátanos, esperando así contar con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Natividad is 51 years old and a very hard-working, happy, and sociable  woman. She is separated from her husband and lives in the company of her 4 children in her own house.

Natividad sells plantains, a fruit which she buys from merchant wholesalers who come from the city of Pucallpa. Sometimes she herself makes the journey to bring her products home and then sells them at her small post, located in her district municipal market.

Natividad has done this for 4 years and she is grateful that her children have always helped her with her work. What she likes about this activity is being able to feel productive and count on sufficient income to satisfy her children's basic necessities. She finds the business profitable, since plantains are massively consumed in this part of the region.

This will be Natividad's 2nd loan through MFP, and she feels very good and comfortable with the group she belongs to, since they demonstrate much solidarity. With the money she requests, Natividad will buy a larger quantity of plantains, hoping thus to count on greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy more plantains to sell.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 36 years old, a mother of three children. She has owned a tailoring shop in Kilifi for the last 10 years and earns a good income.
