She has good credit history with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her third loan, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She hopes to use the loan to purchase cloth for making dresses and school uniforms. Her clients are mainly from schools around Kilifi.

With the anticipated profits she plans to start a green grocer business and also to meet her family's needs. She desires to grow her business and to own rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for making dresses and school uniforms.

loans.name: Prophète Plus Group

texts.en:
Prophète Plus is a community bank made up of nine micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is Jean Pierre.  These members are united for the same goal which is to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Jean Pierre sells beverages in the eastern area of Kinshasa.  He has been in the business world since 1994 selling palm oil.  After much hard work and good management, he succeeded in making his business thrive thanks to the accumulated profits.  He is happy to be one of MFI HOPE’s clients.  He has already obtained and correctly repaid eight loans from this micro-finance institution.

He intends to reinforce his capital with the next loan by adding twenty crates of beverages.  Currently, the business gives him a profit of US $50.00 per week. 

Jean Pierre’s ambition is to open a soft drink facility in his area.  He is 46 years old, married, and the father of four children whose ages vary between 4 and 15 years. Three of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase in bulk twenty crates of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Delia has a shop that makes and sells viands and snacks like rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for nine years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 40 and has 1 daughter.  Her husband has been earning by working as a welder. Thao has been running a general store from the front of their house for the past four years. She sells a variety of basic goods and snack foods. 

She would like to borrow money to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods, such as foods and beverages, in order to expand her current business. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, continua con la administració y el cuidado de sus productos en la agricultura y ganadería, y también la socia compra y vende cereales, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir su credito en la compra de tarwi, quinua, trigo entre otros y venderlos en su stand en uno de los mercados de Urubamba y en el mismo Rayanniyoc. La socia desea invertir el prestamo para comprar cereales e incrementar su negocio.

La socia a futuro cercano desea poder crecer en cuanto a sus negocio y convertirse en comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Luisa continues managing and caring for her crops and cattle. She also buys and sells cereals. She would like to invest the current loan in the purchase of cereals, including tarwi [lupini beans], quinoa, wheat, etc., to sell at her stand in one of the Urubamba markets and in Rayanniyoc. She wants use it grow her business, too.

In the near future, Luisa wants to be able to grow the business and become a wholesale vendor.

loans.use: to buy cereals and expand her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 37-year-old, married woman from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. She lives with her family in a small, old house. She is the only breadwinner for her family, and they depend on her for support. Fatima has a stall for selling kitchenware in the city. It is a good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad, because of latest conflict.

Fatima took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help his to buy a new collection of kitchenware to sell at her stall. She hopes that this new inventory will enable his to increase her sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of kitchenware to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Denny

texts.en:
Denny is a very simple, hardworking woman. She comes from a very poor family, and since she was young she has had to work. More than anything else, Denny says that she is unafraid to venture alone because she has had to fend for herself all her life. Ms. P. has three children, and her husband works as a security guard at a local business. Denny has learned how to many things, but her specialty is writing manuals for finely-crafted artisan goods. Some of the most beautiful woven rugs and tablecloths come from Manualidades Denny. She sells her goods close to her home where she is well known, and she sells to customers nearby the church. The income she brings in from this business helps to support her family’s basic needs, but she is applying for this credit so that she can get raw material: special painting for the engravings, fabrics and the material to elaborate the portfolios. She and her husband wish to continue outdoing themselves and growing to where they can send their children to good schools. Their aspiration is to have their own house and to continue giving their children opportunities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is applying for this credit so that she can get raw material: special painting for the engravings, fabrics and the material to elaborate the portfolios.

loans.name: Yadulla

texts.en:
48-year-old Yadulla lives in Khaladj village,  Salyan region. He has 2 children.
4 years ago he decided to start this business.
Yadulla’s plan is to raise his income level to be able to provide for his children’s education in high school. He intends to do this by increasing the number of his cattle.
Now he requests a loan of $1000 to open a butcher shop. 
Every day he goes to the market and stores to offer his products.
His neighbors know him and buy meat from him because his meat is always fresh.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop

loans.name: Marzia

texts.en: Marzia is 21 years old and lives in a household of four in District 5 of Kabul Afghanistan. She is single and her father was killed during the war in Afghanistan. Since she doesn’t have brothers and also is the youngest in her family, she is the main financial support for her family.  Marzia provides income through knitting at home. She would like a loan to buy more knitting materials which will help her build a good business. This will hopefully provide more income for her family and make a good life for them.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her knitting business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
I need to put flooring down in my home as it is a source of illness and infection for my children. I have not been able to put it down yet as I have had to do other, more urgent, things. I need a loan of $1000 to put down the flooring and for bars.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito poner el piso de mi casa ya que es una fuente de infección y enfermedad para mis hijos,no he podido ponerlo debido a que he tenido otras cosas más urgentes”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner el piso de mi casa y las rejas.

loans.use: To put bars and flooring/Poner piso y rejas

loans.name: Kasdu

texts.id:
Mr. Kasdu sells light snacks that kids love, like crackers, around the neighborhood using a motorcycle. With $35 daily capital, Kasdu buys his goods to be sold from a supplier. He usually works from 9 am to 7 pm and earns about $6 profit daily. With that earning Kasdu supports his wife and only child, and whatever left was saved to pay his land rent (Kasdu built his own home from simple materials like "gedeg"/bamboo walls and dirt floor). The loan from DINARI will be used to finance a new motorcycle. Hi plans to sell his old motorcycle, which is not so reliable anymore. Kasdu expects that his earnings will increase with a new and more reliable motorcycle.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Bapak Kasdu mempunyai usaha menjual makanan ringan dengan cara keliling naik sepeda motor. Adapun jenis makanan yang dijual seperti: makanan ringan untuk anak-anak, krupuk dan sebagainya. Dengan modal perhari Rp.350.000, Kasdu membeli bahan dagangannya tersebut di suplier dan mulai keliling dari jam 09.00 sampai jam 19.00 dan keuntungan yang diperolehnya sebesar Rp.60.000.-, dengan hasil tersebutlah Kasdu menghidupi istri dan 1 orang anaknya dan sebagian disisihkan untuk membayar sewa tanah Rp.25.000 perbulan sedangkan rumahnya dibangun sendiri dan sangat sederhana dengan bangunannya “gedeg” dan lantainya tanah. Pinjaman dari dinari digunakan untuk membeli sepeda motor yang lebih baik dan menjual motornya yang lama karena motornya yang lama sudah tua sehingga jalannya agak lambat, dengan harapan penghasilan akan meningkat.

loans.use: Purchase of Goods to be Sold

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
This woman is a single mother and head of her family, she has six children- all married and with children, she supports with their expenditures and she is directly in charge on two of her grandchildren. They stay with her and she pays for their food and studies by the profits of her business. This woman has developed many activities to gain enough money. Before this business she had a store in her home, this helped her to take care of her children while they helped her to take care of the clients. Her business has been in existence since more than nine years ago, she started it with $600 from her savings and some help from her older children while they were still single. Her business was originally made by wood and plastic, but she has slowly made some improvements. She still needs more infrastructure for her business to be able to protect her merchandise and get more products. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and her daily sales are approximately $35.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es madre soltera y jefa de familia con un total de seis hijos todos casados y con hijos, a los cuales ella apoya con sus gastos y tiene directamente a su cargo a dos nietos, los cuales le acompañan y a los cuales ella paga su alimentación y sus estudios por medio de los ingresos de su negocio.

Esta señora ha desarrollado diferentes actividades para ganarse la vida. Antes de tener este negocio tenía una pulpería en su casa lo cual le permitía cuidar de sus hijos, ellos le ayudaban a atender a los clientes. El puesto tiene más de nueve años de existir, el cual inicia con un capital inicial de aproximadamente US$ 600.00 aportado de sus ahorros y con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores cuando aún estaban solteros. El local inicial estaba elaborado de madera y plástico, aunque esta señora ha venido realizando mejoras paulatinas al local, aún necesita proporcionar a su negocio mejoras de infraestructura para proteger la mercadería y mayor surtido de productos. Tiene más de 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y sus ventas diarias son de aproximadamente US$ 35 dólares.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderia para surtir y actualizar inventario

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita, as her friends and clients lovingly call her, is dedicated to the sale of food. She sells her food from her small transport that she obtained for her work and with which she procures more regular customers day by day. She thanks her success to the delicious stews she prepares, which she learned from her loving mother Luisa, who also delights the clients with exquisite meals. Rosita yearns to open a restaurant and offer her clients better food and excellent service. In order to realize her dream she is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of kitchen utensils. Thus little by little she will finish up making her small store. Let's make Rosita's desires possible so that she can fulfill her dreams with little delay.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosita , como cariñosamente la suelen llamar sus amigos y clientes, está dedicada a la venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en su pequeña movilidad que ingeniosamente adecuó para dicho oficio y con el que va obteniendo día a día asiduos clientes; gracias a los deliciosos potajes que prepara debido a la habilidad que heredó de su querida madre, Luisa, quién también deleita a sus clientes con sus exquisitos platos.El deseo de Rosita es abrir su restaurante y ofrecer a sus comensales mejor comodidad y un excelente servicio, para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de utensilios de cocina, y así poco a poco terminar de implementar su pequeño local. Posibilitemos los deseos de Rosita para que concrete sus planes en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: The purchase of kitchen utensils in order to realize her dreams little by little

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
I am Naziran B. wife of Mohammad Nazir. I am the mother of six: two daughters and four sons. We all live in Lahore, a historic city in Pakistan. My husband operates a catering shop; two of my sons also help him in this business. My elder children could not get an education due to our poor financial circumstances but now our income has grown and therefore, I have enrolled my younger kids in school.

We have been in this business for six years. Now, we need to buy new crockery and tents for our business and for this, we need a loan.

My other group members are Sakina B. who needs a loan for her grocery store; Tasleem A. G. who needs a loan for her cloth business; Azra B. who needs a loan for a container manufacturing business; and Rasheeda B. who requires a loan for her son’s butcher shop.

loans.use: Buy items for our little catering business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro B. is a 45 year old father with two girls. He is a Chipa vender who gets up very early in the morning to prepare and bake the Chipas so that they are fresh in the morning to sell. He spends his days traveling to try and sell his goods. While he is working as a traveling Chipa vender his wife stays at home selling fruits and ice cream in front of their house.

In order to provide for his family, Pedro is asking for a loan today to help cover the expenses of his Chipa business. With the money he will buy ingredients like eggs, cornmeal, salt, animal fat, and cheese.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients to make Chipas, a favorite national snack.  They are typically made with corn meal, cheese, animal fat, eggs, and salt.

loans.name: Kireka B6 C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Maria S.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Maria is 32 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Maria makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children. Maria has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Maria is joined in her small group by Betty T., Zaituni A., Hadijah Y., and Dorcus N.. Betty T. has a business in stone quarrying and wants to add more capital. Zaituni A. is currently operating a business in stone quarrying and wants a loan to expand business. Hadijah Y. operates a business of stone quarrying and wants to increase her working capital. Dorcus N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To boost tailoring business

loans.name: Aba Amivi

texts.fr:
Born in Gboto in the prefecture of Yoto on September 11, 1982, Aba Amivi T. is married and mother of one child who is enrolled in primary school. She owns a little spare parts store she calls "Les Ezekias", in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase 50 motorcycle tires and 30 innertubes so that she can better serve her customers and increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Gboto dans la préfecture de Yoto, le 11 septembre 1982, T. Aba Amivi est mariée et mère d’un enfant qui fait les études primaires. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de vente des pièces détachées dénommée « LES EZEKIAS » située dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé.

Elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA pour acquérir cinquante pneus (50) de moto et trente (30) chambres à air afin de mieux servir ses clients et d’augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use:
Stock up on tires for re-sale

Faire le stock de pneus

loans.name: Zubeda's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Zubeda is 38 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 18,14,9 and 4. Zubeda has been a artificial flowers and decoration seller since 2005. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more decorations items and artificial flowers for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothes sales, sewing, shoes sales, charcoal and soap sales and the restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more decoration items and artificial flower for her business.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia is a woman with a humble heart. Since having her loving children she has worked steadily with the end goal that they will never suffer any deprivation and that they will be able to complete a higher education. Currently, in spite of her advanced age, she continues to enjoy the same fortituD., tenacity and diligence with which she began to work. Thanks to these qualities, her business of selling second-hand stuffed animals has granted her much satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Zenovia, es una mujer humilD. D. corazón, desD. que les otorgó el don D. vida a sus queridos hijos trabajó firmemente con el fin D. que no pasen privaciones y puedan concluir sin problemas sus estudios superiores.Actualmente pese a su avanzada edad sigue gozando D. la misma fortaleza, constancia y diligencia con la que empezó a trabajar, gracias a esas cualidades hasta hace poco tiempo su negocio D. venta D. peluches D. segundo uso le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones.

loans.use: Additional capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim K. raises fish in a pond near his house. He tends to the fish by feeding them and then selling them once they are of adequate size. His wife also helps him with his fish business. They both live in Toul Chambak Village, Kampong Cham Province.

Because of the growing demand for his fish, he is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase small fish and additional fish food. The loan will allow him and his wife to expand their fish business, and thereby increase their family income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase small fish and additional fish food

loans.name: Wilmer Raydo

texts.es:
Wilmer is a young man who has the opportunity to work as a farmer. He continues to work arduously on his coffee plant fields, where he works with much joy and optimism. He has the ambition to one day become the best coffee merchant in his area. Not only that, but he would also like to have the opportunity to export his crops to other countries. This dream propels him to keep improving his crops on a daily basis. Nevertheless, at this time he needs financial support in order to expand his coffee plant fields. For this reason, he is requesting a loan, money that he hopes you will be able to help him obtain, thus improving both crop production and his income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Wilmer es un joven que tiene la oportunidad de desarrollarse como agricultor, no deja de trabajar arduamente sus cultivos de café, donde trabaja con mucha alegría y optimismo.Tiene la ambición de ser algún día el mejor comerciante de café de su zona, y no tan solo eso, sino también tener la oportunidad de exportar a otros países, este sueño lo impulsa a que día a día siga mejorando sus productos.Sin embargo, en estos momentos necesita un apoyo económico para crecer y ampliar sus cultivos de café, por ello solicita un préstamo, dinero que espera usted pueda ayudar a conseguir, y así mejorar su producción y sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase coffee plants and improve their quality

loans.name: Laura Y Tereza Group

texts.es:
Laura and Tereza are members of the Communal Bank Sarita.

Laura is married, 23 years old, and has 1 son. Laura and her husband are artisans, they make Ayacuchan retablos, which are wooden boxes decorated with images and customs of the area. This is an activity they learned from their parents. From time to time they have an assistant who helps them, depending on the orders they have. They sell their products in the Artesanal market.

Tereza is married, 19 years old, and has 1 son. Tereza and her husband sell beer that they distribute to the stores and also according to any orders that they receive. Tereza, with the loan that she will receive, will be starting a new business selling clothing.

Lara and Tereza need loans of 600 and 800 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of wood, paint, plaster, shirts, and pants.

Laura and Tereza have dreams of having a larger workshop, a gallery, and providing a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Laura y Tereza son socias del Banco Comunal Sarita.

Laura es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Laura junto a su esposo son artesanos, elaboran retablos ayacuchanos, que son cajones de madera en la que se plasman las costumbres de la zona, actividad que aprendieron de sus padres, en algunas oportunidades tienen un personal que les ayuda, dependiendo de los pedidos que tengan, sus ventas lo realizan en el mercado Artesanal.

Mientras que Tereza es conviviente, tiene 19 años y 1 hijo, Tereza junto a su esposo venden cervezas que reparten a las tiendas y también pedidos que puedan tener, Tereza con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa.

Laura y Tereza necesitan prestamos de 600 soles, 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera, pinturas, yeso, polos pantalones.

Los sueños de Laura y Tereza son tener un taller más grande, una galería y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Laura and Tereza wil purchase wood, paint, plaster, shirts and pants

loans.name: Kiazia

texts.en:
Kiazia A. is 27 and married. She has four children who are 12, 10, 6, and 3 from her first husband, who unfortunately passed away. Kiazia previously sold Swahili fabrics called vitenge and kangas but she switched to a wholesale drinks business in 2007. She sells soda, juice, and water to smaller shops in Dar es Salaam. She works daily from 7 am until 6 pm, and is able to earn a monthly profit between $216 and $259.

This will be Kiazia's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two loans to increase her stock and has paid both loans back successfully. With the loan she hopes to receive now, she intends to use it similarly to increase the stock of her shop.

loans.use: To increase stock of drinks in her shop.

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Mrs. Se M., the 28-year-old mother of a three-year-old child, is a rice farmer in Preal Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Sar Pov, is a duck breeder. Se is requesting a loan in order to hire a laborer with a pump and two oxen to both water her crop and plow her rice field; as well, she would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

Se’s husband is shown is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Chuma Group

texts.en:
Mengi T., age 34, is married with three children (ages 8, 4 and 2). He also cares for two children of his late brother (ages 16 and 14). He has a butcher business which he started in 1998. He works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make around $333 per month.

In the past, Mengi has taken out five loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the loans to open a general store and the butcher shop. He now hopes for a loan to start building a frame for another general store. Mengi will share this loan with his subgroup members, who have butcher shops and cafes. His subgroup is part of a loan group called Chuma. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Mengi is the first on the right, standing in a red T-shirt.

loans.use: To build a general store

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es:
La señora Gliceria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, es madre de un hijo, es Enfermera y vive en el Jr. Puno Nº 221, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al  Siglo XXI” en Juli. En un inicio con el préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió, compró bordados en bayeta para poder vender en Cusco. Inició esta actividad económica cuando entró al Banco Comunal y con el cual continua trabajando. Su esposo trabaja en el Sector Educación.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados de diversos diseños.

Su sueño es salir adelante y conseguir un lugar seguro donde vender sus bordados.
texts.en:
Gliceria is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is a nurse, and lives on Puno Street in the district of Juli, Chuchito province, in Puno. She is a member of the cooperative bank “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” (“Women of the 21st Century”). With an original loan of 300.00 soles that she received, she bought cloth embroideries to sell in Cusco. She started this initial activity when the cooperative bank arrived, and she continues to work with them. Her husband works in the educational sector. With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy embroideries of varied designs. Her dreams include to get ahead and to obtain a secure location from which to sell her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase embroideries of varied designs.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol K. is 33 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom province where she owns and runs a pigpen for raising pigs behind her house.  

She normally sells all her pigs for slaughter in six months time after she begins raising them.  She can raise at least two pigs per year.  K. has been running this business since 1993 and is currently earning $8 a day.  

She is responsible for her two children; both of whom are teenagers and go to school.  Her husband, Mr. Sao Sreng, 33, sells wood carvings for a profit. 

To purchase additional pigs to raise, Pol K. requested a loan as capital.  This will help her to save and buy more piglets for raising.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising

loans.name: Se

texts.en: Se S. is 27 years old and stays at home at Bati district, Takeo province with her husband, pictured here. Since 2005, she has raised pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$2 a day. Her husband runs a business selling ice-cream in the village, making on average, about US$25 in revenue per day. The couple has one young child. Se S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a big box to store ice-cream for sale. This will allow her husband to increase the number of ice-creams he can store and sell each day.

loans.use: To purchase a big box to store ice-cream.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy A. is twenty–five years old. She is divorced and has one child, a boy in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Being a single parent, Dorothy works very hard to provide for herself and her son. 
She deals in ready-made clothes for both sexes. Dorothy buys her goods from big boutiques in the cities. She says she treks to nearby markets to do business. Dorothy has been in business for six years.
Dorothy wants a loan to buy varieties of textiles in bulk so she can offer goods in many more places. It is her dream to sponsor her child to have the best of education.

loans.use: To buy dresses

loans.name: Lillian Maria

texts.es: Lillian María Z. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica  a la que Doña Lillian se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio ya que inicio con muy poco inventario pero poco a poco con la ayuda de una amiga decidió solicitar un financiamiento y fue así que su negocio logro prosperar. Los propósitos de Doña Lillian son de mantener siempre activo su negocio ya que es la base fundamental para su manutención. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de carne, gaseosas, golosinas y otros. Los deseos de Doña Lillian son de convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 14.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Lillian María Z. is 44 years old and is single. The economic activity that Lillian does for a living is that she has a small grocery store. For the past four years she has had this business, which began with very little inventory but little by little with the help of a friend she decided to apply for a loan and it was through this that her business has been able to prosper. Lillian's objectives are keep her business always active as it is the fundamental way that she supports herself. The loan that she is applying for will be used for working capital to purchase meat, soft drinks, sweets and other things. Lillian's wish is to turn her small grocery store into a distributor. The amount that she is requesting is C$ 14.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Faamomoi

texts.en:
Faamomoi S., 45, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the general public/villagers 4 days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Faamomoi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy materials needed for the business.

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour, baking powder, soy sauce, yeast and large pots.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena P., 43, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (~416 USD).  SPBD loans are Elena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals,fertilizer,bushknives,wheelbarrow, and weed killing spray.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol G. B. solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio, se llama “yoyis”  ya tiene establecido 3 años. Aunque su crédito es pequeño comenta que le sacaría provecho ya que con lo que le presten compraría cosas diferentes que al cliente le gusten y así con la compra que le hagan darle vuelta al dinero.
Si esposo trabaja en una maquiladora y ayuda a la señora en sus ratos libres en la tienda.
texts.en:
Marisol G. B. requests a loan to diversify her business named “Yoyis” which has been established for 3 years. Even though her loan request is small she comments that she would take advantage of it given that with what she would loan she would purchase various things that the clients would like and with the purchases they make she would turn the money around. Her husband works in a border assembly plant and helps her on his free time with the store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca P., 38, is a divorced mother of three children, a daughter and two sons attending the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Goaso, one of the busy business centres in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.  Rebecca is a trader, operating a roadside provisions store in her community. She buys her provisions in Kumasi. In business now for two years, Rebecca is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. She hopes to expand the business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
La socia JANETT, es originaría de Calca, ella vive en el sector de Huarán, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, posee una zona bastante cálida y rica en productos.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años, es conviviente y tienen 2 hijos de (7 Y 3) años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, nuestra socia exporta granos de maíz fuera del Perú, ella también tiene un abarrotes en el que vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, harinas, leche, entre otros productos, la socia desea el préstamo en razón de que deberá preparar su terreno y sembrar para la nueva cosecha de maíz.

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Janett is a native of Calca. She lives in the Huarán sector, which is located in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas. Her zone is very warm and rich in products. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has two children ages seven and two. She alternates her work between home and agriculture. She exports corn. She also has a grocery where she sells rice, sugar, oil, flour, and milk, among other things. She needs a loan because she needs to prepare her land and plant for the new corn harvest. She is very grateful for the loan, and she promises to repay her debt in the agreed upon time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and stock her grocery store

loans.name: Favor Group

texts.en:
Juah is a single woman with two children. She is able to send them both to private school with the profits from her used clothing business. Juah has been running her used clothing business for 3 years. She moves her business around to different markets and puts her good clothes out. Then she rings a bell to attract customers.

Juah hopes that one day she will be able to go out of the country to purchase more goods. If she is able to do that she thinks that her family will be able to live in harmony together.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Maria Roberta Rebeca

texts.es:
La señora María Roberta  tiene ya más de catorce años dedicándose a la venta de artículos de belleza, papelería y juguetes, esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda y bajo su responsabilidad dos hijas. 
Desea invertir en el negocio la venta de artesanía Mexicana, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir, ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos del la nueva inversión que tendrá el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Roberta has been dedicated to the sale of toys, beauty and stationery products for about 14 years. This business is the source of income for her family. She became a widow recently and has two daughters that depend on her. She wants to start selling Mexican crafts, but does not have the capital to invest on it. She is asking for a loan and is planning to pay it back with the new business income.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Severina

texts.es:
La señora Severina Q. G.  tiene 60 años y estuvo casada pero su esposo viajo hace 15 años a España a trabajar y no sabe de él desde entonces. Tiene 1 hija de 19 años que es madre de una niña de 8 meses, la cual ayuda constantemente con el cuidado de las vacas y por las noches estudia peluquería en la cuidad. La señora Severina vive en la comunidad de Maica Central en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche utiliza para elaborar queso y venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Severina se dedica a elaborar queso hace más de 40 años y sus quesos son conocidos en la zona por su excelente calidad.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de Alimento para su ganado (Challa y Soya) que por problemas de sequia el costo de la misma subió mucho y no le alcanza para comprar todo el alimento que sus vacas necesitan. De este modo no tendría problemas de seguir produciendo la misma cantidad de leche que ya produce y la cantidad de queso ni la calidad bajarían. La señora Severina espera poder obtener otro préstamo una vez finalizado este para poder comprar un equipo de peluqueria para que su hija trabaje de peluquera y pueda ganar dinero para poder mejorar su nivel de vida y de su hija de 8 meses.
texts.en:
Mrs. Severina Q. G. is 60 years old and was married but her husband traveled to Spain to work 15 years ago and she has not heard from him since. She has 1 daughter, 19 years old, who is the mother of an 8 month old girl, who studys hairdressing in the city and helps with the constant care of the cows at night. Mrs. Severina lives in Central Maica of the Cochabamba community, where she has 3 cows whose milk is produced and sold in different markets of the city of Cochabamba. Mrs Severina has been selling milk and cheeses, known in the area for its excellent quality, for more than 40 years. The loan will be used to purchase food for her livestock (Chall and soybeans) because the drought increased the cost of the same lot and she does not have enough to buy all the food the cows need. With the loan she would have no problem continuing to produce the same amount of milk that she already produces, nor would the quantity and quality of the cheese decrease. Mrs. Severina hopes to be able to get another loan after this to buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter so that she can work in hairdressing and earn money to improve her standard of living and that of her8 month old daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock feed

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle O. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 47 years old. Annabelle is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Annabelle operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of fruit products in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Annabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Annabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mercy Masaba Sylivia Group

texts.en: Sylivia M. is a twenty- seven year old business lady who is married with five children in school. She is taking care of two dependents also going to school. She has had a spare parts business for four years. Sylivia is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts in large volume to increase her stock and her profit.  Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in large volume .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorbike as a taxi

loans.name: Hudoiberdi

texts.ru: Худойберди Сафаров проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст  51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Худойберди более 2 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. У него есть также постоянные клиенты, мясники. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Hudoiberdi S. lives in the Yavan region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has four children. Hudoiberdi has been doing animal husbandry for more than two years. He feeds and sells large cattle. He has regular customers butchers. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor M. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Flor owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Flor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Flor is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely T. is 50 years old and lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is a married woman and has two children who are both studying. Like every parent’s dream, she also wishes to provide a complete education for her two children. She hopes that her business and her husband’s business can contribute to the attainment of their dreams. 

Mely has been raising hogs as her way of living for a very long time. She lets her sow get pregnant and raises new hogs. This way, she can make more savings after selling her piglets. She feeds them with special feeds, and according to her, she needs additional capital to buy a supply of feeds for her grown-up pigs. She is borrowing at least 4,000 PHP for her piggery. She is hoping that lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: To buy supply of feeds

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a farmer working in the agriculture sector since 2000 and has 15 years of experience in this field. He is married with one child. Today, Khalil is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy tools and merchandise for his business.

loans.use: buy tools and merchandise

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida N. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Zenaida owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en:
Adenike is a married with 2 children. She is 33 years old. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.

Adenike sells medicines and groceries to make a living. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Jahantab Group

texts.en:
This is Jahantab Group which is made up of five female members. These women wish to take a group loan of 70,000 Afghani.

Gulaly who is 35, has a business doing embroidery work. She is married with four children, all students. With the loan, she would like to expand her business as she would like to support her husband and her children.

The second member is Meher who is a bead worker. She started this business during the Taliban regime because at that time women had no choice to go outside to work. Thus she decided to start the bead-work business in her home to support her husband and her children.

Afghani is the third member and she would like to receive a loan for her brother who is a taxi driver. With the loan he needs to change the engine of his taxi.

Saltanat would like to take a loan for her husband who has a cart from which he sells chips with burgers. He is a hardworking man and works seven days a week. With the loan he wants to buy more essential materials for his business.

The last member of this group is Latifa who wants to take a loan for her husband who has a shop selling cosmetics. He would like to progress his business and buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Refurbish her workshop, buy sewing machines and other work equipment

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega, el señor Santos Z. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería siendo esta la que le permite obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su vivienda. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un novillo y dos bueyes con el propósito de llevar a cabo la crianza respectiva y sacarles el máximo provecho a estos animales. 
Espera confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así beneficiará a su familia que tanto depende de él por ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Santos Z. raises cattle in Somotillo, Chinandega. This is his sole source of income. He is asking for funding to buy a calf an two bullocks to breed in order to get the most profit from these animals. He hopes confidently that the loan will be granted for the benefit of his family that so depends on him because he's such a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en:
Fiapaipai N. is 25 and married with 2 children (ages 10 and 13).  She is starting a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Fiapaipai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fiapaipai joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fiapaipai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fiapaipai N. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Uralbek

texts.en:
For the past 12 years, Uralbek has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle, which he cares for with great care, since it is thanks to them that he can cover his household expenses. Uralbek showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. 

Uralbek considers his work very important, which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional young cattle so that he can earn more money in the future. This will help him generate additional income for his family. We appreciate your support for Uralbek’s projects.     

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Known for its epic mountain passes, the country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent of arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Edward B.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Mabonkani village, in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1972 by the Wesleyan Church of Sierra Leone (WCSL) to educate the children of Mabonkani village and near-by villages. Currently, the school is staffed with eight teachers and has 318 pupils.

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Edward B. S. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 60-year-old was born in Mabonkani village. He is married to a teacher and they have five children.  Edward, who has been a teacher for thirty-eight years, is requesting a loan of SLL 1,500,000 in order to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children. 

(Attached to this photo is the snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Pay school fees and school-related charges for his children

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi N. is a businesswoman who has operated a food kiosk for the last 12 years. Her kiosk is in the Reef Majengo area. She is 38 years old and a single mother. She has seven children.

Chizi was introduced by a fellow member to KADET. This is her first experience with a microfinance organization. She joined KADET three months ago and she is now ready to access her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 after undergoing training with KADET. She intends to expand her business by buying flour and sugar and renovating her premises with this loan.

Her dream is to own a classic hotel along the coast of the Indian Ocean.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar and renovate her premises

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena J., age 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Ausenio, a vegetable vendor, and their marriage is blessed with 2 children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing a variety store while helping in her husband’s vegetable business.

Elena has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and consistently pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow from CCT’s Cooperative quite a few times. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will use the loan funds to buy more of the products that she needs to replenish and maintain operations of her businesses.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a happy and comfortable life for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to add to her product inventory

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Mr. K., 55, lives in Kompong Cham Province and earns a low income. He is a good and determined father who has tried to support his five children since they were very young. Now, four of his children are married and live on their own, while the fifth is single and attends school. Mr. Kouen is a widower.

To earn a living, Mr. Kouen does farm work. Every day in the late morning, he goes to the field next to his house where he plants various crops. He also raises a few pigs in a stall for additional income. Mr. K. is seeking a loan as working capital to invest in growing a better potato crop.

loans.use: To improve his potato crop.

loans.name: Las Alondras Group

texts.es:
Las Alondras tiene como miembros mujeres positivas y luchadoras como es el caso de Carmen quien empezó su negocio hace vaR. años ella está trabajando dentro de un programa que se llama Wawa wasi donde es madre cuidadora de niños entre 6 meses y 2 años de edad además por las noches se dedica a la venta de comida rapida como: salchipapas y hamburguesas, esto le permite tener mayores ingresos para los gastos en su casa. En el futuro a ella le gustaría tener un negocio mas simple y al que no le dedique mucho tiempo ya que sufre de una enfermedad  a los huesos.    

Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of Las Alondras are positive and tenacious women. Carmen is one of them. She started her business several years ago. She works in a program called “Wawa Wasi”, where she takes care of children between the ages of six months and two years old. Also, in the evenings she sells fast food like “salchipapas” (fried potato and sausages) and hamburgers. This allows her to have greater income for the household expenses. In the future she would like to have an easier business. She wants one where she does not have so spend a lot of time because she has a bone illness. The members are grateful for and value the support given them through this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Hugo Leonel

texts.es: Hugo tiene 51 años de edad vive solo en el país su esposa se encuentra en el extrajero hace 2 años ella obtuvo visa de contrato y trabaja en los Estados Unidos, Hugo con su esfuerzo pudo comprar hace aproximadamente 8 años un equipo para discoteca y ahora le agradece a Dios por ello, lo alquila para cualquier evento que a él lo contaten y de so obtiene sus ganacias. A parte de eso el es maestro de educación Física y Arbitro a la vez. A Hugo lo contratán 3-4 veces a la semana, él es ambulante alquila su equipo o instrumento de sonido en San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, o en cualquier lugar donde soliciten sus servicios. Solicita el crédito para comprar una bocina ya que la que tenia se arruino y quiere comprar una nueva y vender la viejita, también una consola ya que le es muy útil y le urge, también una luces de a colores ya que tiene solo de un color. Su sueño es tener 2 alquileres de equipos o instrumentos para discoteca o/y a parte de eso contratar a un cantante cristiano ya que lo solicitan mucho para las bodas.
texts.en:
Hugo, age 51, lives alone in the country. His wife has been living abroad for two years. She got a work visa and works in the United States. Through his efforts Hugo was able to buy discotheque equipment eight years ago. Now, he thanks God for it. He rents it out for various events that he is hired for, and that is how he gets his income. Besides that, he is a physical education teacher and a referee. Hugo is hired 3-4 times a week. He is an itinerant worker who rents his equipment or sound instument in San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, or in any other place where they request his services. His is requesting a loan to buy a loudspeaker because the one he has is ruined. He wants to buy a new one and sell the old one. He also wants a large instrument board because they are very useful and he urgently needs it. Also, he will buy some colored lights because he only has one color. His dream is to have two sets of rental equipment or discotheque instruments and or use part of this to contract a Christian singer because they are requested a lot for weddings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invert more in his business

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en: Eneria T. is from Litapan, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Eneria owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Eneria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Eneria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eneria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Eneria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ngombol1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NGOMBOL 1 est créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village.

Mariama C., (la femme qui lève la main debout en deuxième position à partir de la gauche) est présidente du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de lait caillé. Elle achète du lait frais de vache, le fait cailler et le vende en faisant du porte à porte. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans.
Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter périodiquement 40 seaux de lait.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle réalise à partir de son activité elle participe à la prise en charge la famille en achetant des provisions pour la nourriture.
texts.en:
Solidarity group NGOMBOL 1 was created on December 28, 2009. It's part of the "Banc Villageois de THIEO". It is composed of 14 women, all from the same village. Mrs. C. (second women from the left on the back in the picture, raising her hand) is the group's president. She's 35 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children she has to support. She has a small business selling yogurt. She buys fresh cow milk, turns it into yogurt, and sells it door to door. She's been running this business for five years. Her new loan will enable her to buy 40 buckets of milk on a regular basis. With the profits drawn her business, she helps to support her family by purchasing food.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 buckets of fresh cow milk

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn B. lives in Brgy. Pandan, Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: Direct Selling (Personal Collection), Tricycle Operator, and Jewelry business. Her common-law husband, Jerry Dela Cruz, who is 40 years old, works as a Policeman to earn his living.  She has 2 children who are 5 years old and 8 years old.

Rocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 40,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital, so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children, to buy her own land, and build her own house. Rocelyn B. is a Dungganon woman, who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario vive en el Barrio Villa Warnes,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches junto con sus hijas, ella es profesora  y trabaja por las mañanas en colegio fe y alegría de la zona del plan 3000. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar un horno, mesas y sillas para ampliar su puesto de venta ya que  su clientela  esta aumentado y desea diversificar su menú. La Sra. Rosario se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, ya que se dedica a dos actividades, Tiene una hija quien le ayuda en la pensión y tiene también el apoyo de su esposo, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Señora Rosario lives in the Villa Warnes neighbourhood. With her daughters, she sells food every evening; she is also a teacher and works during the day at the Fe y Alegría College in [a district called] Zone 3000. The loan she is seeking is to purchase an oven, tables and chairs so that she can enlarge her diner. The number of customers is already increasing, and she wishes to diversify her menu. Señora Rosario describes herself as an enterprising and very hard-working woman - as she has shown by dedicating herself to two jobs at once. She has a daughter who helps in the diner, and the support of her husband. She is very grateful to this institution for offering their support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an oven, tables and chairs

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
Don José de 58 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y 5 hijos, la mayor de 14 años de edad y la menor de 5 años, ellos residen en el cantón la Laguna, caserío los G. de Corinto en Morazán. José se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y la crianza de ganado, el aprendió la siembra de hortalizas desde que era muy pequeño, pues su padre se dedicaba a ese oficio, él no tiene un horario fijo para le siembra, y que a veces le ocasiona problemas las plagas porque le dañan su producción. Hoy don José necesita un crédito el cual invertirá en la siembra de seis tareas de tomate y tres tareas de chile, comprando los materiales necesarios como es la semilla, abono y el tratamiento para plagas.
Este crédito ayudara a don José a mejorar su cosecha, a obtener mejores hortalizas sanas para su comercialización y para el consumo familiar y así que sus ingresos familiares sean mayores.
Sus sueños son obtener una buena producción que le permita tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 58 years old, is married and lives with his wife and five children. The oldest daughter is 14 years old and the youngest is 5. They live in the Laguna canton, in the Los G. de Corinto hamlet in the town of Morazan. Jose plants vegetables and raises cattle. He learned to plant vegetables when he was very young because his father was also in the same activity. He does not have a fixed schedule to plant. Sometimes he has issues with plagues damaging his crop. Currently Jose needs a loan to invest in planting six lots of tomatoes and three lots of peppers by buying the necessary material such as seeds, fertilizer and treatment for plagues. This loan will help Jose improve his harvest, obtain better vegetables to sell and for his family's consumption and to increase his family's income. His dream is to obtain a better harvest which would help him have more income to help his family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds to plant vegetables

loans.name: Santos Israel

texts.es: Santos Isrrael G. A. es un agricultor de 40 años de edad, casado y con cinco hijos, residente en la comunidad de la Concepción en Patuca, Olancho. Desde hace doce años don Santos se dedica a sembrar diferentes tipos de cultivos, como el de la yuca,  frijoles y maíz, mientras que su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y sus hijos al estudio. Una de las dificultades que enfrenta es que en ocasiones le pagan un buen precio por el producto y en ocasiones no. Solicita el préstamo para cultivar y necesita comprar una carga de frijoles, abono y pagar a un empleado para que le ayude. Con el apoyo del préstamo él y su familia gozarán de una mejor condición de vida, ya que con las ganancias obtenidas tendrán lo necesario para el sustento diario. Es su primer crédito en FAMA y espera no tener ningún problema con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Santos Isrrael G. A. is 40 years old, married and has 5 children.  He lives in the community of Concepción in Patuca, Olancho. For 12 years Mr. Santos has worked planting different types of crops such as cassava, beans, and corn, while his wife engaged in household chores and guided their children to study. One of the difficulties he faces is that sometimes you pay a good price for the product and sometimes not.  He is requesting a loan to grow and he needs to buy a load of beans and fertilizer and also pay an employee who helps him.  With the support of the loan he and his family will enjoy a better life, since with the earnings obtained they will have what is necessary for daily sustenance.  This is his first loan with FAMA and he expects to have no problem with his payments.

loans.use: To purchase a load of beans, fertilizer and labor pay

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife in his parents’ house. He has been involved in auto repair for 15 years and finally, in 2008, he opened his own shop, specializing in steering and wheels. He is thankful for his shop and he works hard to cover the increasing costs of food, housing and other family expenses. He is the main income provider for his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new wheels to expand his business operation. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his shop to earn more income and be able to buy his own house for his wife.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Evelyn Cecilia

texts.es:
Evelyn de 38 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután con su familia, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, el negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de este mismo lugar, lo atiende de lunes a domingo, este fue iniciado cuando ella ya se había casado.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería, con este préstamo ella pretende disponer de variedad de prendas de vestir para los clientes, mejorando así su condición como microempresaria y recibiendo ingresos mayores para sostener su hogar.
El objetivo de ella es fortalecer la venta, tener un negocio prospero y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and lives in Juquilisco, in Usultán department, with her family.  She has an 8 year-old daughter.  She has a business selling clothes which she has had for 10 years.  Her business is in the town market and she serves there from Monday to Sunday.  The business was started when she had already married.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.  With this loan she plans to have a variety of garments for her customers, thereby improving her conditions as a small businesswoman and making more income to support her household.

Her goals are to strengthen her sales, to have a successful business and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old.  She lives with her partner and their three children in the village of San Pablo Pomalca in the district of Pomalca, a small rural region near the city of Chiclayo.  Her children are 17, 12 and 10 years old.

For several years, Maria has run a small general store out of her home.  She sells a wide range of products including dry foods, personal products, candy, vegetables, beverages and other items.  In addition, she sells carrots two days a week in the local market, the Mercado Los Patos.  Her husband works as a farmhand for local farms and production facilities.

Maria plans to use the loan to expand her inventory at both the general store and the carrot stand.  This will be her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa and her first experience with a financial institution.  She appreciates the access to credit in order to expand her business and improve her family’s income.  She dreams of providing her children with education from primary school and secondary school through college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She is a tailor who has developed her business in her home. Her husband is the main income provider but like the majority of the Lebanese woman, she works to help him to raise their big family.  

She presents sewing services and she also repairs clothes. Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new sewing machine. That will allow her to increase her production and furthermore deliver her tailored garments faster. She is able to serve a wide range of clients from her home. In the future, she is looking to expand her business and eventually open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Novaya Kahovka. He owns a small business selling office appliances, related components and expendable materials in one of the local malls called “Central.” He launched this business about 12 years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 20,000 UAH in monthly turnover. His monthly net profit is about 7,000 UAH.

Andrei has used microloans before and found them very instrumental for his business development. This time Andrei is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase parts, expendables and other inventory items. A portion of profits generated will be invested in his business while some of it will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts, expendables and other inventory items

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria T. is from the village of Mabantad, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Victoria is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Victoria is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily use products. Victoria is just starting this business.

In 2010, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia, de 55 años,  esta casada con Donato (60) y también vive con  su joven hijo  Michael (22) y juntos viven en su casa que es propia y esta ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.Otilia, es una señora muy alegre y enfocada en sus responsabilidades; se dedica a la atención  en su  bar – recreo que esta ubicado en su zona. En ese lugar ofrece bebidas alcohólicas para el consumo de adultos, además  ofrece platos típicos de la selva como: tacacho con cecina, juane, entre otros, y cuenta con el apoyo de cinco  señoritas dispuestas a brindar una buena atención  a su público concurrente. De esta manera Otilia viene trabajando 10 años y esta agradecida por la preferencia de sus consumidores y los fines de semana cuenta con mayor acogida de público, lo cual le genera mayores ingresos. Algunas veces le incomoda cuando sus clientes  beben  en exceso y se salen del límite; pero ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
