Para el futuro tiene planeado  instalar  una  nueva sucursal con el mismo nombre y la misma zona, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.Es el sétimo préstamo con MFP, por lo cual se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente y así desea obtener los mejores beneficios, además en su banco comunal es una socia integra  porque es muy solidaria.Otilia tiene planeado invertir los   mil soles solicitados, en la compra de implementos que le hacen falta en su negocio, como nuevas sillas, mesas, y también desea  brindarle mantenimiento a su negocio.
texts.en:
Otilia, age 55, is married to 60 year old Donato.  They also live with their young 22 year old son, Michael.  They live together in their own house, which is in the Quimbiri district.

Otilia is a very cheerful woman who is focused on her responsibilities.  She works in her bar, Recreo, which is located in her zone.  She offers alcoholic beverages for adults.  She also sells dishes that are typical of the jungle.  Some of the dishes she offers are “tacacho con cecina” (a mass of roasted green banana, chorizo or jerky, oil, lard, salt and pepper, served with grilled jerky) and  “juane” (rice, hen's meat, olives, boiled eggs and spices, which are enveloped in a leaf of bijao and boiled for around 90 minutes), among others.  She has help from five young women who provide her customers with good service.

This is the way that Otilia has been working for ten years.  She is grateful that her customers prefer her food.  On the week-end she has more customers, which generates more income.  Sometimes she is uncomfortable when her customers drink in excess and go over the limit.  However, she keeps going ahead with her business.

In the future she plans to establish a new branch with the same name in the same zone.  This way she hopes to continue moving ahead.

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She pledges to keep paying punctually.  That way she wants to get better benefits.  Also, she is an upright member of her communal bank because she is very supportive.  Otilia plans to use the requested 1,000 soles to buy things that she needs like new chairs and tables.  She also wants to provide maintenance to her business.

loans.use: Buy items to improve her business

loans.name: Kaeut

texts.en:
Kaeut C., 25, is a married woman who is a local farmer in the province of Kompong Thom. She has been in the farming business since 2005, earning an income of approximately $1.60 per day. Her husband is a furniture maker, and his finished products consist of beds and cupboard. His furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple have been married for a few years, and they have only one child who still lives under their care. 

Recently, Kaeut C.’s husband's business is doing better day to day, so her husband wishes to buy additional wood in order to make beds for sale. This is the reason why Kaeut C. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy additional wood in order to make beds for sale

loans.name: Miralakbar

texts.en:
A. Miralakbar is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has one son, age 7, to whom he would like to offer a better life and a good education. To realize this dream, Miralakbar works seven days a week and eight to nine hours per day. He earns about $505 every month from his cattle breeding business. He is a diligent person, who started his own cattle breeding business when he was younger, in 1990. 

Miralakbar requested a loan of 2,000 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva. This is his second loan taken from Aqroinvest. Miralakbar has a good client history from repaying his prior loan. With this second loan he bought four more cows to increase his earnings. 

Miralakbar wants to breed more animals and raise his profits, and in this way support a better life for his dear son.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Rosa Mariela

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío El Carbón del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, ella cría gallinas, patos, pavos y  también cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace más de tres años, cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Rosa desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales con la finalidad de obtener animales con más tamaño y buen peso que le permitirá venderlos a un buen precio incrementando por supuesto su ganancia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 32 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and her son in the El Carbón settlement in the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  It is an agricultural zone situated in the Piura region, which is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises and sells small animals and poultry.  She raises chickens, ducks, and turkeys.  She also raises pigs in back of her house.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the businessmen who usually visit the zone where she lives.  She has been doing this for over three years, and she has established customers in her zone.

Rosa wants to get balanced feed for her animals so that they will be bigger and of a good weight.  This will allow her to sell them for a good price, which, of course, will increase her earnings.  That is why she believes it is advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,200 soles.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Angela has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second business of selling shoes.  

To help expand her business, Angela has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Angela hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Angela hopes to become a popular singer.   

Angela is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get more capital from her business than before.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cristela Del Socorro

texts.es: Cristela Del Socorro, desde hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a la crianza y destace de cerdo, por lo que inicio como su principal fuente de ingresos ya que así elabora los diferentes productos como frito, pepena entre otros derivados del cerdo, pues es por medio de su familia que ella decide incursionar en este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de 4 cerdos por lo que tiene que recorrer grandes distancias en ciertas comunidades para obtener precios favorables. El sueño de ella es mantener este negocio activo que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Cristela Del Socorro has been raising and butchering pigs for over six years.  She started doing this as her primary source of income because she makes different pork products like fried pork and “pepena” (pork intestine).  She decided to get into this business through her family.

The loan she is now requesting is to buy four pigs.  She needs to travel far to get to certain communities in order to get good prices.

Her dream is to keep her business active; it is her main source of income.

loans.use: to buy four pigs

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Genoveva es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos mayores D. edad.
Lleva 10 años con la familia D. Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica al servicio D. costura, cuando es época D. colegio es cuando tiene más pedidos.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 metros D. tela, 2 kilos D. retazos, 1 docena D. cierre, ½ docena D. botones, 1 cinta satinada.
Su esposo es empleado público y tiene que estar siempre midiéndose en los gastos del hogar para hacer alcanzar el dinero.  Gracias a éste negocio ella pueD. solventar algunos gastos del hogar.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos y sobre todo por las charlas educativas que dan a las socias.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the "Nuevas Amigas" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 57 years old, married, and has 6 grown-up children.

Genoveva has been working with the Manuela Ramos family for 10 years.  Her business is sewing and she has most orders during the school season.  She will use her new loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles to buy 6 meters of fabric, 2 kilos of remnants, one dozen sets of fasteners, half a dozen sets of buttons and one lot of satin ribbon.

Genoveva's husband is a public employee and they always have to balance their household expenses carefully in order to make the money stretch.  Thanks to her business, Genoveva is able to cover some household expenses.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her loans and, above all, for the educational talks that they give to their members.

loans.use: to buy fabric and fasteners wholesale

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
V. Hamza sells spare parts for cars. He has been in this business for 16 years and is an experienced entrepreneur. His kiosk is located in a good location where many people pass by. Hamza is very disciplined and hardworking. He also knows how to listen to people and build good relationships. He started his business because he wanted to be financially independent from the government and other employers. He has an analytical mind and is always thinking of ways to develop his business. Hamza has applied for a loan to generate more income and invest in new ideas. He understands that in business one always needs to adjust and change to be successful.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy earns a living through farming. She grows rice to sell. She currently needs farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She applied for a loan so that she could fund her farm. Nancy hopes for her farm to grow.

Nancy is 45 years old and is a married woman. She has six children and the oldest is 23 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Saningo

texts.en:
Saningo is 24 years old, married, has been a farmer for the last eight years.  He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area.

This is his third loan and he plans to purchase farm supplies and livestock to fatten. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.  His dream is to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area.

 He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies and animals

loans.name: Isererero Farmers Group

texts.en: 35-year-old January has been operating a butcher shop for the last decade in Kihihi. Before he embarked on this business, he was mostly preoccupying himself with a timber sales business. January is happily married with four kids and he says he began this butchery business with savings from his timber sales business. Weekly he says his sales revenue totals shillings 150,000 and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more goats for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell their meat.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur is 61 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in Dornod province in Mongolia. His son, who is 24 years old, attends college. 

Gantumur manages a meat trading business from a rented stall at a trading center in his town. He started his business after working as a butcher for several years. His son helps with the family business by collecting animals from herders in the countryside.  Gantumur's  products are well-known among his customers for quality and reasonable prices.  He has been able to build a strong customer base. His working capital has now reached 2,500,000 MNT and he is planning to expand his business in the future.   

Gantumur is an open-minded and delightful man who says, "I am trying hard to better my living condition."  He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Yumjir

texts.en:
Yumjir is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2008 and has gained much experience. 

He is a polite man who is planning to have plot of land in the future. 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos (3 independientes). Cuenta con educación primaria.
Se dedica a la venta de maná (cereal dulce), cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijas, nos cuenta que su esposo en tapicería, pero la ayuda en lo que puede.
Desde hace nueve años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco fanegas de maíz, dos bolsas de azúcar y otros insumos que necesita.
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas educativas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of  the Community Bank “Niño Jesús de Praga” ("Baby Jesus of Prague"), which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Department of Puno.  She is 48 years old, married and has 5 children (3 of whom are independent).  She has primary-level education.

Juana works selling maná (sweet popped corn), with the help of her husband and daughters.  She tells us that her husband works in upholstery, but he helps her as he can.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nine years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 New Soles, money which she invested in her business.

With this new loan of 1200 New Soles, she will buy five bushels of corn, two bags of sugar and other ingredients that she needs.

Her dream is to continue with her business and improve their income.  What she likes about the Community Bank are the meetings and educational talks about business.

loans.use: to buy five bushels of corn, two bags of sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lavurik

texts.ru:
Лавурик родилась в 1948 году. Она живет в городе Севане вместе со своей семьей, которая состоит из ее мужа, сына и невестки. 
До 1995 года Лавурик работала на швейной фабрике, а на протяжении последних 16 лет она занимается собственным бизнесом: продает одежду на Севанской городской ярмарке. Лавурик продает одежду как для взрослых, так и для детей. Ее муж помогает ей в бизнесе и еженедельно они ездят за покупкой товара для бизнеса в Ереван. Товар они покупают на оптовых рынках Еревана. 
В преддверии начала учебного года Лавурик хочет увеличить ассортимент предлагаемой продукции и для этого ей необхорим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм. Данный кредит является для Лавурик седьмым, и она никогда не задерживала свои выплаты по кредиту.
texts.en: Lavurik was born in 1948. She lives in the town of Sevan with her family, which consists of her husband, son and daughter. Prior to 1995, Lavurik worked in a sewing factory, and for the past sixteen years, she has worked in her own business: selling clothes at the Sevan city market. Lavurik sells clothing for both adults and children alike. Her husband helps her in the business and they go every week to buy goods for the business in Yerevan. They buy goods in wholesale markets in Yerevan. In anticipation of the school year Lavurik wants to increase the range of products she offers, and for this she needs a loan of $ 1,000,000 AMD. This loan is Lavurik's seventh, and she has never been late paying for a loan.

loans.use: To add her stall's clothes assortment

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Uganda. She is single with 4 children and all go to school. Teopista sells roasted maize from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 7 years and works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more fresh maize. 

Her goals are to build her own shop and also expand her business. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Teopista lives in a rented house. The family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her monthly expenses are rent, medication and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fresh maize for roasting

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni A. is 42 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has two adult children, both married. Her husband works as a farmer.  Though Ni A. often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for 10 years.  

Ni A. is the head of the Sari Indah group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s second loan with MUK.  With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni A. receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 54, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a maintenance worker, and a father to her 4 children. The oldest child is already working, one is in elementary school, and two are still staying at home. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, Victoria is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Victoria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Victoria hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Thelma has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has run this business for seven years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fish for resale.
Thelma has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Orkhontuya

texts.en:
Orkhontuya is a 29-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her husband and two children, ages 6 and 11, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, or a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district of the city. Her elder son attends a local secondary school, and her daughter attends kindergarten while their father works at a geological company. 

Orkhontuya supports her family by operating a women's clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market with rental stalls.  She has been running this business since 2002. In 2006, she bought a small stall and increased her working capital.  Today her working capital is approximately three million MNT. Usually, she imports her products from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Orkhontuya is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety clothing to sell at her own small stall. “I’m really thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving me an opportunity to improve my business. I will work hard”, our trusted client Orkhontuya said.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jacinto Rufino

texts.es:
Jacinto Rufino tiene 56 años de edad vive en unión libre no tiene hijos vive con la esposa en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.
Jacinto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol, café, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque va a invertir en la agricultura y le va a generar ganancias.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño es poder  contar con salud y seguir trabajando en la agricultura  y seguir mejorando los ingresos. En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte como indor futbol, gallos.
texts.en:
Jacinto Rufino is 56 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

The San Nicolas community bank is located in San Nicolás, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn.

Jacinto is a farmer who grows corn, rice, beans, coffee and cacao.  He makes his purchases and sales in San Jacinto.  He is requesting this loan to invest in his farming.  He will buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, Matamonte (a herbicide), fertilizers and weedkiller so that he can keep his crops in good condition.

This loan will be very helpful to Jacinto because he will invest it in his farming which will make him profits.

The challenges that Jacinto frequently faces are competition, pests and crop diseases.  His dream is to enjoy good health, keep farming and continue improving his income.

In his free time, Jacinto enjoys taking part in sports such as indoor soccer and cockfighting.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, Matamonte (herbicide), fertilizers and weedkiller

loans.name: Ngetich

texts.en:
Ngetich is age 27 and married with 2 children who are 4 and 2 years old. He has been in farming for 10 years. He currently employs one farmhand and sells his produce of milk to the local market. He also operates a motorcycle transport business. 

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow for his dairy farming business. He says the additional cow will boost his dairy income and enable him to expand his transport business as well. He is optimistic the businesses will continue to grow and be able to provide for the family's basic needs.

He says lack of finances is the major challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Belkis Mercedes

texts.es:
Ceprodel está velando por el desarrollo y mejora del nivel de vida de los maestros nicaragüense, en este caso, Belkis ha combinado dos Profesiones las que le permiten tener mejores ingresos como son la de magisterio actualmente subdirector en un colegio de Quezalguaque y la ejecución de un saloncito de belleza, ya que tiene 4 años de desempeñar dichas actividades. 
Como una persona amante de su profesión ella es soltera, y quiere lograr la época donde esta profesión de la belleza tiene buen mercado lo quiere aprovechar. Para ello está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de equipo y productos  como, plancha, crema, permanente, Vitaminas, Secadora, Espejo todo para el salón de Belleza, ya que la labor educativa entra en receso o culminación del año lectivo.
texts.en:
Ceprodel is ensuring the development and improvement of living standards for Nicaragua’s teachers. In this instance, Belkis has combined two professions which enable to her have more income. She is now teaching and a subdirector in a Quezalguaque school, and she runs a beauty salon. She’s been working in these professions for four years. 

As a person who loves her job, she is single. She wants to reach a time with her beauty business has a good clientele that wants her services. For this reason she is asking for a loan to be invested in the purchase of equipment and products like a hair iron, cream, perms, vitamins, a dryer, and a mirror all for the beauty salon as her educational work goes on recess or ends with the school year.

loans.use: to buy hair irons, cream, perms, vitamins, hair treatments, a dryer, and a mirror for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sokoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun and his wife, Pich, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Two of the children are security guards and other five attend school. 

Sokhoeun is a wooden-house builder and a farmer. Pich sells vegetables and she is also a farmer. Sokhoeun is asking for a loan of $500 to continue his farming and buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. He will also use a part of the loan to fill in the land behind his house. There are some tiny ponds behind his house, so he needs to fill it in. 

Photo: Sokhoeun is pictured at his brother’s house.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm and fill in the land behind his house.

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme Zenabo est la responsable du groupe ADONAÏM2.Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Le plus âgé a 5ans et le moins âgé a 3ans. Aucun ne va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments depuis 5ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter un sac d’oignon, un carton de patte de tomate, un plat de tomate fraiche, un demi plat de percile et de celerie, 2kg d’ail, un paquet de Maggi.

Elle prend soin de ses enfants avec ses bénéfices. Ses ambitions sont de scolariser ses enfants et d’agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Zenabo is in charge of the Adonaïm 2 group. She is married and mother to two children, the eldest five years old and the youngest three years old. Neither of Zenabo's children attend school and she also has two other dependents.

She has been selling condiments for five years and gets her supplies at the Pissy market in town. Her customers are both men and women.

Zenabo wants to buy a sack of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a plate of fresh tomatoes, half a plate of parsley and celery, 2kg of garlic and a packet of Maggi stock cubes.

She takes care of her children with her profits and her ambition is to be able to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a dish of fresh tomatoes , half a plate of parsley and celery, 2 kg of garlic and a packet of Maggi stock cubes

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 42-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and has six children.

Khadra has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more goods for her store.

Khadra is looking to improve her family life conditions.

Due to cultural issues, Khadra's son was photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the store.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 43 years old and is married. She has 2 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Ha's husband earns money by working as a driver. Ha earns an income to support her family by making clothes. 

Ha would like to take a loan to buy sewing materials to make a greater range and quantity of clothes to sell.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials to make a greater range and quantity of clothes to sell

loans.name: Nicolasa  Georgina

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa  Georgina es una señora trabajadora, humilde con muchos sueños por cumplir ya que desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Gilberto quien se dedica a la siembra de limones, Doña Nico como mejor la conocen las personas de su localidad se dedica a la  venta de mercancía de abarrotes y a la siembra de limones.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mercancía de barrotes como es: galletas, aceite, maseca, refrescos, jugos, sabritas y yogurt.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Nicolasa Georgina is a hard-working and modest woman. She has many dreams to fulfil, since she wishes to have a better quality of life.

She is happily married to Gilberto, who grows lemons. Nico, as she is better known by local people, sells groceries and grows lemons. She asked for the loan to buy grocery merchandise, such as cookies, cooking oil, tortilla flour, soft drinks, juices, potato chips, and yogurt. 

She thanks the Foundation for the support it has given her to move forward and fulfil her dreams.

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 25 years old and married. She has three children. 

She sells food, such as tea and cooked rice, to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. 

She describes her business environment as good because she has regular customers. Her other source of income is from her farming activities. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 70,000 KES to buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Mercedita has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 14 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Ngân works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future. 

Ngân is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Ngân is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 14 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

This is Ngân first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe,créé en novembre 2012,rassemble des membres qui habitent la même localité et ont comme activité l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Mariama,qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche de la photo,et levant la main,est la représentante du groupe,elle est veuve,est mére de 09 enfants dont 03 garçons.Elle pratique comme activité l'élevage.

Avec le prêt,elle compte acheter 03 ou 04 moutons à 27000f l'unité et 03 chèvres à 32000f l'une.

Le bénéfice servira à élargir son bétail et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: This group, created in November 2012, brings together members who live in the same local area and who earn a living through raising livestock and small-scale retail. Mariama, the woman with her hand raised to the far left of the photo, is the representative for this group. She is a widowed mother to nine children, three boys and six girls. She earns a living through raising livestock. With this loan, Mariama is planning on purchasing three or four sheep for 27,000 CFA each and three goats for 32,000 CFA each. The profits will be put towards growing her herd and increasing her savings.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.en:
My name is Maria Suyapa and I have a specailty food business in my home. I also sell my products in various factories in the city. I have been doing this for several yars and earn enough to pay for family expenses and for my children\\\'s education. I need to invest in order to meet the demand of my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase of Maseca, sugar, fruits, meats, vegetables, cuitos, spices, tracing paper, bags, pajillas, butter, firewood.

Mi Nombre es Maria Suyapa, cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas (productos para consumo Humano) en mi casa de habitacion, y tambien lo distribuyo en las diferentes fabricas de la ciudad, tengo varios años de realizar esta actividad la que me genera ingresos para los gastos familiares y gastos de educacion de mis hijos, necesito invertir mas para satisfacer la demanda de clientes.

loans.use: compra de Maseca, Azucar, frutas, carnes, verduras, cuitos, especias, papel trazo, bolsas, pajillas,manteca, leñas.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is a 32 year-old woman who lives in Pantang, Accra, Ghana. She sells both ladies' and gents' footwear. She carries her goods in basket and sells from house to house to her clients. She wishes she could open her own shop where she can sell her goods. She is seeking a loan of $750 to enable her open a shop.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mazgan

texts.en: Mazgan is 30 years old and lives with members of her family in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and she has 8 years' experience in her job. She wants to take out a loan to buy new machines to increase her business. This will help her find good relationships with people to make a good monthly income to help and support her family. She is very happy now and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra machines

loans.name: Olga Alicia

texts.en:
Olga is a hard-working woman. She is married and has two kids. Her husband works in a security company, however, his salary is very low and insufficient to pay for all the expenses of his family. Owner wants to offer a high quality education to her children and improve their living standards. This will be impossible on the salary of her husband alone. Therefore, Olga found it necessary to generate an extra income and started to sell shoes and dairy products two years ago.

To bolster her business and to continue growing, Olga requested a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise in order to satisfy customer demand, and to offer a good service. She commits to repay this amount in three months. Please be a parts of Olga's accomplishments and help her to make her dreams come true. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de seguridad, sin embargo, su salario es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su familia. Olga desea poder ofrecer una educación de calidad a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, lo que sería imposible solo con el salario de su esposo, por lo que Olga vio la necesidad de un ingreso extra y comenzó a vender zapatos y productos lácteos desde hace dos años.

Para poder darle un impulso a su negocio y continuar creciendo, Olga solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte de los logros de Olga y ayúdala a realizar sus sueños, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
"I would like to borrow money to buy more rice for our rice husking business". A few loans later, Mrs Phan Thị Nhàn and her family have built a small,home based, business of rice husking. Her husband is working alongside with her. Everyday he transports rice and the rice husk from their home to the market 5 km from their home to sell to the villagers from Hưng Nguyên. Their goal is to be able to provide an education for their 2 children. Mrs Phan Thị Nhàn is now requesting a new loan of 750 USD to expand her rice husking business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

"Tôi muốn có vốn mua thêm thóc lúa để hàng ngày xay xát gạo đem bán cho bà con". Sau những lần vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, gia đình chị Phan Thị Nhàn đã có được một cửa hàng nhỏ ngay tại nhà để đặt máy xay xát và dự trữ thóc gạo. Chồng chị hiện nay cũng không đi làm thuê mà phụ vợ đem gạo và những thực phẩm chăn nuôi từ những chiếc máy xay xát ra chợ cách nhà 5 km để bán cho người dân trong huyện Hưng Nguyên. Chị cho biết hai anh chị sẽ phấn đấu cho hai con trai hiện đang học cấp 1 được học hành đầy đủ. Chị đang làm hồ sơ vay mức 750 USD để tăng lượng gạo xay xát mỗi ngày.

loans.use: buy rough rice, husked and sell it

loans.name: Ceberina

texts.es:
Ceberina is a hard-working mother of five. Every day she rises early to bake the delicious bread her community enjoys for breakfast. With the family's help, it is distributed to retailers throughout the city. The business is going well, but the family pays a lot of money for rent. They would like to buy their own space for the bakery and a small shop and are working very hard to save up towards this goal. Let us help Ceberina make this dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ceberina es una diligente madre de familia, que diariamente se ocupa de brindar y satisfacer a su comunidad con sus deliciosos panes, los cuales son infaltables para un buen desayuno, dedicándose así mismo a las responsabilidades que demanda ser madre de 5 hijos.Diariamente empieza sus labores muy de madrugada junto a su familia, para la preparación de los panes, los cuales elabora de un modo muy especial, para después distribuirlos por todas las bodegas de la ciudad; el negocio marcha bien, sin embargo la carencia de un local propio hace que tengan que pagar una suma de dinero muy grande por el alquiler del local.Por esta razón desea tener un local propio donde trabajar tranquilamente y empezar a ahorrar para poder abrir más adelante una pequeña bodega con la que seguirá apoyando a sus hijos que se han convertido en su fuente de motivación. Ayudemos a que doña Ceberina haga sus sueño realidad

loans.use: To help a family of bakers open their own shop.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Phượng, 54 years old, joined TYM fund in 1998. Her initial loan of 60 usd was invested in pig breeding and retails business. The profit that she made from the pig breeding business was used to buy things that were needed for her family. After 3 years, she concentrated solely on the pig breeding. With the support from her husband who is a veterinarian, Ms Phượng has become one of the most successful TYM members. Her income is 150 usd a month. She's requesting a loan of 950 usd and she's planning on expanding her pig breeding farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Phượng, 54 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Với mức vay đầu tiên là 60USD chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ. Kết quả thu được từ chăn nuôi tích lũy giúp chị mua sắm được một số tiện nghi trong gia đình. Từ năm thứ 3 chị tập trung vốn vào phát triển đàn lợn. Với sự hỗ trợ tích cực của chồng, một bác sĩ thú y, chị Phượng là một trong những thành viên sử dụng đồng vốn có hiệu quả với mức thu nhập 150USD/tháng. Dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ xin vay 950USD để tiếp tục mở rộng dự án của mình.

loans.use: Buy pigs and mash

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
“I live in Lahore, a large city and have six daughters. My eldest daughter has finished tenth grade and now attending a sewing course. She could not continue her education because government colleges are too far and private ones are too expensive. The other girls are in school.  

I need a loan so that we can invest in my general store. I want to diversify my store and add cosmetics and cloth to the store. My store is doing well now that I have a no credit policy. Besides running the general store, I also design traditional textiles and sell to rich women in Lahore. I actually started with my business by sewing clothes. My husband’s government income was not enough to make ends meet and I literally knocked on people’s doors to give me clothes to sew. I believe that my enterprising spirit will help me go a long way.”

loans.use: Add Cosmetics and cloth to the general store

loans.name: Guillermo Noel

texts.es:
Cell phone repair is a business that requires much ability and dexterity because one must interact with very small and delicate parts which one must now how to manipulate for efficient repair. Guillermo Chavarri Garcia has worked on this business for three months in the city of Chinandega in the beautiful nation of Nicaragua.

Even though it has just started, his business has prospered greatly thanks to the support offered by Ceprodel, which has given him a total of 3 loans that he has used to invest in his locale, and also to buy two glass display cabinets where he can place the spare parts of the cell phones that he sells. His family life is very stable because he is a father with two children of school age whom he needs to support and offer their daily sustenance. His current need is investing to improve the infrastructure of his business, and in this way continue acquiring new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La reparación de celulares es un negocio que requiere de mucha habilidad y destrezas por el hecho de que se interactúa con piezas muy pequeñas y delicadas que deben saberse manipular para una eficiente reparación. A este negocio se dedica el caballero Guillermo Chavarri Garcia desde hace tres meses en la ciudad de Chinandega de la bella nación de Nicaragua.

Su negocio a pesar de que está naciendo ha venido prosperando grandemente gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel que le ha otorgado un total de 3 créditos que los ha utilizado para invertir en su cocal y además para la compra de dos vitrinas de vidrio donde coloca repuestos de celulares en venta. Su vida familiar es muy estable debido a que es padre de familia con dos hijos en la edad escolar a quienes tiene que mantener y llevar el sustento de cada día. Su necesidad actual es la inversión para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y de esta manera seguir ganando nuevos clientes.

loans.use: Expand his business (Ampliación del negocio)

loans.name: Bombay 1B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine N.. She is currently in the business of selling snacks and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Justine is 44 years old and married. Her husband is a builder. She has 4 children ranging from age 17 to 27 and one of them goes to school while the others work. Each week, Justine makes approximately UGX 14000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Justine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Justine is joined in her small group by Getrude W., Robinah S., Margret K., and Justine N.. Getrude W. has a business making candles and wants to expand her business. Robinah S. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add more stock. Margret K. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase more shop items. Justine N. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients like flour, cooking oil and frying pans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products for resale and home improvements for business.

loans.name: Konkoba Group

texts.en:
The inhabitants of Kormaslaia village are purely subsistence farmers and are mainly growing vegetables, rice, cassava, sweet potatoes and peas. To ensure food security, many community members are looking for means of increasing food production.

The Konkoba Group, with their leader, Saio K., is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875) to grow rice and peas. They also need the loan to hire labour and purchase fertilizer. Saio M. K., the leader of the group, is 45 years old and married with 4 children.

The members of the Konkoba Group want to increase their yields of rice and peas this year. They need to be able to purchase fertilizers and hire labourers to assist them in the production and harvesting of their farms.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire labourers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is an elderly woman, and she fries and sells ripe plantains and boiled beans to schoolchildren and the neighbors. She has 3 children and only 1 of them is currently in school. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy more plantains, beans, and vegetable oil to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Maranatha. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy beans, ripe plantains, vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en: Sobhi, 55, is married  and lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He owns a clothing shop and he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase inventory for his shop. This is the first time Sobhi has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his clothing shop

loans.name: Sara Joana

texts.pt:
Sara Joana G. is 26 years old and a native of Maputo. She is single without children and a college student. She has worked for the Ministry of Agriculture for 5 years in an administrative function from 7:30am until 3:30pm. She has a monthly salary of 3,100MT and is able to save some money each month.

She lives in her parents' home. Since she was little she has lived with her parents. She started school when she was 5 and is currently attending college. In 2003 she started working for the ministry as her first job.

This is the first loan through Hluvuku and she has never had any other. She came to know Hluvuku through her aunt who is already a client. Sara's big dream is to build a home and furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Sara Joana G. tem 26 anos de idade e é natural de Maputo, solteira ainda não tem filhos é estudante no ensino superior. É funcionaria do ministerio da Agricultura a 5 anos, como administrativa e tem um horário das 7:30 às 15:30h. Tem um salário mensal de 3.100,00mt e consegue poupar algum dinheiro mensalmente. Vive na casa dos pais. Desde pequena vive com os seus pais começou a estudar aos 5 anos e neste momento frequenta o ensino superior em 2003 começa a trabalhar no ministério como seu primeiro emprego. Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve noutros bancos e conheceu a Hluvuku a traves da sua tia que já era cliente. Constitui como grande sonho para Senhora Sara construir sua casa e mobilar.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Delfín

texts.es:
Delfín is 48 years old and married to Graciela de Obregón, they do not have children. He has had a general store located in a well known neighborhood of Luque for more than 10 years.

Delfín emigrated from Misiones state to her current location. He supplies his neighbors meat, rice, milk, charcoal, baked goods, and other supplies that he buys in the city’s center.

He has successfully been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for 8 years. The loan that he seeks will be used to buy meat, rice, milk, charcoal, baked goods and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Delfín tiene 48 años esta casado con la señora Graciela de Obregón, no tienen hijos. Tiene una despensa ubicada en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Luque hace mas de 10 años.

El señor Delfín emigró del departamento de Misiones. El mismo surte a sus vecinos de carne, arroz, leche, carbón, panificados y otros víveres los cuales compra del centro de la ciudad.

Opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde hace 8 años en forma excelente. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de carne, arroz, leche, carbón, panificados y otros víveres

loans.use: Buy meat, beverages, milk products, rice, vegetables.

loans.name: Liberacion Group

texts.en: Ana F. is the representative of a group named "Liberacion."  The five people in this group are hoping to receive a loan so that they can each start their own small business and better their lives. Ana is a hard working mother of two children. She is hoping to start a small business selling cookes, candies, and other small goods. Her dream is to increase her business! On behalf of Ana, the group, and Esperanza International-- Thank you for your support!!

loans.use: To set up a food vendor business

loans.name: Tojihon

texts.ru:
Касирова Тожихон, 1941 года рождения. У нее большая семья состоящая из 10 иждивенцев. Она начала свой бизнес с носовых платков и насков. Постепенно наращивая опыт увеличивала свой товарооборот. За три года в этом бизнесе она увеличила свой ассортимент. Сейчас Тожихон продает разновидность токи (национальные головные уборы), махси (национальные сапоги) и чапаны (национальное пальто). Также в продаже у нее можно найти головные уборы для религиозных людей. Свой товар она закупает у местных производителей, у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района.
Для закупа религиозных головных уборов хочет получить займ в сумме 1000 сомони.
texts.en:
Tojihon K. was born in 1941. She has a large family with 10 dependents. She started her business by selling handkerchiefs and socks. Slowly, as she gained experience, she increased her inventory. Over three years in this business she increased her assortment. Right now Tojihon sells a variety of traditional hats, boots and coats. In addition she sells head coverings for religious people. She purchases her products from local producers and from suppliers from Kokanda and sells them at the central market in the Gissar region. She would like to take out a loan for 1000 somoni ($300) to purchase religious head coverings.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase religious head coverings for sale

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Madame Emilienne L. est née le 29/04/1959 à Aného. Elle a à sa charge deux personnes. La vente du riz en détails et d’huile constitue son activité principale. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter ces produits pour couvrir la demande de ses clients qui devient de plus en plus importante. Les bénéfices qui découleront de la vente lui permettront d'améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Emilienne L. was born on April 29, 1959 in Aného and has two persons in her care. Selling rice and vegetable oil retail constitutes her main business. She is applying for this loan to buy goods to meet customer demand, which is increasing more and more. The profit derived from her sales will enable her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in rice and vegetable oil

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Agé de 39 ans,  D. CELESTIN est un producteur agricole, marié et père de 4 enfants dont 1 scolarisé.  Il réside dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME, un des 4 arrondissements enclavés que compte la commune de DANGBO et précisément dans le village AGONGUÊ. Il  travaille son champ après le retrait de la crue. Son  activité principale est la culture du maïs, du niébé, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate. En générale, la population s’adonne à la production vivrière après la  décrue et pendant  la saison pluvieuse. La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il sollicite un prêt de 190 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Celestin D., 39, is a farmer, married and the father of four children, of whom one is enrolled in school. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves that make up the township of Dangbo, more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), niébé (cowpeas), vegetables, okra, and tomatoes. In general the population works growing market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 190,000 FCFA to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Mrs. Noun Neang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people who live in Chumrov village in Takeo province formed the village bank loan. All the members plan to use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Noun N. was selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Touch, is a construction worker who earns a little income to support the family. Mrs. Noun N. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, who are all enrolled in the local school.

Mrs. Noun N. now has a lot of customers who have many needs. In order to meet these demands, Mrs. Noun N. is requesting a loan to buy more silk to weave. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: Buy more silk to weave to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mr. Thy U. is a farmer in Lvea village in Takeo province. He owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to cultivate rice during the dry season. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, fuel, and hire laborers to work on the field. His wife, Mrs. Keo Sinat, is a chicken middleman. Mr. Thy U. is 43 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel, and pay laborers to work the field

loans.name: Mirta Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Mirta está casada desde hace aproximadamente 29 años con el Sr. Saturnino Bernal, con quien tiene 5 hijos, Gustavo, Mario, Hector, Mauricio y Laura, todos ya mayores de edad.
Doña Mirta se dedica a la confección de ropas desde que tenia 17 años que aprendió la profesión con su madre, lo que siempre le sirvió para sustentar a su familia.
Los créditos que la Fundación le otorga los invierte en la compra de telas para luego confeccionar uniformes para estudiantes etc.
Los próximos créditos los quiere invertir en la compra de una maquina de coser industrial
texts.en:
Mirta has been married for about 29 years to Saturnino Bernal, who she has five children with. Her children are Gustavo, Mario, Mauricio and Laura and they are all grown. Doña Mirta has made a living as a seamstress since she was 17 years old. She learned how to do the job with her mother. The job has always allowed her to provide for her family.

With the loan through The Foundation she will be able to buy fabric so that she can then make school uniforms and other uniforms as well. With the rest of the loan she plans to buy an industrial sewing machine.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Fabric

loans.name: Maria Zulema

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ZULEMA ES BUENA CLIENTE, CUMPLIDA CON SUS PAGOS, DESPUES DE UN TIEMPO LA SRA. HA DECIDIO SACAR ESTE CREDITO DE FORMA CUIDADOSA, MIDIENDO ELLA MISMA SU CAPACIDAD. LA SEÑORA ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA DOS DE SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA MANTIENE A SU HOGAR, ESTA SEPARADA Y SOLO TIENE A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA, EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y JUNTO A SU PADRE, QUIEN LE COLABORA, MANTENIENDOSE CON EL PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO, ES UNA FAMILIA MUY UNIDA. ANTERIORMENTE ELLA SUFRIO UN ROBO DE MAQUINARIA  PERJUDICANDOLE EN GRAN MEDIDA, PERO PASADO EL TIEMPO HA LOGRADO RECUPERARSE Y SUPERARSE,  HASTA EL PUNTO DE TENER CONTRATOS E INGRESOS SEGUROS.  EL ANHELO DE ESTA FAMILIA ES DE SUPERARSE Y TENER UN PROPIA VIVENDA.
texts.en:
Zulema is a good client that has repaid her loans. After some time, she has decided to request this loan, herself carefully measuring her capacity to repay. This is her second individual loan. She supports her household; she is separated and takes care of her small, school aged daughter as well as her father, who helps her with the business. Together they are a very close family. Previously, she suffered a robbery of her machinery, which greatly harmed her, but with the passage of time has managed to recover and overcome this harm to the point of having contracts and secure income. The desire of this family is to get ahead and have their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of khaki and rainproof fabric

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita tiene 43 años de edad, reside en Laureles Sur en la ciudad de Managua, con cinco hijos de 3, 12, 20,22 y 23 años de edad,  los tres menores estudian, su esposo es electricista, su negocio es un bar. En un colegio en donde vende comida, golosinas, gaseosa, y otros productos, desde horas muy tempranas sale de su casa ya que desde muy tempranos los alumnos llegan a comprar al bar., tiene cinco años administrando este local. El crédito lo va a invertir en comprar zinc y perlines  para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que esta en mal estado y no desea mojarse en este invierno. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios de poder hacer posible las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She lives with her five children (ages 3, 12, 20, 22, and 23). Her three youngest children are still in school. Her husband is an electrician. For five years she has had a café in a local high school, where she sells food, sweets, soft drinks, and other items. She must leave the house very early in the morning since the students arrive early at the café.

She will use this loan to purchase zinc paneling and beams to replace the roof of her house, which needs to be fixed so that it doesn't leak this winter. This is her seventh loan from AFODENIC, and she is grateful for the support that has enabled her to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Madlene

texts.en: Madlene is a 34-year-old woman living in Al Mansourieh in Mount Lebanon. She has been working as a beauty adviser since 2005 and she services the surrounding areas. Today, Madlene is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a laser machine in order to increase her income.

loans.use: buy a laser machine

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a rice grower. She is 56 years old, a widow, and has six children. She works so hard on her farm. She thinks that she needs to be strong especially since she no longer has a husband to support her needs. She is also a food vendor. She cooks and sells food in the street when she is not busy on her farm.Margarita also raise pigs at the back of her house to supplement her income.

Margarita is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase thirteen sacks of feed. She will also use the loan for fertilizers. The loan will help her get a better harvest and get started in her pig business. In that way, she believes, she could easily support her children who are now starting a new family.


CEVI provides livelihood. It helps people start and have their own business. CEVI gives not just loans to their clients, it also offer training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 13 sacks of feed and a few sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has one daughter and two sons attending primary and senior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the very busy commercial town of Goaso, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Mariama is a food vendor. She has been in business for over 20 years. She runs a chop bar in her community, where she prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. She buys food items such as cassava, plantain, rice, and other ingredients from the local market. She is requesting a loan so she can procure ingredients in bulk. 

Mariama hopes to be able to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through high levels of education.

loans.use: Buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 49 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, está casada con el padre de sus 7 hijos y viven en su casa propia. Cuando era joven no le gustaba el cultivo de la tierra, pero desde que se enamoró y se casó con un agricultor su trabajo se tornó netamente al labrado de esta, sembrando plátanos, piñas y mayormente café. Cuando aun sus hijos eran muy pequeños, junto a su esposo doblegaban esfuerzos, pero ahora que ya han crecido, los ayudan realizando una faena y de ese modo aminoran sus días en la chacra. Entonces se organizan para la comercialización del café en los diversos mercados en busca de un buen precio, esta dinámica les permite captar mayores ingresos para su hogar, puesto que mientras que ellos están vendiendo sus productos, sus hijos están trabajando en sus tierras. Con las ganancias acumuladas pueden cubrir los gastos de educación; tanto del colegio de los menores, como el instituto técnico de los mayores que están en otras ciudades fuera de su pueblo. Debido a estos logros que le brinda la agricultura Angélica aprendió a amar y cuidar con mucho cariño a cada una de sus plantas. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los 4 periodos anteriores trabajó con mucha responsabilidad, asimismo en sus reuniones de grupo le tienen mucho respeto y consideración, debido a su puntualidad y porque es una mujer muy sensible ante los problemas de sus compañeros de banco comunal. El dinero solicitado planea utilizarlo en la compra de 18 sacos de nitrato (abono), en busca de mejores resultados en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Angélica is 49 years old and a hard-working mother. She's married and she and her husband have seven children. They own their home. When Angélica was young she didn't care for farming, but later on she began to love it and she married a farmer. Her work soon turned to planting plantains, pineapples, and primarily coffee. When her children were very small, she and her husband redoubled their efforts. But now that they've grown, the children help Angélica and her husband with the work and subsequently reduce the number of days spent in the fields. The family organized coffee sales in various markets in search of a good price. This dynamic allows them to increase the earnings for their household, because while Angélica and her husband are selling, their children are working the land. With their earnings they can cover the cost of the children's education, including high school for the younger children and technical university tuition for the older children who live in other cities. Given these achievements in the agriculture sector, Angélica learned to love it and care for her crops. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and during her last four loan cycles she worked very responsibly. Angélica attended group meetings respectfully and punctually, because she's a sensible woman who addresses the problems of her colleagues in the community bank. This loan will be used to buy 18 sacs of nitrate fertilizer, to achieve the best possible coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: A. is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells medicine and provisions; she has been in this business for 10 years. A. is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions to sell

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en: Rosabella R. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 59 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Rosabella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2000, Rosabella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Rosabella is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar M. has a successful business selling home products in his own shop at a market. He started his business about five years ago, after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy. He is an internally displaced person who suffered from the Armenian-Azerbaijan war. In 1992, he lost his house and started a new life with a lot of difficulties in the city where he lives now. Anvar purchases his products at very low prices and is then able to resell them for a profit. Because he sells in bulk amounts, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Anvar rents a very good location at the market for his business and he has a small amount of competition.

He has requested a loan of 2000 USD to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more products to sell, enabling him to increase his profit and continue operating a profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 38 years old.  He is the loving husband of Elvie and a good father to their two children: Simeon - 9 years old, a grade school student and Arvie - 4 years old, already studying in a pre-school in their village in Cutog Grande Reina Mercedes, Isabela. His wife is patiently sacrificing working abroad for many years as a domestic helper. To help his wife in supporting their family, Arnel engaged in a small business. 

Arnel is working as tricycle driver for almost 11 years.  He drives his own motorcycle and earning  a weekly income of PHP2, 000.  He wanted to maintain her business and with this he is asking to avail a loan of PHP7, 000 from the Kiva lenders.  This amount will be of great help for the maintenance of his tricycle.  He believes that being patient and with hard work, they can have a better way of living.  He is also hoping that they could overcome the hardship of life and give his children with good education.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ruth Roxana

texts.es:
La Sra. Ruth Roxana A. Q. tiene 27 años, esta casada con el Sr. Grover Mita Alba 5 años, tienen dos hijos que estan en la escuela. Viven en su casa propia en la zona de la Maica Norte a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la zona se caracteriza por ser lechera y agricola.

La Sra. Ruth se dedica a la lecheria desde hace 13 años, empezó a trabajar desde muy pequeña con su madre que le enseño todo lo relacionado con el cuidado del ganado lechero. Ahora tiene su propio ganado lechero. Entregan toda su produccion a una empresa local que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos.

Requiere de dinero para la compra de Cascara de soya para almacenar en la epoca de sequia. Esto ayudará a que su ganado no este sin alimento durante esta epoca del año y su produccion no se vea afectada. Esto tendra un impacto positivo ya que sus ingresos podrian incrementar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth Roxana A. Q. is 27 years old and has been married to Grover Mita Alba for 5 years. They have 2 children who currently attend school. They live in their own home in the zone Maica Norte, 10 minutes from the city of Cochabamba. This area is known for its dairy and agriculture business. Ruth has been working in the dairy business for 13 years. She began when she was very young, working with her mother who taught her everything about caring for dairy cows. Today she has her own dairy cow, and she sells all the milk to a local company that makes all kinds of dairy products. She needs the loan to purchase feed to store during the dry season. This ensures that her dairy cow does not have to go without food during the drought, and her production won't be affected. This protects her income and let's her grow her business, so that she can continue to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her dairy cow.   She will need to store the feed during the drought to protect her small business.

loans.name: María Nela

texts.es:
La señora María Nela M. se ha destacado por dedicarse a su actividad de venta de agroquímicos en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega donde a diario ofrece sus productos a sus clientes que le visitan.

El motivo por el cuál ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel es para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los agroquímicos con la finalidad de ofrecerlos en su establecimiento y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora María Nela M. has distinguished herself in the sale of agricultural chemicals. She sells in the central market of the Chinandega region, where she offers her products daily to the visiting customers. The reason that she is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL is to purchase agricultural chemicals that she can sell from her establishment, and this way meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase agricultural chemicals

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phaste at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies of groundnut to  make phaste to sell.  

Keji is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a grinding mill and locate it at the market for easy access to customers. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of groundnut to make phaste to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 63 years old and married with 11 children. Her eldest child is now 44 years old and married. Erlinda sells dried fish for a living. She works hard to provide for the increasing needs in her family. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. This loan will be used to fund her business.

loans.use: To fund her business

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie S. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old and single. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food and daily use products in the community. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jessie joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her store

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.en: The ‘New Horizon’ Women’s Committee was formed by a group of women, all of who live in the same neighborhood. They all worked in “clorinderas” – transporting goods across the border into Paraguay. They saw a need for a greater quantity and diversity of goods, and an opportunity to make profit. All women already have their own established businesses, except for two who are starting new enterprises.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Lux

texts.en: Lux S., 29, is married with a two-year-old child. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and child. To make a living, she is employed at a private company. She provides the laundry services at that company, earning an income of US $2 per day in revenue. Her husband works at a construction site. He paints the buildings both inside and outside, earning an income of US $5 per day. These sources of income from S. and her husband help to cover the family expenses. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase pigs to raise and wood to build a pig cage. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Virgen Del Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Comité Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro, así se denomina el grupo conformado en fecha 18 de noviembre del 2.009, integrado por 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando con el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendoras, en el 1º ciclo. 



Este grupo se formó gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Marcia G. logró juntas a todas sus vecinas y amigas.
