El crédito va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de mercerías, venta de comestibles, venta de cosméticos, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de carne, venta de bebidas, venta de remedios ,venta de frutas, cría de pollitos, cría de cabras, peluquería, confección de prendas de vestir, compra de elementos para masajes, etc. 



Todas ellas están muy contentas trabajando en forma muy conjunta y solidaria con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro Communal Bank was formed on the 18th of November, 2009. It is comprised of 15 women who are working with the Women Entrepreneurs Committee, and they are in their first cycle. This group was formed thanks to the current Director of Finances, Marcia G.. She was able to get all of her neighbors and friends together. The loan is for their different activities like selling notions, selling food, selling cosmetics, buying merchandise for the grocery store (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, pastries, and dried leaves for tea, etc.), selling meat, selling drinks, selling remedies, selling fruit, raising chickens, raising goats, hair styling, making clothing, and buying massage supplies, etc. All of them are very happy working this way in such a united and supportive manner with the Paraguaya Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, raw materials, and animals for their businesses

loans.name: Ffena Tugagawale Group, Mukono

texts.en:
J. Muhammed is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 42 years old and married with three children between the ages of 18 and 12, and he also takes care of two orphans. 

Muhammed has operated a business of selling old shoes and clothes from Kame Valley market for 16 years, from which he is able to make about $25 in weekly profits. His biggest challenge is the limited capital at his disposal. 

Muhammed has a dream of building his own house so that he can stop renting. He also wants to educate all his children to the University level with the hope that they will find better job opportunities. He needs a loan to be able to buy more shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.use: Buying more stock of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana Milena A. Jiménez, es una joven negociante que vive en Barranquilla con su cónyuge que es conductor  y sus dos hijas de 4 y 7 años.
Desde hace mas de tres años se dedica al comercio    y en la actualidad vende  especialmente vestidos y calzados deportivos para damas, caballeros y niños; comenzó su negocio con la venta de  cosméticos y colonias mediante  catálogos empresariales, pero añoraba tener su capital de trabajo propio y mediante los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha podido crearlo. Siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y ayudar en los gastos del hogar, sus principales clientes son empleados que están ubicadas en el sector de las Nieves, barrio donde ella vive, que se encuentra circundado por grandes empresas; su primer mercado domestico con el cual comenzó su negocio fue su familia y como es muy amigable consigue clientes muy rápidamente. En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito por valor de $1.300.000 precisamente para responder a pedidos de calzado deportivo, vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños que le han hecho sus clientes.
Su sueño grande es tener un almacén y una vivienda propia, tiene actualmente un e desafío muy importante y es el compartir su actividad como negociante con el cuidado y dedicación de sus hijos y las actividades domésticas propias de una mamá responsable..
texts.en:
Ana Milena A. Jiménez, is a young businesswoman living in Barranquilla with her spouse, who is a driver, and their two daughters ages 4 and 7. She has been in business for more than 3 years, and currently sells mainly sports clothing and footwear for women, men and children. She started her business selling cosmetics and colognes from catalogs, but she missed having her own working capital, and through loans from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation she was able to accumulate it. She has always enjoyed being independent and contributing to the household expenses. Her main clients are around the Las Nieves area, the neighborhood where she lives, workers she meets going to the large businesses. Her first domestic market, where she got her start, was her family, and since she is very friendly, she rapidly obtained additional clients. Currently she is requesting a loan of $675 in order to fill orders already made by her clients for sports footwear and outfits for women, men and children. Her biggest dream is to have a shop and her own home. Her challenge now is to juggle her business along with the childcare and the household work of any responsible mother.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock to fill orders

loans.name: Marotyon

texts.en:
Marotyon is a 46-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has been working as a jewelry designer since 1993. He produces necklaces, earrings, bracelets, pins and other type of jewelry. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties since he learned his trade from his father. When he was young, he used to help his father during his free time; he loves his work and produces beautiful jewelry.
Marotyon is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase gold for his work. He has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work. In the future, he plans to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase gold for his work

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Celina C.  ex integrante del comité San Ignacio   domiciliada en el km 9 Acaray de  Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona .

El comité se Denomina “Santa Lucia ”  están  en el Primer Ciclo   con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes.

La Señora Celina C., teniendo en cuenta la creciente demanda de ropa, más bien uniformes para escuelas y colegios desidio invertir en la compra de materiales para la cofección de los mismos, ya que ella posee un taller donde tambien además de ella trabajan otras costureras y confeccionan prendas de vestir. Actuamente,  se ve con la necesidad de adquirir más máquinas para la costura y terminación de las prendas, así como materia prima como son las telas y accesorios para la confección de prendas de vestir de buena calidad, por ello la solicitud del prétamos.
texts.en:
Celina C., a former member of the San Ignacio committee, initiated the formation of the current committee. She lives at kilometer 9 in Acaray, Ciudad del Este. She met with her neighbors and friends to form a committee in her area. The committee is called “Santa Lucia, ” and they are in their first loan cycle, with 18 members. It is a group which stands out in the neighborhood for its unity, solidarity and responsibility. The members pursue diverse activities. Celina's work is making clothing. She has observed a growing demand for clothing, especially primary and secondary school uniforms, so she decided to invest her loan in materials for making uniforms. She finds that she also needs additional machines for creating and finishing clothing, as well as raw materials such as fabrics and accessories for the preparation of high-quality clothing. This is why she requested this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sewing machines and materials

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim K. is married and has three children, all attending school. He accessed funds from a friend and established a business selling men's wear. As his business continued to progress, he thought it fit to change from the sale of used clothing to the sale of school bags and travel bags.

He was a member of our group-lending program and has a good credit history. Ibrahim is now seeking a loan to buy more stock and generate more income that he will use to cater to his family and to save to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy used school and travel bags

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Cruz D., es casada y con tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón ninguno esta bajo su responsabilidad, ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 12 años tiene una pulpería y la vez compra cerdo para destace lo cual lo hace 2 veces por semana y tiene la ayuda de su esposo en el negocio del cerdo.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de veintiocho créditos, los cuales le han servido para invertir más en su negocio, vale mencionar que ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Doña Cruz D., es casada y con tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón ninguno esta bajo su responsabilidad, ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 12 años tiene una pulpería y la vez compra cerdo para destace lo cual lo hace 2 veces por semana y tiene la ayuda de su esposo en el negocio del cerdo. Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de veintiocho créditos, los cuales le han servido para invertir más en su negocio, vale mencionar que ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra Arroz, Azúcar, Aceite, Jabón, Gaseosas, etc

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mrs. Ra T. is 37 years old and she lives in Rung B village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sophal Resch, are farmers who own three hectares of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Ra T. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide, and to hire a farm laborer. The couple has four children; one is laborer in Thai country while the other three are students in the local school. (Her husband is in the picture with her.)

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide and to hire a farm laborer

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget P., 58, is a widower who lives with two of his children in the Battambang province. He stays at home and raises pigs for US$1 profit each day. He is also supported by two of his children who are local teachers. Nget P. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To raise more pigs.

loans.name: Poderosas De Lircay Group

texts.es:
El BancoComunal Poderosas D. Lircay, se encuentra ubicado en L. Comunidad del mismo nombre del departamento D. Huancavelica.
Elsa, es socia y Tesorera del Bancomunal, tiene 02 hijos pequeños los cuales van a L. escueL.. Elsa se dedica a L. venta D. carnes, negocio que heredó D. su familia, ya que ayudaba desD. pequeña a sus padres en L. tienda que ahora elL. administra. Elsa con su ingreso a Finca  ha aprendido a ser puntual y responsable, lo cual junto con sus préstamos le ayuda mucho en su negocio. 
Elsa, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual realizará mejoras en su tienda y así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Elsa por ahora invierte sus ahorros apoyando a su esposo, quien se encuentra por terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
The Poderosas D. Licay community bank is located in the community of the same name, in the Huancavelica department. Elsa is treasurer of the community bank. She has 2 little children who go to school. Elsa sells meat, a business that she inherited from her family, as she helped her parents from a very young age in the stO. that she now runs. When Elsa joined Finca she learned to be punctual and responsible, and this and her loans have helped her a lot in her business. Elsa needs a loan with which she will make improvements to her stO. and thus offer a better service to her customers. For now she devotes her savings to helping her husband, who is about to finish his university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mejoras en su tienda

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is very interested in her business and has spent 15 years as a full-time business woman. Her business is located at # 2 Wilson Street, Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. Mabinty is married and has 3 children.


She was initially financed by her husband. She started a business trading firewood, palm oil and gara clothing which she has now been running for 15 years. She goes to work at 7:00a.m. and returns home at 6:45p.m. Her challenge is how to expand her business so that she can cover the high cost of transportation and price changes of the goods she trades in; and also support her family. She needs a loan to expand her business. She intends to use the proceeds from her business to educate her children to university level and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy gara cloth (locally dyed cloth) for sale

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan D. is from the village of Poblacion, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years old. Jonathan is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Jonathan works in someone else's business providing motor transport services. Jonathan has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jonathan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing engine. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonathan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing engine

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandra vive en el barrio Urkupiña, de la zona del plan  3000, ella se dedica a la fabricación  y venta de edredones  que entrega al por mayor y al crédito, también vende otros productos al crédito como ser bañadores, lavadores y cestos de ropa, la Sra. Alejandra necesita el crédito para comprar una maquina industrial de costura para poder hacer la entrega de sus pedidos en un menor tiempo, la señora tiene la ayuda de su hija y en caso de que el trabajo sea mayor es colaborada por una de sus familiares. Ella es una persona trabajadora, responsable que se esfuerza para salir adelante con sus hijas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra lives in the Urkupiña neighborhood of the Plan 3000 suburb. She manufactures and sells bedspreads in bulk and on credit. Alejandra also sells other products on credit such as swimsuits, wash basins, and clothes hampers.

She needs a loan so that she can buy an industrial sewing machine to help her complete her orders in less time. Alejandra works with her daughter and whenever they receive large orders, they seek assistance from their relatives. She is a hardworking and responsible person who strives to get ahead alongside her daughters. Alejandra is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for providing this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial sewing machine & fabric

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa L. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Nimfa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop to sell both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La persona que sale en la fotografía el esposo.

Carolina G. González inicio una construcción hace tiempo que realizo con ahorros propios pero no le alcanzo para terminarla. La señora desea terminar para poder extender su casa y asó tener mas espacio en su vivienda para realizar su proyecto ella necesita comprar material  pagar mano de obra. Su esposo es el que mantiene los gastos el trabaja como chofer de taxi.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is the husband. Carolina G. González started building onto her house a short time ago using her own savings but ran out of money before she could finish. She’d like to finish the project thus being able to enlarge her home and have more space. To complete the project she needs to buy materials and pay labor costs. Her husband, who works as a taxi driver, is covers household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide D. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Rosario, Poblacion II, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fruit vending.  Her husband, Wennie D., who is 55 years old, earns an income as a security guard.  They have three children who are 16 to 30 years old, with two of their children having their own families and only one living at home to help Heide in her business activity. 

Heide joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Heide has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP, which she added to her own capital, helped her earn a monthly profit of $1184, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP again to supplement her own capital so that she can buy more fruits to sell. Heide is working hard so that she can sustain her family's daily needs and be able to save up for the education of her youngest child, and to set aside some money for the future security of her family. Heide D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase fruits in season to sell

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Santos Antonio P. S., es un hombre de 42 años, habitante del barrio Los Ríos, es casado y tiene 3 hijos adolecentes que estudian la escuela primaria, el es agricultor contando con una experiencia  de más de 20 años su esposa comercializa las cosechas de forma tal que tienen organizado las cargas del negocio para un mejor orden y productividad, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, fungicidas, abonos, que permitan un mejor mantenimiento a las cosechas un aumento en la producción e incremento en las ventas que favorezcan a corto plazo a las comodidades de su hogar, en la remodelación de la infraestructura de su finca y utilizarla como retiro para su esposa y él, así como hereda para sus hijos. Este no es el primer prestamo del señor P., a travez de todos estos años que se le ha brindado este apoyo hemos obsevado una mejora en los niveles de vida en los que ellos años atras habitaban.
texts.en:
Santos Antonio P. S. is a 42-year-old man who lives in the Los Ríos neighborhood. He is married and has three children who are adolescents and are in primary school. He is a farmer and has more than 20 years of experience. His wife sells the crops and they have the responsibilities of the business organized in a way that provides for better organization and productivity.

He is requesting a loan for his business to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers, fungicides, and manure which will allow him to provide better maintenance to his crops. This will mean an increase in production and sales which are good for his home in the short term, as it will allow him to remodel the infrastructure of his farm and use it for his and his wife’s retirement, as well as inheritance for her children. This is not Mr. P.’s first loan – throughout the years that he has been provided with funding, we have observed an improvement from the qualities of life that they had before.

loans.use: Phytosanitary maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B. is from the village of Bungad. She is 45 years old. Teresa is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2010, Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Teresa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nuevo Amanecer es un excelente  comité conformado el 06 de Julio de 2.010, integrado por 18 mujeres de la Ciudad de Ita.
 Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. 
La mayoría de las integrantes del grupo siguen activas desde el primer préstamo y con eso demuestran solidaridad y compañerismo. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Pablina y se dedica a la venta de pan y miel. 
Esta actividad los realiza dos o tres veces a la semana dependiendo de los pedidos que reciben de sus clientes. 
La miel que ella vende los compra de varias zonas del país, y el pan es totalmente casero, ella misma los prepara en un horno que tiene en su casa. 
Sus clientes están muy satisfechos con sus productos y solicitan el préstamo para la compra de harina, queso, grasa para pan y otros ingredientes.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) Communal Bank is an excellent group that was formed on July 6th, 2010.  The group is comprised of 18 women from the city of Ita.

It is a very active group, and all of the members demonstrate companionship and solidarity.  They attend the weekly meetings, and they carry out activities to raise money for the common good of the group.  The majority of the group members are continuing in the same businesses they have had since the first loan.  That way they are demonstrating solidarity and companionship.

Pablina is one of the members.  She sells bread and honey.  She does this two or three times a week, depending on the orders she gets from her customers.  She buys the honey that she sells in various areas of the country.  The bread is completely home-made.  She makes it herself in an oven that she has in her house.  Her customers are very satisfied with her products.  She is requesting the loan to buy flour, cheese, fat for bread, and other ingredients.

loans.use: To buy flour, fat, and honey

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina B. is from the village of Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Mina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Mina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Mina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees  for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 25 years old and single. He sells clothing, shoes, bags, etc. His store is open from 7am until 6pm every day. He runs this business in Gasaka district in Rwanda.  

Since Simon has only five years' experience in business, so his profit is still too low to expand meaningfully, but he believes that a small amount of additional capital would positively change his life. For that reason, Simon has requested his first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to purchase a variety of shoes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes for resale

loans.name: Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Beathe is 29 years old and married to a petrol station attendant. She has one child who is three years old. Beathe is the group leader of the borrowing group called "Abanyamurava", which means "people with commitment" in English.  The group members work in different businesses but have come together to request a loan to help the growth of their businesses. All these borrowers are committed to their work and ability to repay. 

Beathe, the group leader, owns a shop selling both men and women's clothing and she has had this business for one year.  She hopes to add more classic styles of clothing with the loan and she is determined to put aside savings out of the profits. Beathe is wearing a blue dress with necklaces and is standing behind the first row.  She would like to be a distributor of garments after one year.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es: Clemente M. G., es una persona muy humilde de 51 años de edad, quien reside en Colón, en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa, y un hijo de 13 años de edad. Clemente, se dedica a la venta ambulante de ajos, los cuales comercializa en diferentes tiendas y negocio, día tras día, Clemente sigue una ruta diferente, de manera que pueda surtir a todos sus clientes. Este negocio es bastante estable debido a que desde hace 13 años que se dedica a el, por lo que es muy conocido en su rubro. Clemente solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de ajos y de esta forma contar con la capacidad de vender mayor cantidad de productos lo cual sea de mucho beneficio para la economía de su hogar y su familia.
texts.en: Clemente Melendez G. is a humble man.  He is 51 years old and lives in Colon, together with his wife and their 13 year old daughter in the department of La Libertad.  Clemente earns a living by selling garlic to various shops and businesses.  He works every day and follows different routes, trying to serve as many customers as he can.   This business is pretty stable, as he's been doing this work now for 13 years and is well known.  Clemente is requesting a loan to purchase greater quantities of garlic, enabling him to increase sales.    The additional income will be a great benefit to his family.

loans.use: To purchase more garlic for resale

loans.name: Martin Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Martin tiene como actividad la confección de diferentes tipos de ropa según época, el realiza  el armado y la confección de las mismas para después comercializarla a terceros, el sr. Martin es una persona emprendedora, dinámica, joven y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida, esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial recta y una maquina over loock para renovar su maquinaria con la que trabaja y así mejorar e incrementar su producción, esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita crédito bajo este financiamiento ya que la primera vez le fue muy bien por lo cual agradece por esta oportunidad que le dieron.
texts.en: Mr. Martin's business is sewing different types of clothing, depending on the season. He puts the items together and sews them in order to later sell them to third parties. Mr. Martin is an enterprising, dynamic and young person with a great desire to succeed in life. He is now requesting a loan for the purchase of a straight industrial sewing machine and an Overlock machine in order to update his machines for his work. This will improve and increase his production. This is the second time that he has requested a loan with this organization, as the first time went very well. Thus, he is grateful for this opportunity that they are giving him.

loans.use: the purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A., 52 years old, is married to a farmer. She has 10 children: 3 girls and 7 boys. Helen raises hogs and ducks. Helen sells the pigs and duck eggs at the market. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. Helen says that, with a big family like hers, providing their household needs is a challenge. But Helen is happy that she and her husband always support each other to sustain their family.

Helen is in need of additional piglets, ducks and feed. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, ducks and feed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. tortas y galletas, ella prepara tortas y bocaditos para diferentes eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños entre otros compromisos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. tortas y bocaditos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como mantequilla, azúcar y harina.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Victoria, a member of “HATUN RUMIYOC”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Victoria is 57 years old, she is married and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity, the sale of cakes and cookies. She prepares cakes and snacks for different events such as weddings and birthdays among other celebrations. She wishes to enlarge and improve her activity of cakes and snacks sale. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as butter, sugar and flour.

Victoria is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To buy butter, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette, 62 years old, has four children between the ages of 19 and 21, two of whom attend school, while the other two completed their primary school and then stopped their studies due to insufficient funds to pay for school fees.

Bernadette sells sorghum and is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum. With the additional profits she plans to buy a domestic animal to rear.

loans.use: To buy additional sorghum to sell

loans.name: Jesutin Group

texts.en:
The Jesutin group consists of fifteen women who live in the same district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's economic center. They normally meet once a week to offer support in business and for loan repayments. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Ablawa is nearly thirty years old, and lives with her husband Julien and their three children who are all schooled. For the past ten years she has sold products as a traveling saleswoman, particularly within the Pahou market. She currently sells plastic items such as washing bowls and buckets, as well as soap. 

With her loan she hopes to purchase three dozen plastic buckets and six crates of soap from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her ambition is to have her own stall at the market, and grow her business from there.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls and buckets, as well as soap, for resale

loans.name: Yolanda Elizabeth

texts.es: Yolanda Elizabeth L. D. A. D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive en casa propia en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee como fuente D. trabajo una tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su vivienda. Yolanda siempre ha estado a disposición D. los clientes les da la mejor atención, para ella la felicidad del cliente es su lema, al tener los mejores productos con buen precio la gente prefiere comprar en su negocio y eso le ha creado más demanda es por esta razón que Yolanda se decidió a solicitar el crédito a INTEGRAL para abastecer su tienda con mas productos como cereales, medicinas, golosinas, bebidas, gas propano, entre otros. Es así como ella quiere salir adelante satisfacer sus necesidades y llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en: Yolanda Elizabeth L. D. A. is 43 years old.  She lives in her own home in San Salvador department.  Yolanda has a store in her home where she has always been ready to help her customers with anything they need.  She offers them the best customer service because making her customers happy is her motto.  Yolanda offers the best products at the best prices so people like to shop with her.  This has created a lot of demand.  For this reason, Yolanda is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can stock her store with more products such as cereals, medicines, candies, drinks, propane gas, etc.  This is how she would like to get ahead in life, cover her needs and bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy cereal, medicines, candies, drinks and propane gas

loans.name: Gricerio

texts.es:
Gricerio tiene 48 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La actividad que desarrolla  es el servicio de chofer en una empresa de transportes que se encuentra en  el distrito donde reside. Con esta actividad ha salido adelante junto a su familia.

Gricerio anhela aperturar un lugar donde pueda brindar servicio de lavado de motos en su domicilio, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.

Gricerio es responsable y muy trabajador, en la asociación trabaja se brindan apoyo cuando lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Gricerio is 48 years old.  He lives with his partner and family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity, which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Gricerio works as a driver for a transport company in his district.  Through this work, he gets his family ahead in life.

Gricerio would like to open a place where he can provide a motorbike washing service on his property.  In this way, he will increase his income and be able to achieve a better quality of life.

Gricerio is responsible and very hard working.  In the association in which he works, they provide support for each other when they need it.

loans.use: to open a motorbike washing service

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa A., age 38, established his transportation business in 2001. It is his only source of livelihood. Working seven days a week and often 18 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He is married and has no children.

He needs a loan in the amount of Le 3,600,000 in order to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Musa plans to complete the construction of his house and to continue to take good care of his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra, 51 years old, is a mother for nine children, 6 girls and 3 boys. She is married to Mousa, 52 years old, who has two jobs, one as a heating technician and the other as owner of a grocery store.

Yusra felt the need to help her husband in raising their nine children, so she started her embroidery business ten years ago. Yusra is specialized in embroidering traditional dresses and has been successfully running her business since then.

Now Yusra is applying for a loan to buy more fabrics and other raw materials so she can continue making these beautiful traditional dresses.

loans.use: To buy more  fabrics.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Inti, tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos: 2 profesionales y 2 que están estudiando. Julia tiene una panadería. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. harina y demás ingredientes para la preparación D. panes. Está 2 años en FINCA Perú, ingresó por la invitación D. su hermana. Le gusta por la facilidad D. los préstamos se trabaja a base D. confianza y se pueD. ahorrar. Con sus ahorros y préstamos pudo comprarse algunas máquinas D. panadería. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus 2 hijos que están estudiando terminen su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank Musuq Inti. She is 49 years of age, married, and has four children: two professionals and two in school. Julia has a bakery. The loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of flour and other ingredients for the making of breads and pastries. 

She has been a client of FINCA Perú for two years, and joined at the invitation of her sister. She likes it because of the ease of acquiring a loan, because the work is based on trust, and it allows one to save. With her savings and loans she was able to purchase some bakery machinery. 

Her dream is that her business continue to grow, and that her two children who are in school would finish their professional educations.

loans.use: to purchase flour and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 32-year-old married man who has a 2-year-old child.  For four years, he has been working as an insurance agent.  Being a businessman, he decided to join a group in Faulu Kenya so that he can get easy access to business loans.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on financial management and he is currently saving his money on a weekly basis with his group members.  

Peter needs 30,000 Kes to buy a computer for his office.

loans.use: buy a computer for his office

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 43 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Amalia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Amalia aspires to build and expand business to secure a future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear and costume jewelry

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es: Cayo, natural de la ciudad de Palmapampa, tiene 23 años, es un joven trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su querida hija de 03 años de edad a quien desea brindarle una buena educación. Cayo a su corta edad es un joven con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir, se separó de su esposa por lo que tuvo hacerse cargo de su hija de 03 años. Al principio no supo administrar el tiempo, para dedicarle a su hija pero poco a poco se adapto. Hoy se esmera por entregarle todo lo que esta a su alcance y vive muy feliz al lado de su hija. Cayo sabe como administrar su dinero; a su edad ya cuenta con 02 ingresos, con el apoyo de los créditos recibidos montó su propia bodega, donde es muy concurrida por parte de sus consumidores, a la vez  se dedica a la actividad agrícola donde cultiva cacao. Este trabajo lo realizan los jornaleros, quienes se encargan de la cosecha y deshierbo de maleza. Con el dinero solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras  para que sean productivas. Este será  su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que contara una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir progresando. Además agradece a su banco comunal por el buen desempeño que tuvieron en la primera reunión grupal. Con el monto solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas.
texts.en:
Cayo, native of the city of Palmapampa, is 23 years old and lives in his own home along with his beloved three-year-old daughter to whom he hopes to provide a good education. Cayo, at his tender age, is a young man with many responsibilities to fulfill. He was separated from his wife and so had to take charge of his three-year-old daughter. At first he did not know how to organize his time, in order to care for his daughter, but little by little he adapted. Today he works hard to give her everything within his capacity, and lives very happily alongside his daughter. 

Cayo knows how to handle his money. At his age he already has two sources of income. With the support of the loans received he set up his own grocery store which is much frequented by his customers. At the same time he works in farming, growing cocoa plants. This work is done by day laborers, who handle the harvesting and weeding. 

With the requested money he will buy bags of compost for fertilizing his land so that it may be productive. This will be his second loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that once again he will have your support so he may continue making progress. In addition he is grateful to his communal bank for the good efforts they made in the first group meeting. With the requested sum he will purchase bags of compost to fertilize his lands and make them highly productive.

loans.use: to purchase bags of compost.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en:
Yah is 39 years old and lives in West Point. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 16. Both of her children are attending school.

Yah has been known to most of her community's members as a very powerful business woman who sells dried goods such as rice, oil, charcoal, soap and many other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. She hopes to send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, a 46-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and four children. Her husband is a bricklayer. Huong earns an income to support her family by operating a general store in front of her house. The products that Huong sells include detergent, shampoo, toothpaste, and snack foods. She has been running her store since 1998.

She requires a loan to purchase a greater variety of basic goods and common household products, such as beverages and snack foods, to stock her store and offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that will permit her to earn more income and save money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase basic products, such as beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last ten years. She is 31 years old, married to Paul and they have four school-going children. Margaret was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Margaret hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rab'aa

texts.en: Rab'aa is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and has five sons and three daughters. Some of her sons are employed. Her husband is a driving instructor and gets a decent income. Rab'aa has a car for training new drivers and wants to make repairs to it, but she hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Rab'aa gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for all the repairs the car needs. This will make the car work more efficiently and her husband will take on more new drivers to train. That will lead to improving the family income positively and let the family live in better conditions. Rab'aa is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed in the car he uses for training new drivers.

loans.use: To pay for repairing the car that is used for training new drivers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more salt, cassava flour, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, Mwanajuma has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her place of operation, and she dreams of establishing a shop to sell her products in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, with the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans and maize flour for her food stall.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans and maize flour for her food stall.

loans.name: G.s. Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es: Maura Elena y Perfecta conforman el grupo solidario Milagro De Jesús. Ellas son personas muy emprendedoras y disfrutan de este medio de vida. Perfecta se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio los esfuerzos constantes que realiza para obtener ingresos para su hogar. Ella se levanta todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, cremas, carnes, fósforos, sopas, enlatados, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Maura Elena and Perfecta make up the 'Milagro de Jesús' community bank.  They are very entrepreneurial people and they enjoy their work.  Perfecta runs a grocery store.  She has had this business for more than 13 years.  She constantly works hard to make income for her household.  She gets up every day at 7 o'clock in the morning and works until 9 o'clock at night.  She is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, cream, meat, matches, soups, canned goods and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cream, meat, matches, soups, canned goods and other products

loans.name: Maria Lucy

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maria, es conviviente; la socia tiene 38 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de pananderia,ella prepara diferentes tipos de pan y luego lo vende en el distrito de Oropesa,la socia trabja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de panaderia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mantequilla,aceite y harina paraa preparar pan.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: María has a spouse; she’s 38 years old and has three children.  She’s still a baker; she makes a variety of types of bread to then sell in Oropesa District.  She works from 8am until 7pm and is able to support her children with this business.  She wants to expand the bakery and is asking for a loan to buy butter, oil and flour to bake bread.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy butter, oil and flour to bake bread.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married and has three children. Nelson is 52 years old and lives in Libertad, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Nelson's first loan helped him to repair his tricycle, which he uses to provides transport services to his community. The revenue generated is of high quality and he has proficiently paid back his loan. He is very thankful to GDMPC and the people who support GDMPC to help people like him.

Currently, Nelson is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase new wheels for his tricycle so that he can provide better service to the people in his community.

In the future, Nelson plans to use the income generated from his business to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle so that he can provide better service.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, aged twelve and one. Divina has had a sari-sari (convenience store) store business for five years. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, eggs, and canned goods to the people in her community. Divina earns 8,000 PHP per month with her business.

Divina has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, and rice. She hopes this loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, and rice

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, is a happily married mother of three. Her children are 23, 20 and 17 years old.  Her children are well educated which makes Salma and her husband proud. 
Her husband is a salesman by profession and his income relies on his sales.  He buys household supplies and food items at wholesale and sells to different grocery stores and general stores.  
He has been involved in this business for the past seven years.  
To improve his finances and his clientage, Salma is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah.  Her husband intends to use this loan to purchase more household supplies and food items for resale. 
She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to his business and her family will use the increased income for their well-being.

loans.use: To buy household supplies & food items for resale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está en casado y vive con su hija y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende compra los insumos para asistir su cafetal como los abonos y pago de mano de obra. El cuenta con un terreno ya establecida con la plantación de café y necesita una muy buena asistencia este año por lo cual opto por el crédito. El quiere darle a su cafetal una buena mejora pues esta cosecha pasado se deterioro mucho su plantación. El espera con este que le hará a su proyecto mejorarlo en condiciones y obtener de el los mejores resultados para así generar una mejor cosecha este próximo año y salir con los pagos del crédito y mejora su estabilidad económica y el bienestar de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Luis, 46, is married living with his daughter and his wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure for his coffee crops and also to pay labor costs.  He has a field already planted with coffee and needs good assistance for it this year which is why he opted for the loan.  He wants to improve his coffee plantation because last year it was greatly deteriorated.  He hopes that with it he’ll be able to improve its conditions and get better results from it so that next year his harvest will be better and he will be able to make his loan payments and improve his economic stability and his family’s wellbeing.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR gave him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. Sarah is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and cows for her meat vending business.

Sarah has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and cows for her meat vending business.

loans.name: Jenny Maria

texts.es:
A sus 28 años, Jenny es una mujer que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y verduras, actualmente ella vive en la ciudad de Nazca, lugar árido y caluroso, conocida a nivel nacional, por sus maravillosas líneas impresas en el sueño, Hechas de piedra, en forma de animales y aún no se ha identificado el creador de las mismas.

Jenny tiene su negocio propio desde hace 2 años, gana aproximadamente S/. 32 diarios, lo que le permite asumir todos los gastos necesarios para su bebé, su esposo es chofer en la ciudad de nazca y esto les ayuda a tener ingresos adicionales para poder brindarse, casa vez más, una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa y que este a su vez sea rentable, también desea brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es por eso que gracias al préstamo Kiva, ella podrá mejorar algunas habitaciones poniéndole falso piso y también comprará esteras para poder arreglar su negocio, lo que le permitirá brindarle una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
At 28 years old, Jenny is a woman who makes a living selling groceries and vegetables. She currently lives in the city of Nazca, an arid and hot place known throughout the country for the amazing lines on the ground. They are made of rocks in the form of animals. As of yet they have been unable to identify their creators.

Jenny has had her own business for two years. She makes about 32 PEN each day, which allows her to take on all of the necessary costs for her baby. Her husband is a driver in the city of Nazca and this gives them some extra income so that they can give their child a better life, little by little.

Her dream is to be able to build a house and that her business continues to be profitable. She also wants to provide the best for her family. That is why, thanks to the Kiva loan, she will be able to improve a few rooms, putting in flooring. She will also buy straw mats to fix up her business, which will allow her to provide better quality service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy straw mats for her store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, 29 years old, is married and has two children aged 6 and 12. She owns a green grocery store where she sells sweet potatoes, carrots and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years. Her other source of income is from farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Lucy has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business to wholesale in the future. Lucy has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy sweet potatoes, carrots and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy sweet potatoes, carrots and vegetables

loans.name: Honorine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. Honorine, la représentante du groupe (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Honorine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Honorine vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis une environ trente ans. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Honorine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur fonds de roulement et à mieux satisfaire leur clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et des condiments.

loans.name: Bubandi 111 Kahimbi Group

texts.en:
Teddy who lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda is a hardworking married woman,dealing in cocoa seeds buying and selling. She got involved in the businesses to earn income and meet increasing family demands. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business. 

Teddy has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa seeds for drying and resale to her customers.
She is a member of Bubandi 111 kahimbi group where members guarantee one another for a loan.

loans.use: To buy cocoa seeds for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen owns a shop where she makes ceramic decorations. She learned how to work with ceramics from her parents when she was 18. When she got married 10 years ago she and her ex-husband set up the business in her home with the help of her parents who provided the ceramic oven which cost $100 at the time. Slowly she bought the molds for her decorations which became popular in her neighborhood. Now she not only sells ceramics she also teaches others how to make them through her courses. She is seeking investment capital in order to invest in molds and paints for her ceramics. She is anxious to receive the loan so she may improve her business and provide a better living for her 3 children whom she cares for on her own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy molds and materials for ceramic production

loans.name: Liuamaama

texts.en:
Liuamaama A. is a hard-working woman of sixty- eight years of age. Her proposed loan will be used to buy materials to develop the land for growing her farm. She has fourteen children; five have already passed away, and nine are still living. Three of Liuamaama’s children are married, and six children are still in school. Her husband works to maintain their farm in good condition. The family also supports some of their relatives who live with them and help on the farm.

Liuamaama owns a permanent stall in the Public Market where she can sell the products from her farm. She strongly believes in her business and its development.

loans.use: To use as working capital for buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the market

loans.name: Daniel Wafula

texts.en:
Daniel is married with three children. He has not undergone any formal training, although he has attended seminars for youth groups, where he was taught measurers of poverty eradication. He runs a food kiosk in his local area but also sells firewood to supplement his income. He also supplies some local schools with firewood.

With the loan of $150 from PEMCI he intends to expand his firewood business and also increase his stock. Recommended for support by PEMCI partners.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Zamin

texts.en:
Zamin is 23 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Kalbadjar region, Almalig village. This single man is settled in the Khirdalan settlement.

Zamin has a lorry. He sells building materials with his lorry. He has been in this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to do capital repairs on his lorry to improve his business.

loans.use: To do capital repairs of his lorry

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa lives on Avenue Luis Espinal in an area called Villa Ingenio in the city of El Alto Bolivia. She has three children. Her husband recently left them, and so Rosa has started to sell fruit juices and soft drinks from her house. The loan she is asking for is to buy more drinks and refreshments for her business, so that she can improve the economic situation of her family. This is her first loan with Impro, and the evaluation they did showed she is qualified to receive the money.

Rosa vive en la Avenida Luís Espinal de la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene tres hijos, su esposo recientemente hizo abandono del hogar, por lo cual Rosa se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas, refrescos, etc. en la puerta de su domicilio. El crédito que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de mercadería (frutas y refrescos) para su negocio y así mejorar los ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a single mother aged thirty three with one daughter of eight. She stays in a one-room house. She operates a retail shop where she sells a variety of household commodities like sugar, salt, curry powder, maize flour, rice, sweets, biscuits and drinks. Joyce has been running this business for the last five years. It is her sole source of income and covers the rent and food for the family plus school fees for her daughter, who is in primary level. She would like to borrow $900 to buy more stock to increase her income. This will be an assurance of a meal every day and other basic needs.

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Asr Group

texts.en:
Shafoat is leader of the ASR group. She is married and has 5 children. She has been in business for over 10 years. She has an education as designer. She has her own workshop where she has several assistants. With one of them (her best friend, Hursheda) she decided to take a loan from Microinvest in 2004. (Shafoat is on the right and Hursheda is on the left.) Hursheda has talent as good designer, but her family condition was hard and she could not get higher education. Shafoat took her into her workshop and taught her all she knows.

Today they both are active clients of Microinvest and their business is developing every day. With their KIVA loan, they want to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: Buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Fabiana's Group

texts.es:
Fabiana, Teresa y Lucila have been part of the Communal Bank Urpicha (a Quechua term meaning little bird) for 9, 2, and 1 years respectively. Fabiana tells us that she is the founder of the Communal Bank. All three say that thanks to the training offered by the Communal Bank they have learned to be responsible, to save money, and to educate their children with love and affection. They also mentioned that thanks to the savings they have collected in their Communal Bank they have accomplished many things such as building a house and educating their children.

Fabiana is 49 years old, has 5 children, and sells fruits from a walking cart in the Nery García market. She has been working in this business for five years. Her desire is to change her business and start a grocery store in her house. Teresa is 41, has 7 children, and sells fruit by walking through the city center of Ayacucho. She has been in this business for 25 years. Lucila is 44 years old, she has 5 children, and she has been operating a grocery store located in her home for the past 3 years.

The women need loans of 400 soles, 600 soles, and 600 soles respectively, which they will invest in the purchase of mangos, peaches, bananas, papayas, pineapples, cucumbers, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil. Their earnings will be used to construct a house, start a new business, and educate their children. The dreams of Fabiana, Teresa and Lucila are that their children will be professionals, that they will be able to start a new grocery business, that they will be able to own their own homes, and that they will maintain good health and be able to live in harmony with their spouses.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Fabiana, Teresa y Lucila pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urpicha (palabra quechua que significa Pajarito), desde hace 9, 2 y 1 años respectivamente. Fabiana nos cuenta que es la fundadora del Banco Comunal. Ellas cuentan que gracias a las capacitaciones en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, a ahorrar, a educar a los hijos con cariño y amor. También mencionaron que gracias a los ahorros que pudieron reunir en su Banco Comunal hicieron muchas cosas como construir su casa y educar a sus hijos. Fabiana tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, y vende frutas en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años. Su deseo es cambiar de negocio e implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Teresa tiene 41 años y 7 hijos y vende frutas caminando por las calles céntricas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 años. Lucila tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, y tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 3 años y está ubicado en su casa. Ellas necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de mango, durazno, plátano, papaya, piña, pepino, arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche, aceite. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en la construcción de su casa, iniciar un nuevo negocio y la educación de los hijos. Los sueños de Fabiana, Teresa y Lucila son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un nuevo negocio de venta de abarrotes, tener una casa propia, estar bien de salud y vivir bien en armonía con el esposo.

loans.use: For the purchase of mangos, peaches, bananas, papayas, pineapples, cucumbers, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Nelly Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelly S. is a very hardworking person who has been selling different styles of shoes and apparel in León, Nicaragua for 30 long years. She has two children to support. Her wish and the reason for all her efforts is to be able to save enough money to allow her children to both study and eventually attend college.

She started her business in a shabby business space, but little by little she has been investing in her business, ultimately buying shelves on which to place her shoes and apparel. It is important to stress that 3 years ago, Nelly started receiving loans from Ceprodel, loans that she has directly invested in the expansion of her business, the purchase of greater quantities of merchandise from her suppliers, and stocking up her business with the latest style of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Nelly S. es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desde hace 30 largos años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de todo estilo en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Es madre de dos hijos a los que tiene que mantener ya que su anhelo y el motivo de sus esfuerzos es para ahorrar para que sus hijos puedan estudiar e ir a la universidad.

Su negocio lo inició con un local en mal estado por lo que poco a poco ha venido invirtiendo en su negocio hasta comprar estantes donde colocar los calzados y la ropa. Es necesario destacar que desde hace 3 años la señora Nelly ha sido beneficiada con créditos en Ceprodel los que los ha invertido directamente en la ampliación de su negocio comprando mayores cantidades de ropa a sus proveedores y surtiendo su negocio con nuevos estilos de calzados.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Wakaliga A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rehema M.. She is currently in the business of selling scrap and is requesting a loan to boost business. Rehema is 42 years old and is a widow. She has 8 children ranging from age 14 to 32 and four of her children go to school. Each week, Rehema makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the rent and educate her children. Rehema has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX in order to expand her scrap business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rehema is joined in her small group by Daua N., Sarah S., Farida N., and Agnes K.. Daua N. has a business selling drugs and wants to add to the business. Sarah S. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Farida N. operates a business selling scrap and wants to increase inventory. Agnes K. is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase brooder warmers.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of scrap sold

loans.name: Ivan Elioth

texts.es:
Iván is a contractor and installs wood floors. He has a business called "Floors and More". He is married to Berenice Luna Hernández and they have two sons: Brayan is 4 years old and Alexis is 5 months.

In April 2000 he opened his own business installing tile and wood floors so that he could have enough income to be able to support his family. As he acquired experience the business improved; today he has a broad clientele and is recognized within his community.

He needs a loan of US $750, which he is willing to repay in 6 months, for two purposes. The first is that many of his clients have had to pay for transportation of materials, so he has decided to offer this service free of charge in order to increase his clientele and increase his income. The second purpose is to buy a portable electrical generator which will be used in new residential developments that do not yet have electricity installed, so that he can use all his tools and equipment. Iván hopes that with your contributions he will have the loan he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Iván I. es contratista e instalador de pisos de madera tiene un negocio llamado “Pisos y Mas” esta casado con la Sra. Berenice Luna Hernández y tiene dos hijos Brayan de 4 años y Alexis de 5 meses

En abril de 2000, abrió su propio negocio, para así obtener ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, instalando pisos de cerámica y madera, adquiriendo experiencia, se fue perfeccionando hasta la actualidad, en la cual cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes y reconocimiento en su localidad.

Requiere un crédito por US $750 que esta dispuesto a pagar en 6 meses, este tiene una doble finalidad la primera nació ya que muchos de sus clientes pagaban flete para el envió de los materiales, entonces el decidió dar este servicio gratis, para así tener mayor clientela y conseguir mayores ingresos, y la segunda para comprar una planta de luz portátil, esta la utilizara en los fraccionamientos nuevos que no cuentan con servicio de luz instalada en el domicilio, y así poder usar sus herramientas de corte. Iván espera ser favorecido con tus contribuciones y lograr el total del crédito que necesita.

loans.use: Buy equipment for work.

loans.name: Janet Ntege`s Group

texts.en:
Janet is the leader of a group of five women. She is 35 years of age and married with three children, all of whom are in school, aged 16, 14, and 7 years. The community she lives in is semi-urban.
Her main challenges are the hazards of the weather because she conducts her business of paper sales from a verandah in Kampala’s city center.  Otherwise, there is a ready market for her products.  Janet has paid back more than 10 loans which she has used for paying school dues, increasing stock and contributing to the welfare of the family.  

Her biggest plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: Her biggest plan is to educate all her children.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza started her business to help her husband with the family expenses, since they needed to pay for the education of their children and buy their own house, because they wanted to leave a legacy to their children. She started her business 8 years ago. The idea came to her that she lived on a street with many businesses who purchased items in her husband's store and wanted food for sale. This made her decide to start a business in that location. She started a market for selling food.

She needs a loan of $600, which will be repaid in 6 months, to remodel her business and in this way achieve growth.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenza inició el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de su familia ya que necesitaban solventar los estudios de sus hijos y comprar una casa propia, porque deseaban dejarle un patrimonio a sus 3 hijos. Comenzó hace 8 años su negocio, le surgio la idea ya que vive en una avenida y hay muchos negocios a su alrededor, los cuales compran en la tienda de su esposo, y le pedian comida en venta por loq ue decidio poner un negocio de este giro, ademas de instalarse en un mercado con la venta de comida.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio y asi logar su crecimiento.

loans.use: To remodel her food sale business.

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Ay S. O. raises pigs near her house. She has been raising pigs for five years and earns about $3.20 per day. Her husband provides battery-charging services to people who use rechargeable car batteries in his village. People in rural villages in Cambodia use these rechargeable batteries as a modest means to power their homes. He makes about $2.80 per day from providing this service. 

Because of an increase in customers, his machine cannot support the demand for battery-charging services. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of $500 for husband to purchase a dynamo and increase the power output of his battery-charging machine. The picture is of Mrs. O.'s husband.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase equipment to increase the output of his battery-charging machine

loans.name: Halissatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Halissatou I. E. D. was born on October 13, 1964 in Bafilo in the Assoli prefecture in northern Togo. She is married and has three children. She is a seamstress and also sells handbags and shoes in Lomé’s Agoè Cacavéli neighborhood. She has previously received a loan and repaid it in full. She is requesting a second loan in order to buy an embroidery machine, 40 handbags and 25 pairs of shoes. This will enable her to increase her stock levels and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame I. E. D. Halissatou est née le 13 octobre 1964 à Bafilo dans la préfecture d’Assoli au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et a trois enfants. Elle est couturière et fait également le commerce de sacs de sortie et de chaussure dans le quartier d’Agoè Cacavéli à Lomé. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter une machine de broderie, 40 sacs de sortie et 25 paires de chaussures. Ceci lui permettra de réhausser le niveau de son stock et de mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use: To buy handbags and shoes

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
The Mujeres Unidas ("Women United") committee was formed when the leaders of the neighborhood commission invited them to form it. The committee now has 16 members and it was one of the first committees set up in the city of Luque. It's now in the ninth cycle of the program.

- Bertilda Centurion will invest in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pull-overs.

- Mary Liz G. de Tullo will invest in the purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Estela Mary C. will invest inthe purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Digna Carolina Bogarin will invest in the purchase of herbal medicines.

- Ana Maria L. will invest in the purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Azucena de Maria A. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Justina B. de Baez will invest in the purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Luz Bella A. de Bogado will invest in the purchase of perfumes.

- Maria Librada C. will invest in the purchase of meat, plates for empanadas, vegetables, cooking oil, napkins, among other things.

- Carmen M. Ojeda will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Maria Concepcion G. will invest in the purchase of herbal medicines, meat, plates for empanadas, vegetables, cooking oil, napkins, among other things.

- Angela Beatriz V. de Chavez will invest in the purchase of meat, plates for empanadas, vegetables, cooking oil, napkins, among other things.

- Zunilda Z. G. will invest in the purchase of apples, oranges, tangerines, pears, peaches.

- Fidelina G. will invest in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pull-overs.
