- Maria Lozanta G. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Maria Graciela G. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El comité Mujeres Unidas se formó mediante que los dirigentes de la comisión del barrio realizaron la invitación a las vecinas para formar el comité. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 16 integrantes, fue uno de los primeros comités formados en la ciudad de Luque y ahora se encuentran en el noveno ciclo del programa.

- Bertilda C. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, camperas.

- Mary Liz González de Tullo invertirá en la compra de harina, arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Estela Mary C. invertirá en la compra de harina, arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Digna Carolina B. invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales.

- Ana María L. invertirá en la compra de harina, arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Azucena de María Arévalos invertirá en la compra de carbón.

- Justina B. de Báez invertirá en la compra de harina, arróz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Luz Bella A. de Bogado invertirá en la compra de perfumes.

- María Librada C. invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, servilletas, entre otros.

- Carmen M. Ojeda invertirá en la compra de carbón.

- María Concepción González invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales, carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, servilletas, entre otros.

- Ángela Beatriz V. de Chávez invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, servilletas, entre otros.

- Zunilda Z. G. invertirá en la compra de manzanas, naranjas, mandarinas, peras, durazno.

- Fidelina González invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, camperas.

- María Lozanta G. invertirá en la compra de carbón.

- María Graciela G. invertirá en la compra de carbón.

loans.use: Miscellaneous businesses: Buy products for resale and/or buy supplies for making products for sale.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer C (New Dawn C) Group is made up of eleven women and one man who live in the Ciudad Satélite neighborhood, near Cotel Plaza and Cívica Ave in the city of El Alto, Bolivia.

The group is led by its president, secretary and treasurer: Rosa Marlene Unzueta, Nelson Corrales Soliz and Maria Teresa T. G.. The people that make up this group are involved in a variety of different businesses, including selling jewelry, deodorant, clothing, cosmetics, meat, appliances and fruit. Others work as secretaries, graphic designers, and beauty salon attendants. About half of the group has between one and three years of experience in their respective businesses, while the rest of the group has 10 to 20 years of experience (except for Gloria, who has been selling clothing for 35 years!).

This group completed its second loan cycle without any problems, so they were able to continue onto their third cycle. The group's makeup is a little bit different in this cycle, since some people had to leave the group because they were traveling. Still, the prospects for the new members look good; they are a very humble and responsible group of people. The group is certain that the loan they will receive from our institution will allow them to improve and expand their businesses.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal denominado NUEVO AMANECER C, esta conformado por señoras que en su mayoría radican en la Ciudad Satelite por inmediaciones de la Plaza COTEL y la Av. Cívica de la Ciudad de El Alto. La mesa directiva esta conformada por la Sra. Rosa Marlene Unzueta, Nelson Corrales Soliz y Maria Teresa T.; las personas que componen este grupo se dedican principalmente a la comercialización de joyas, desodorantes, ropa, frutas y otros. Este grupo culmino su segundo ciclo sin ningún problema, motivo por el cual se le otorgara el tercer ciclo, se reorganizo debido a que algunas personas ya no participaran por motivo de viaje sin embargo se tiene buenas perspectivas de las socias nuevas, ellas son un grupo de personas muy humildes y responsables; están muy seguras de que el crédito que les ofrece la institución les facilitara el mejoramiento y crecimiento de sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy bulk merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua D. is a 26-year-old woman and is married with three kids, who currently attend school. Akosua works very hard to provide food for herself and her children.  She has four years of experience dealing in goods such as ladies bags, shoes, materials and other footwear in a market center at Obuasi Ghana. She believes that with her good human relations and her proximity to the market area, the loan would help her to purchase the right quantity of goods demanded by her loyal customers. She says that this would help her make more profit to expand her business and also finance her kids' education. Akosua is a member of Trust Group called St John. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy more women's shoes, bags, slippers and materials.

loans.name: Sobhieh

texts.en:
Sobhieh is a 57-year-old widow who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her only child. 

Sobhieh owns a small shop where she bakes “markouk,” a traditional Lebanese flatbread. Markouk is a type of thin bread that is baked on a domed or convex metal griddle known as a "saj." It is usually large, about 2 feet long, and thin. Similar to the procedures for making other flatbreads, the dough of saj bread is flattened and kept very thin prior to cooking, resulting in a very slender depth to this bread. 

She has requested a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for cooking her bread. She also needs the loan to help her family expenses.

Sobhieh is known for her good quality bread and her low prices. Actually, she is the cheapest in her area. Her shop is well-positioned, because her clients are her neighbors and students, and she is near a school.

When she first started her business, she faced some difficulties because there was a lot of competition between her and other producers of markouk. The competition didn’t allow her to sell as much markouk as she expected, but now she found the solution by lowering her prices.
 
Sobhieh is an active woman. She started her business after her husband's death so that she can support her family and make a living.

loans.use: Sobhieh will use the loan to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy tiene 35 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus  tres hijos. Todas las mañanas de los días feriados y de fiestas sale muy temprano a vender  sus productos de limpieza, en especial de cocina, siendo su clientela señoras amas de casa, esta actividad la realiza por más de 10 años, y gracias a que en las ferias  la concurrencia de personas es bastante favorable, puede  vender  mayor cantidad de productos en un solo día, lo que hace de su actividad  algo rentable. Lo difícil es salir muy de mañana y caminar cuadras tras cuadras ofreciendo sus productos, con el fin de poder vender al máximo su mercadería. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. El deseo de Susy es vender en un lugar propio, por ello desea invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos e incrementar sus ingresos y ahorros, para conseguir el monto necesario para su local propio.
texts.en:
Susy is 35 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their three children. In the morning on market days and holidays she leaves very early to sell cleaning products, mostly products for the kitchen. Most of her customers are women who are housewives. She has been doing this for more than 10 years and thanks to the fact that the markets are crowded with people, she can sell a large amount of her products in just one day, making her job somewhat profitable. The difficult part is leaving very early and walking for blocks and blocks offering her products in order to sell the maximum amount of her merchandise. This is her first loan with MFP. Susy would like to sell in her own place in the market. She would like to invest in a larger amount of products and increase her earnings and savings in order to save enough for her own space.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products to sell

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. H., 34, earns income growing rice crops and raising pigs for sale in Rumlich Village, Pursat Province. She lives with her husband and two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend primary school. Mrs. H.'s rice farming business is the family's main source of income. Both she and her husband work hard every day. 
The family's house is old, and Mrs. H. would like to build a new one. She managed to save money and buy some of the necessary wood for building the house. However, she needs a loan to be able to purchase wood to finish the building.

loans.use: Purchase of wood to build a house

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương năm nay 44 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và ba con tại huyện Ý  Yên tỉnh  Nam Định. Trước khi tham gia quỹ tình thương  thu nhập của gia đình chị Phương chủ yếu là từ thu mua phế liệu.  Năm 1998 chị Phương đã tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá và chăn nuôi cá. Công việc phát triển tốt và đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định. Hiện tại bên cạnh thu nhập từ buôn bán và  nuôi cá gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ việc đi đúc đồng thuê của chồng với tổng thu  nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu  tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa và mua cá giống về nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Phương, 44 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ý Yên district, Nam Định province. Before she became a member of the TYM Fund, her family’s income came mainly from collecting scrap materials. In 1998, she joined the Fund and used a loan to start a small grocery shop and a fish farming enterprise. The operations have thrived and now provide her family with a steady income. Currently, in addition to the family businesses selling groceries and raising fish, her husband also earns wages working in a bronze casting business. The family income averages about 4,000,000 VND (240 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (900 USD) to invest in her grocery shop and to buy fish to stock her fish farming operation.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop, Fish farming

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapegua distante a 1km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa . 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas son Artesanas,vendedoras,modista,peluqueras y otras actividades ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida .
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

Este grupo tiene 15 integrantes en total, pero en este ciclo solo 14 solicitaron un prestamo.  La lista abajo incluye todos los integrantes.

Luciana  B.	Artesana
Rosa J. 	Alquiler de sillas
Maria B.	Vendedora
Rafaela C.	Artesana
Ma-Estela S.   	Empleada 
Valeriana M.(NO ESTA EN LA FOTO)	Tejedora
Jacinta Paredes (NO ESTA EN LA FOTO)	Vta. de Alfareria
Ma-Francisca B.     	vendedora
Nerlis B. 	Empleada
Celsa R.	Empleada
Ma-Bernardita S.	Venta de queso
Sila B. 	Tejedora
Mirian C.	Peluquera
Lidia C.	Modista
Suny B.	Tejedora
texts.en:
One kilometer from the Carapeguá office in Carapeguá, several women with low income found out about Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepeneur's Committee) and decided to get together to receive information about the aforementioned program. These women are economically active. The majority are artisans, merchants, confectioners, hair stylists, or are involved in the activities mentioned on this page. They seek a little more support through credit in order to increase their income and improve their quality of life. They need this loan to invest in their respective jobs and thus achieve a common and individual sustainable growth. This group has 15 total members but in this cycle only 14 asked for a loan. The list below includes all the group's members. Luciana B. Artisan Rosa J. Chair rentals Maria B. Merchant Rafaela C. Artisan Maria Estela S. Employee Valeriana M. (Not pictured) Seamstress Jacinta Paredes (Not pictured) Pottery sales Ma-Francisca B. Merchant Nerlis B. Employee Celsa R. Employee Maria Bernardita S. Cheese sales Sila B. Seamstress Mirian C. Hair stylist Lidia C. Clothing designer Suny B. Seamstress

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The majority of Comité's members invested their credits in their current activities as described above (clothes, rags, thread, shampoo, conditioner, etc.)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita, nació en el distrito de Saylla de la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 45 minutos de la misma ciudad en auto, carretera asfaltada.

Ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada; tiene 7 hijos, 6 de ellos mayores e independientes, ella aún vive con su menor hijo de 16 años y aún ella lo educa, nuestra socia  actualmente lleva a la ciudad de Puno fruta para vender y este viaje es muy pesado para ella, por lo que la socia desea comprar un pequeño terreno en el distrito de Saylla, para poder poner su negocio de venta de chicharrones (plato típico a base de chancho acompañado con papa doradas, choclo y ensalada).

La socia está muy feliz y agradecida con el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y está comprometida a pagar el total de la deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The member Margarita was born in the Saylla district in the province of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco by car via paved highway.

She is 49 years of age and is married. She has 7 children. 6 of them are adults and independent. She still lives with her youngest son who is 16 years old and even though she is educating him, our member currently brings fruit to the city of Puno to sell and this trip is very difficult for her. This is why this member wants to buy a small piece of property in the district of Saylla to be able to open her business selling "chicharrones" (a typical pork-based dish accompanied by golden potatoes, corn, and salad).

This member is very happy and grateful for the provision of the loan and promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a small plot of land

loans.name: Ni Nengah Karsini

texts.id:
Setelah berjalan 6 bulan, kini Ni Nengah Karsini sudah menyelesaikan pinjamannya di DINARI untuk tahap yang pertama. Pinjaman tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli induk babi dan pakan. Dari pinjaman yang pertama Ni Nengah Karsini kini memiliki 1 ekor induk babi. Dari 1 ekor induk babi ini Ni Nengah Karsini mendapatkan 8 ekor anak babi yang baru berusia kira - kira 17 hari. Anak babi ini baru bisa dijual jika sudah berumur kurang lebih 30 hari. Dari 1 ekor anak babi ini Ni Nengah Karsini bisa mendapatkan keuntungan kurang lebih Rp. 50.000,- Jadi dari 8 ekor anak babi yang Ni Nengah Karsini miliki, nantinya Dia akan memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 400.000,-
Ni Nengah Karsini berniat menambah induk babinya. Namun modal yang Dia punya belum mencukupi harga 1 ekor induk babi. Untuk itu Ni Nengah Karsini mengikuti program ternak babi yang ada di DINARI lagi. Pinjaman kedua ini dipergunakan untuk membeli induk babi, agar hasil yang Dia peroleh dari memelihara induk babi ini semakin besar. Ni Nengah Karsini juga berharap dapat terus membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Karsini completed her 1st loan with Dinari in a 6 month period. She used the loan to buy breeding pig and pig feed. This breeding pig produced 8 piglets. They are around 2 weeks old at the moment. She will be able to sell these piglet when they are one month old. She can earn a profit of USD 4.4 / piglet, so in total she will earn USD 35.2.

Ni Nengah Karsini is planning to buy another breeding pig, therefore she is participating in another Dinari loan program. She is hoping to earn more money with 2 breeding pigs so she can help the family's economy.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a breeding pig

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She sells touch lights. She started this business in 2006. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more touch lights to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more touch lights to sell

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Mrs. Marietta O. has been a member of Paglaum Coop for almost three years. Residing at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, she is married and blessed with two children.

Marietta is currently obtaining her 5th loan for her sari-sari (general) store to buy additional stock. She wishes and hopes that her children will able to finish their studies until college and someday will be able to find a stable job.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana P. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has two children – a daughter and a son. She says her children are currently in junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Her husband is a trader. Juliana is also a trader. She buys all kinds and sizes of wood from saw mills in her community. She sells to carpenters and wood workers. Juliana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure wood in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to pay for a higher education for her children.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 35 years old. Elmar is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elmar operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elmar has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elmar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Elmar is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Elmar from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 38 años, vive con sus hijos: Valeria de 15 y Jerri de 6 años, ya que su hijo mayor, Walter de 39 ya vive fuera de casa. Siempre le ha llamado la atención el arte culinario, es por eso que decidió trabajar en este rubro vendiendo salchipapas, que no es otra cosa que papas y salchichas fritas acompañadas con mostaza, mayonesa y salsa de tomate. Cristina realiza esta actividad de 7 a 10 de la noche, ya que el día lo ocupa en las labores de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. La venta es buena, ya que la sazón que le pone Cristina a sus salchipapas no tiene comparación, siendo el puesto que tiene afuera de su casa muy visitado, la clientela siempre se va con una sonrisa, después de deleitarse con este delicioso platillo. En el futuro le gustaría tener un espacio dentro de su casa donde ofrecer con mayor comodidad sus salchipapas y así ganar más clientes y por ende más clientela. Este es su préstamo 16 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos y le gusta mucho su grupo de trabajo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de platitos descartables, bancas e ingredientes al por mayor preparar las salchipapas.
texts.en:
Cristina, 38, lives with her children, Valerie, 15; and Jerri, 6. Her oldest son, Walter, 19, lives away from home. The culinary arts have always interested her. That is why she decided to work with food by selling “salchipapas”. They are nothing more than potatoes and fried sausages with mustard, mayonnaise, and tomato sauce. Cristina sells from seven until ten at night. In the daytime she is busy with household chores and taking care of her children. Sales are good because the way Cristina seasons her salchipapas is beyond comparison. The stand she has outside of her house is well frequented. Her customers always leave with a smile after enjoying this delicious dish. In the future she would like to have a space inside of her house where she could offer her salchipapas more comfortably. That way she would gain more customers. This is her 16th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always been very punctual in her payments. She likes the way her group works. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy more disposable plates, benches, and wholesale ingredients to make the salchipapas.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and equipment for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. lives in the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old, married and has six  adult-aged children. Gloria makes a living by running a small sari-sari or general store where she makes most of her income selling items such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Gloria has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans, which she used to buy more products to sell. Gloria has applied for a new loan to expand the number of products available in her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fagalele

texts.en:
Fagalele K. is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiafai. She is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Fagalele owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Fagalele has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fagalele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fagalele has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Fagalele is now requesting a new loan of 1100 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the second loan she has taken out from SPBD. Fagalele plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and/or expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert A. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 32 years old. Herbert is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Herbert operates a business of running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products and a variety of viands (tasty dishes or snacks) in the local community. Herbert is just starting this business.

In 2009, Herbert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herbert is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Herbert from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business and to meet the basic needs of his family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is twenty-five years old. She is single and has no child. She lives alone in a rented apartment in Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Grace is a seamstress by profession. She designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has a workshop by the roadside in her community. She says she has three apprentices under training.

Grace has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy textile materials and other sewing accessories in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Antonio C. es padre de familia y tiene un hijo pequeño de edad a quien le quiere dar lo mejor.
Con dos créditos anteriores que atenido con KIVA ha construido un cuarto pero le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto y los acabados para terminar el cuarto que será para su niño. Es por eso que nueva mente esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo préstamo y así terminar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como técnico en una fabrica.

loans.use: Elaboración del piso de concreto y enjarres

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose J. is currently in the business of selling ice cream and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge for making more ice cream to sell.  Rose is 26 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant in the Heineken company. They have 5 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Rose hopes to be able to open up a shop. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es: Reyes C. D. C. vive en el departamento de San Salvador con su familia, que la compone su esposa, quien trabaja como costurera y sus dos hijas. A sus 60 años de edad, Reyes sigue siendo el mismo hombre luchador y visionario en sus negocios, el es propietario de un bus y microbús, los cuales circulan en las calles de El Salvador, con rutas de destino ya estipuladas, para Reyes ha sido un gran logro tener sus propias unidades de transporte colectivo, que ahora le generan los ingresos con lo que sostiene a su familia, el solita de un crédito para la compra de llantas de su bus, las cuales ya son necesarias por el degaste que presentan.
texts.en:
Reyes C. D. C. lives in the department of San Salvador with his wife, who works as a seamstress, and their two daughters. He is 60 years old and still fights and has aspirations for his business. He owns both a bus and a minibus that circulate through the streets of El Salvador. Reyes establishes the destinations and routes for his vehicles and has managed both of them successfully in order to earn income for his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase tires for his bus since they have degraded over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new tires for his bus

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana G. M. is a married Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a clothing store at Tabata – Kimanga district in Dar es Salaam.  She sells different types of clothes to customers for men and women, youth and children. She first purchases the clothes from the wholesale and retail shops at Kariakoo city market and Karume city market. She needs a loan of 800,000 TZS to buy more goods to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Noa Johane

texts.pt:
Noa Johane M. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 54 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 18, 16 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Matola rio e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Chibuto para Matola – rio em 1962 com seus pais transferidos pelos serviços. Tem um negocio próprio ha mais de 15 anos, trabalha com sua esposa cerca de 10 horas por dia. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 13.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 11.500.00com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, arroz, açúcar, bebidas e outros) para reforçar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro de forma a melhorar e diversificar cada vez mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Noa Johane M. was born in the district of Chibuto in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is 54; married; and the father of 3 children who are 18, 16, and 11. All of them are in school. He studied through 7th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family in the Matola neighborhood and doesn't support anyone besides them. He left Chibuto for Matola in 1962 with his parents when they were transferred here. He has had his own business for more than 15 years. He works with his wife for close to 10 hours a day. He makes a monthly income of about 13,000 meticais and applies it to his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his neighbor who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan in the amount of 11,500 meticais, and he will use it to buy products (oleo, rice, sugar, drinks, etc.) to strengthen his quantity of merchandise. He promises to pay back this loan on time so he will be able to receive more credits in the future. He will use them to improve and diversify his business more and more.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell beer, rice, flour, and other food products.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Khoeurn L., a longtime farmer, lives in the province of Siem Reap. She plants various crops on her own land next to her house. Khoeurn L. is a married woman and a mother, currently residing with her husband. All four of her children are married and live independently, while her husband helps to feed his family by working in construction. Khoeurn L. has harvested and sold her mature crop and she hopes to replant her crop but she lacks money and is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Fagbemi

texts.en: Fagbemi is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells foodstuffs at retail prices to his customers in the market in Ibadan, Oyo State.  He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes to expand his business. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Am's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Am I. is the village bank president who was selected by the members, who will use the loan for different purposes. The village bank loan, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Thlok Damnak Luong village in Takeo province.

Mr. Am I. is 61 years old. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a livI.. His wife, Mrs. Oem Mom, owns a small restaurant in the local market. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their livI. conditions, Mr. Am I. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start a new breedI. business. He is the father of three children, two of whom are waiters while the youngest one attends the local school. All the members are shown in the photo but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: El Hadji Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur Gora G. est  un jeune pêcheur de 27 ans qui habite a Yoff Ndeugagne.Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-Imcec Yoff depuis décembre 2007.Il exerce la pêche depuis 10 ans entre la localité de Yoff et de Kayes. C’est une activité qu’elle a hérité de ses parents pêcheurs  mais qui le passionne beaucoup aussi. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 et 8 ans. Son plus grand moment de bonheur est lorsqu’il attrape beaucoup de poissons. Monsieur Gning sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour l’achat d’un matériel de plongeon, d’une bouteille a air et d’un ensemble plongeur. L’augmentation de ses profits lui permet de garantir l’alimentation de sa famille et d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Monsieur Gora G. is a young fisherman (age 27) who lives in Yoff Ndeugagne. He has been a member of the l’U-Imcec Yoff bank since December 2007. For ten years, he has been fishing in the area between Yoff and Kayes. He was raised in a family of fisherman, and loves his profession. His happiest moments are when he has a big catch. Monsieur G. is married with two children, who are 6 and 8 years old. With the 300,000 frs loan he has requested, Monsieur G. will purchase diving equipment, including an oxygen tank and a diving suit. Increasing his profits will help guarantee he can feed his family and send his children to school.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase diving equipment

loans.name: Iris Marvely

texts.es:
La joven Iris A. trabaja como asalariada en una escuela que queda en Puerto Morazán un municipio del viejo.
Ella va a utilizar este crédito para remodelación y mejorar su casa en compra de electrodomésticos, y laminas de zinc para reparar el techo. 
Ella ya tiene varios años de trabajar como profesora de primaria y gracias a ello ha podido salir adelante con su familia.
Iris es una joven que no tiene hijos, solo vive con su marido en casa de su familia y ambos trabajan para llevar el sostén al hogar.

La joven nos dijo que el trabajar con CEPRODEL, le ha servido de mucho ya que ha podido mejorar su vivienda y comprar algunos de sus electrodomésticos que ella utiliza en el hogar y que espera seguir trabajando con la Institución ya que le ha brindado la oportunidad de demostrar su responsabilidad, y honestidad dentro del campo laboral como personal.
texts.en:
Iris A. is a salaried employee of a school that is in Puerto Morazán. She will use the funds to remodel and improve her home and to buy appliances. She also needs to buy zinc metal sheeting to repair her roof. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for several years and this has made it possible to get ahead in life with her family. Iris is a young woman who does not have any children; she lives with her husband in her relative's house; both work to support their household. She told us that working with CEPRODEL has been very useful for her because she has been able to improve her home and buy some appliances she uses; she hopes to continue to work with the institution because it has offered her the opportunity to show her responsibility and honesty both in work and personally.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements and to buy appliances.

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo is 45 years old and the mother of four children. She sells cooked food and drinks, and before now she hawked cooked food, but could only sell the little quantity she could carry around. She says thanks to LAPO Microfinance who have made it possible for her to own a shop so she can now sell more of what she used to sell.

Taiwo also sells eggs retail. She supplies eggs to customers at their business place. Presently, she opens her shop every day of the week except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is feeding the children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Taiwo is asking for a loan of NGN 80,000 to enable her to expand her egg business (sold in cardboard crates). This, she said, will enable her to meet the demand of customers in a timely manner. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell
